loans.name: Tedder

texts.en:
Tedder is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, who are all currently in school. For the past 7 years, Tedder has been working hard to manage her school, which provides day care and nursery services. To help expand her business, Tedder has requested for a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to construct more classes, which will help Tedder to generate greater profits and improve on her daily income. Tedder hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand on the school. 




"

loans.use: to construct more classes

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is 40 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Bashir has been working hard to manage his hair dressing saloon. To help expand his business, Bashir has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to buy more relaxers and dryers, which will help Bashir to generate greater profits and cater for all his neccesities. Bashir hopes that in the future, he will be able to build a residential house. 




"

loans.use: to buy more relaxers and dryers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old and lives in the town of Entebbe in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her hardware business, where she sells building materials like cement and iron sheets. To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to buy building materials like cement and iron sheets, which will help Mary to generate greater profits and start up another branch. Mary hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business. 




"

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement and iron sheets

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a 51-year-old single man living in Enrile. He manages a small junk shop buying and selling old newspapers, boxes, jars and bottles. He patiently involved himself in this kind of business to get income. He has been in his business for over 10 years to sustain his family's needs. Jose is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 as additional revolving capital to buy more empty cans, bottles and jars to resell for profits.

Jose hopes to keep improving his income to save funds for use in emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy more empty cans, bottles and jars to resell

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario de 26 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 10, 6 y 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida desde hace 6 años prestando sus servicios domésticos de manera domiciliar, su esposo aporta a la economía familiar gracias a su trabajo en una empresa. Rosario desea construir un muro de contención, además desea construir un cuarto dormitorio por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: cemento, arena y grava, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para la construcción de las mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en: Rosario is 26 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children aged 10, 6 and 2. She is an enterprising woman who has been making a living for the last 6 years offering domestic services in people's houses. Her husband adds to the family economy through his work in a company. Rosario wants to build a retaining wall and a fourth bedroom so she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand and gravel, and also to pay for the labour required to build the improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel, and also to pay for the labour required to build the improvements to her home.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 29 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Rosemary has been working hard to manage her jewelry business, where she sells necklaces, bangles and watches. To help expand her business, Rosemary has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to buy materials to make bangles, which will help Rosemary to generate greater profits and earn income as well as to cater for her basic needs. Rosemary hopes that in the future, she will be able to construct rental houses. 




"

loans.use: to buy materials to make bangles

loans.name: Rita Ester

texts.en:
Rita Ester is 40 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Rita Ester has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, where she rears broiler chickens. To help expand her business, Rita Ester has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to buy poultry feeds and drugs, which will help Rita Ester to generate greater profits and earn income. Rita Ester hopes that in the future, she will be able to construct a big poultry farn. 




"

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and drugs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods and items for the grocery

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Hawa has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household commodities. 

To help expand her business, Hawa has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more household commodities, and will help Hawa to generate greater profits and increase her profit margin. Hawa hopes that, in the future, she will be able to have a big business.

loans.use: to purchase more household commodities

loans.name: Cuong's Group

texts.en:
Cuong is 55 years old and married, with three children. For the past 15 years, he and his wife have been running a general store from the front of his house to earn an income to support his family. 

He is the Group Leader of a four-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, Cuong is wearing a T-shirt. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. 

Cuong is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of products, such as food and beverages, to restock his store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and to attract additional ones. He also hopes that, through his loan, he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties his family may face.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to restock his store.

loans.name: Ofelia Buenaventura

texts.es: Ofelia de 50 años de edad vive con sus 2 hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida como vendedora de fruta, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 25 años en el mercado central. Su esposo tuvo que emigrar al extranjero para tratar de darles una mejor calidad de vida a ella y sus hijos. Ofelia desea construir un camino con gradas para llegar a su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía el actual es inaccesible. Por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: arena, grava y cemento, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para reparar el camino de acceso a su residencia en el cual construirá gradas.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 50 years old and lives with her two children who are 19 and 17 years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman who makes a living as a fruit vendor, which she has done on a traveling basis for 25 years at the central market. Her husband had to emigrate abroad to try to give her and her children a better quality of life. 

Ofelia wants to build a pathway with stairs to reach her home because, as seen in the picture, it is currently inaccessible. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy sand, gravel, and cement, and to pay laborers to repair the access road to her residence.

loans.use: buy sand, gravel, and cement, and to pay laborers to repair the access road to her home.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 38 years old and lives in the town of Abaita in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Pauline has been working hard to manage her stationery shop. 

To help expand her business, Pauline has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy books, reams of paper, pen and pencils, and will help Pauline to generate greater profits and start up another branch. Pauline hopes that, in the future, she will be able to to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy books, reams of paper, pens and pencils

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 20 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells household commodities. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more household commodities, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and have a large profit margin. Joseph hopes that, in the future, he will be able to diversify the business.

loans.use: to purchase more household commodities

loans.name: Larry

texts.en: Larry is 48 years old and married. He is raising his family in a rural community and earns their living through farming. He plants and harvests root crops and various vegetables to sell. Due to financial hardship, he planned to expand his plantation to ensure a high production. Having inadequate capital, he would like to avail himself of a loan of PHP 29,000 to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed to sustain his crop production. Through this loan, Larry believes that he will expand his plantation and have high production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed to sustain his crop production

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Botros

texts.en:
Botros is a single young man, born in 1995. Because of difficult financial conditions, he was forced to leave the intermediate level of school 4 years ago and to start working in an aluminum shop to cover his three family members’ expenses and needs. He was only fifteen years old when he started working.

Botros dreams of opening his own car rental shop business, so he is requesting a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to start his dream and to buy the first car as a first step towards a better future. This loan will help Botros achieve his dream and increase his income, which will help him cover his family’s expenses and save profit for the future.

loans.use: To start his dream by buying the first car for his car rental business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old and lives in the town of Abaita in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, John has been working hard to manage his butcher shop, which sells meat.

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cows, and will help John to generate greater profits and increase the number of customers. John hopes that in the future he will be able to make his business well known.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Nuvy Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nuvy Grace works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and house rentals. Nuvy Grace is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy gasoline and spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle to further build her transport business.

Nuvy Grace successfully repaid her previous loan. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 46 years old and is married. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. She is running a shop selling beverages. She started this shop 22 years ago.

She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of beverages to restock her shop.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Dau

texts.en: Dau, 47, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a worker for a local construction company. Dau has started a beverages shop and has sold cosmetic products for five years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of beverages and cosmetic products to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Easther

texts.en:
Easther is 38 years old and lives in the town of Abaita in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Easther has been working hard to manage her hairdressing salon. 

To help expand her business, Easther has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy hair products and open up a massage section within the salon and will help Easther to generate greater profits and meet daily costs. Easther hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch.

loans.use: buy hair products and open up a massage section within her hairdressing salon

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Lanh, 45, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is running a business selling batteries.

Lanh has been running a stall selling sweet sticky rice, cigarettes and phone cards for fifteen years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of rice, cigarettes and phone cards to stock her stall and to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her child to school.

loans.use: to buy rice, cigarettes and phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji is a single man, born in 1988, and has an intermediate level of education. He left school to help his family cover their living expenses and needs due to their hard financial situation. Three years ago he started working as security in a restaurant. He is a hard worker and has proved to be a decent and responsible man in his domain.

Naji is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, to support his brother in covering some of his marriage expenses. This loan is very important to Naji, as it will help him make his brother’s dream come true. He is looking forward to opening a mobile phone shop of his own in the future and quitting his current job for good.

loans.use: To support his brother in covering some of his marriage expenses

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: María de 34 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos de 14, 12, 8 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que apoya en la economía familiar por medio de la venta de granos básicos  los cuales son cultivados por su compañero de vida, además vende leche de vaca  desde hace  10 años. María acaba de terminar de construir su vivienda pero como se observa en la fotografía esta no cuenta con ventanas, además ella desea encementar el piso de su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso, además deberá comprar dos ventanas y pagar mano de obra necesaria para encementar el piso y colocar las ventanas.
texts.en:
Maria, 34 years old, lives with her life partner and her four children, who are 14, 12, 8, and 3 years old. She is a tenacious woman who supports the family economically by selling basic grains that are grown by her life partner. She has also sold cow milk for ten years. 

Maria just finished building her house, but, as shown in the photograph, it does not have windows. She also wants to cement the floor of her house, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor. She also needs to buy two windows and pay for the labor needed to cement the floor and install the windows.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor and to buy two windows for the house.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: María de 52 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 26 y 19 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo antojitos típicos todos los días, además vende fruta partida para aprovechar su clientela. María desea construir un cuarto para la cocina por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, madera y cemento, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para construir el cuarto para la cocina.
texts.en:
María, age 52, lives with her husband and their two children, ages 26 and 19.  She is an enterprising woman who earns a living selling typical snacks every day.  She also sells sliced fruit to take advantage of customer sales.

María wishes to build a room for the kitchen.  That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI  to buy metal sheeting, wood, and cement.  She also will need to pay for the labor needed to build the room for the kitchen.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, and cement.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Due to financial insufficiency, Michael engages in the hog raising business to have additional income. He is 34 years old and has two schooling children. He planned to acquire more piglets to raise but he doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, he would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders  in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and more piglets to raise. He is hoping that he will be able to avail himself of his loan request to be able to improve his business and give his family a better living.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and more piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely successfully repaid her previous loan, used for buying goods for her retail store. Aside from running her store, Fely was busy taking care of her pig farm business. Fely was looking to augment her family's income, and GDMPC is her partner in growing the business. To improve her pig farm, she took a new loan to purchase feeding supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated as a result of the loan to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: After Maher finished the repayment of the installment of the first loan he received from Kiva lenders, he applied for a second loan of 200,000 YER to purchase more canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and other materials to sell in his store. He warmly thanks Kiva lenders for their first financial support that helped him to increase his business and improve the living standards of his family. He hopes to be financed with this loan. He is a very thankful young man.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and soap to sell in his store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty's group is comprised of hardworking women. Betty is 24 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Betty has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells local brew.

To help expand the business, Betty has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet for the business, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and increase her business and savings. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own.

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more millet for the business,

loans.name: Adilia Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Adilia está muy contenta porque ha avanzado con el muro perimetral de su vivienda el cual logro realizar con el crédito anterior, quien goza de seguridad junto a su familia gracias a sus ingresos de su labor como cocinera y el apoyo de Kiva con Afodenic, ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo que destinara para instalación de servicios higiénicos en el interior de la vivienda mejorando así su entorno.
texts.en:
Adilia is very happy because she has made progress with the wall around her house.  She managed to do it with the previous loan.  She enjoys security with her family thanks to her income from her work as a cook and the support from Kiva and AFODENIC.

She is now requesting a new loan to install a bathroom inside her house.  This way she will be improving her environment.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, cement, sand, pipes, a toilet and its accessories.

loans.name: Vang

texts.en:
Vang, 35, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two sons and her husband. Vang and her husband earn money through their business, selling rice with many kinds of food to people in their community. They stared this business ten years ago. 

Vang would like to get a loan to buy a larger quantity and better quality of rice and raw ingredients to make better meals to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy rice and raw ingredients to make meals for selling

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung, 30, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with two children and her husband. Dung and her husband earn money through her business, selling food and running a general store. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger quantity of food and household items to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have a better future.

loans.use: To buy food and household items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Isma

texts.en:
Isma is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is currently in school. For the past three years, Isma has been working hard to manage her small retail business, where she sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Isma has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soda and water to sell and will help Isma to generate greater profits and increase the size of her business. Isma hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a plot of land. 

Isma is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more soda and water to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Beatrice. She is a passionate farmer from the Kericho area of Kenya, an area famous for tea growing and also home to some of the world’s best long-distance runners; many have won gold medals in international events. Beatrice is the mother of three children and has been involved in mixed farming--that is, planting various varieties of food crops and keeping dairy cows--for the past five years. Although Beatrice makes profits from farming, her crop production is so low and her profit margins are very thin because she lacks good farm inputs. That is why she is gratefully seeking a loan to buy farm inputs.

Beatrice is determined to solve this situation by buying good quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to be used in increasing her crop production. Through the loan Beatrice is going to improve her income level and she will assure her children of a bright and secure future. Beatrice is very visionary, and she projects that with her improved income she will be able to open a shop where she will sell cereals from her farm, and through the accumulated profits, her business will flourish.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a single young man, born in 1996. He was studying at the elementary level in school before he left to work as a furniture painter to help his family of four in covering their living needs.

Today, after gaining seven years of experience in his area, he is requesting a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, in order to open another extra income business that has to do with selling furniture, since his dream is to open a wide showroom in the future. In the meantime, through the acquired loan, he will buy the necessary requested needs to start up and make his dream come true. He will also be able to renovate his family’s house and improve their living conditions.

With this loan Mohammad will be able to plan for a better future, own a business, and increase his income, as he will be able to cover all of his family’s expenses and save some profit for his own life.

loans.use: to open another extra income business selling furniture

loans.name: Chung

texts.en: Chung is requesting a loan to buy more beverages and sugar cane to make juice to sell from her store. Chung's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She hopes that through expanding her business activities, she will increase her income and improve her family's living conditions and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beverages to sell and sugar cane to make juice for selling.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 46 years old, living at Enrile with her family. She relies on income from raising hogs for future sale. She used her income in paying bills at home, meals and school needs. Manuela wanted to raise hogs healthier but had insufficient funds for hog sustenance. So, Manuela is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and rice bran for her hogs. 

She hopes this loan will be given to her and ensures good growth of hogs for better hog sales someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and rice bran for her hogs.

loans.name: Sabel

texts.en: Due to capital insufficiency, Sabel wants to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders through ASKI in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in vegetable production. She and her husband work together in planting and harvesting root crops and vegetables for sale. Through their patience and hard work, they are hoping that someday, they will increase their production and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Jose Raymundo

texts.es: don Raymundo, tiene 40 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de San José de Comayagua, cerca de Taulabe. Anteriormente se dedico al cultivo de maíz, frijol y caña para la venta y consumo. Hace 6 años ha hecho su cultivo de café por ser mas rentable, la producción la vende a los intermediarios de la zona. Ha solicitado el sexto ciclo de préstamo que es por 9,000 Lempiras para comprar 14 sacos de abono y limpiar la finca de café. Su plan es mantener su finca en buen estado para sacar mayor producción y darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Raymundo is 40 years old, lives in a domestic partnership with his wife with whom he has two children, and resides in a town in the San Jose de Comayagua municipality, near Taulabe. He used to make a living growing corn, beans, and cane to sell and consume. Six years ago, he made coffee his crop because it is more profitable. He sells his product to local intermediaries.

He has requested the sixth cycle loan which is for 9,000 Lempiras to buy 14 bags of manure and clean the coffee plantation. His plan is to keep his plantation in good condition to increase production and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy 14 bags of manure and clean up the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Doña Ernestina, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara con su hija y una nieta. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio vendiendo todo tipo de mercadería y hace un año decidio poner su negocio fijo de una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como carnes, lácteos, arroz, manteca, frijoles, productos de limpieza e higiénicos, huevos, pan, churros, refrescos, azúcar, sal, café etc. Ella esta solicitando otro préstamo que es el sexto ciclo y es por 25,000 Lempiras para poder seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y surtir con productos como arroz, azúcar, carnes, refrescos, lácteos, harina, azúcar y otros, con el propósito que su negocio aumente las ventas. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y crecer como persona, ayudando a sus hijos y tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Ernestina is a 48 year old single mother with two children, and lives in the town of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara with her daughter and granddaughter. She has always worked selling different kinds of merchandise, and last year she decided to settle her business in a small grocery store, where she sells food products such as meat, dairy, rice, butter, beans, cleaning and hygienic supplies, eggs, bread, churros, drinks, sugar, salt, coffee etc. 

She is requesting another loan in the sixth cycle, for 25,000 Lempiras, to continue investing in her business and stock her inventory with products such as rice, sugar, meat, drinks, milk, flour, sugar and more, aiming to improve sales. Her goal is to grow the business and as a person, helping her children to have a better life.

loans.use: stock her store's inventory with products such as rice, sugar, meat, drinks, milk, flour, sugar and more.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is 38 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, John Bosco has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soft drinks, bread, sugar, posho (similar to polenta), and juice. 

To help expand his business, John Bosco has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more soft drinks, bread, sugar, posho, and juice, and it will help John Bosco to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. John Bosco hopes that in the future he will be able to build rental houses.

loans.use: purchase more soft drinks, bread, sugar, posho, and juice

loans.name: Grupo Barrio La Union Group

texts.es:
De 24 años de edad residente en Suchitepéquez doña Jaquelin es madre de dos hijos, uno de 6 años de edad estudiante en la escuela de su comunidad y el segundo tiene 4 años de edad y aun no estudia los hijos de ella es el motivo de que tiene que realizar un gran esfuerzo en la actividad que ella realiza para tener un buen ingreso económico para poder dales una buena educación para sus hijos, (Jaquelin es la de escote negro que se encuentra de lado derecho a izquierda).

La actividad principal que ella realiza es la venta de ropa de vestir para damas en forma ambulante por las hermosas calles de su comunidad donde ella vive. Ella realiza la compra de ropa en la ciudad capital para luego venderlas en su comunidad, dicha actividad ella lo ha venido realizando desde hace 4 años ya que dicho negocio le ha generado muchas ganancias para el sustento de su familia.

El motivo del préstamo es de  que ella desea realizar es para la compra de mercadería de ropa que ella realiza en su lugar de origen, la motivación de ella hiso que un grupo de mujeres se unieran a ella para poder también ellas emprender un negocio para poder lograr hacer algo en la vida, ya que las necesidades son muchas en cada familia en su comunidad.

Las aspiraciones de las mujeres Guatemaltecas pues doña Jaquelin es la compra de un local un su comunidad y en darles educación a sus dos hijos para que ellos sean profesionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
At 24 years of age, Suchitepéquez resident Jaquelin is the mother of two children. Her six-year-old is a student in the community school, and the other, who is four years old, is not in school yet. Her children are her motivation for putting so much effort into the activity she does in order to have a good income with which she can give her children a good education. (Jaquelin is the one with black v-neck who is on the right side.)

The principal activity that she carries out is selling women's clothing on the beautiful streets of the community where she lives. She purchases the clothing in the capital city in order to later sell it in her community. She has been carrying out this activity for four years now, as it has generated a great deal of income to sustain her family.

The reason for the loan is that she would like to purchase clothing merchandise, which she does in its place of origin. Her motivation brought together a group of woman who joined together with her so that they, too, could start a business in order to achieve something in life. In their community, every family has a great deal of need.

The aspirations of the Guatemalan women: Jaquelin's aspiration is to purchase a commercial space in her community and to give her two children an education so that they can be professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: El Sauce De Taulabe Group

texts.es: Héctor, tiene 52 años de edad, es soltero, tiene 8 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Siguatepeque cerca a Taulabe. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a las actividades agrícolas, con el cultivo de maíz, frijol y café, lleva 16 años de tener una finca de café el cual vende en pergamino oro en el mercado local. Don Héctor lleva 9 ciclos de préstamo con el actual que es por 20,000 Lempiras, lo ha solicitado en forma grupal y lo va invertir en la compra de abonos para fertilizar el cultivo de café y pago de limpieza para poder sacar mejor cosecha. El piensa en aumentar el área de cultivo con las ganancias que obtenga. El grupo se llama El Sauce de Taulabe, integrado por tres personas, que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es por 52,000 lempiras que lo utilizaran para darle mantenimiento y abonar sus cultivos de café. En la foto esta don Héctor a la izquierda, Santos y Gustavo a la derecha.
texts.en:
Hector is 52 years old, is single, has eight children, and lives in a town in the Siguatepeque municipality, near Taulabe. His whole life he has made a living in agriculture, growing corn, beans, and coffee. For 16 years he has had a coffee plantation. He sells the coffee on gold parchment at the local market. 

Hector has been through nine loan cycles, counting the current one, which is for 20,000 Lempiras. He has requested it as a group loan, and he will invest it in the purchase of manure to fertilize the coffee crop and to pay for cleanup in order to be able to improve the harvest. He is thinking of increasing his crop area with the earnings he makes.

The group is called El Sauce de Taulabe, and it is made up of three members who make a living in agriculture and who live in the same community. The group loan is for 52,000 Lempiras, which they will use to maintain and fertilize their coffee crops. In the photo are Hector (on the left), Santos, and Gustavo (on the right).

loans.use: to buy manure and maintenance to clean the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es: Don Silverio, tiene 59 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos y reside en una comunidad que pertenece al municipio de San Pedro Sula junto a su esposa y uno de sus hijos. Don Silverio anteriormente se dedicaba a realizar trabajos de jornal y hace 10 años decidió con su esposa establecer una pulpería que le generara mejores ingresos. Vende todo tipo de productos de la canasta básica como ser granos básicos, harina, manteca, churros, refrescos, variedades, productos enlatados, lácteos, productos de limpieza, huevos, embutidos etc. Ha mantenido el negocio mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita otro para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y surtir de maíz, frijoles, carnes, verduras, refrescos, huevos, y embutidos para incrementar las ventas.  tiene como plan utilizar las ganancias para arreglar poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en:
Silverio is 59 years old, married, and has 5 children. He lives with his wife and one of the children in a community that belongs to San Pedro Sula municipality. 

Before, Silverio earned a living doing daily wage jobs, but 10 years ago he and his wife decided to set up a small grocery store that would generate a better income. He sells all types of staple goods like dry grains, flour, shortening, chips, soft drinks, sundries, canned goods, dairy products, cleaning supplies, eggs, cold meats, etc. They have maintained the store by investing various loans, and are currently requesting another to continue investing in the business by stocking corn, beans, meats, vegetables, soft drinks, eggs and cold meats, to increase sales. 

He hopes to use profits to little by little improve his house.

loans.use: to stock his store with corn, beans, meats, vegetables, soft drinks, eggs and cold meats, to increase sales.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta owns and manages a small retail store within the local community selling grocery items and Avon, Natasha and Boardwalk products. She is 34 years old and blessed with one child. She aims to further improve her business and increase her income but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more items to resell. She hopes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, frozen foods, Avon products, Natasha products, Boardwalk products and more groceries to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gina Marie

texts.en:
Gina Marie has two children; her husband works abroad. With her desire to help her husband even in a simple way, Gina Marie sells grocery items in their village. She hopes someday to enlarge the business in order to earn a higher income that will enable her to provide for all their basic necessities. 

Gina Marie is requesting a loan of P 23,000 to buy beverages, canned goods, noodles, toothpaste and shampoo. This loan will be a big help in her plans for expansion.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods, noodles, toothpaste and shampoo.

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa, a single girl born in 1989, has a  vocational level of education. Five years ago, she started working as a secretary in a company, and she is a very persistent and hard worker.

Marwa has always dreamed of visiting holy and religious places, but due to her limited salary and family’s financial conditions she hasn't been able to achieve her dream. She is therefore requesting a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to make her dream come true.

loans.use: To pay the expenses of visiting holy and religious places

loans.name: Ramish Group

texts.en:
Ramish is a group which comprises four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB.

Iman is the leader of the group. She is a 32-year-old married woman with two children,whom she lives with in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a. Iman is a very active and dynamic woman who works as a housewife; her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. He is an employee and has a taxi and works on it as a driver to improve the living standards of his family. His income is good, but it is not enough to cover all of the expenses of the family this month because the costs of the Eid holiday were very high. As a result, the family is faced with a financial crisis these days inside the house. They are lacking enough food. Therefore, Iman applied for a loan of 40,000 YER in order to purchase flour, sugar, meats, potatoes, tomatoes, and other food so that she can make delicious meals for her family.

Iman looks forward to improving the living standards of her family. She hopes to open a savings account with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, meats, potatoes,  tomatoes, and other food materials to fulfill her family's food needs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Ruth has been working hard to manage  a made-by-hand craft business. 

To help expand her  business, Ruth has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials for the made-by-hand craft business, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings. Ruth hopes that in the future, she  will be able to own a poultry farm. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her made-by-hand craft business,

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is Married and has 2 children; 1 of them attends school. For the past 3 years, Immaculate has been working hard to manage her small charcoal business. 

To help expand her business, Immaculate has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell, and will help Immaculate to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Immaculate hopes that in the future, she  will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Immaculate is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Meresi

texts.en:
MERESI's group is comprised of  hard working women. MERESI is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda.  has one child. For the past 2 years, MERESI has worked hard to manage her small food market. 

To help expand  her business, MERESI has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sweet potatoes and other fresh foods.  This will help MERESI to generate greater profits and take care of her child. MERESI hopes that in the future, she  will be able to build rental houses. 

MERESI is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes and other fresh foods.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old single man from Qalqilia. He lives with his family in their old house. His brother works in an auto repair workshop and earns a small income. Mohammad works in a sewing workshop he owns. He takes orders from local traders. It is a good business and the income is high. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy threads and textiles for his sewing workshop. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his productivity and also his income.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo in his sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy threads and textiles for his sewing workshop

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Justine is 23 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years Justine has been working hard to manage her small retail business, which sells food and vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables and fresh food for sale, and will help Justine to generate greater profits and increase on her personal savings. Justine hopes that in the future  will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fresh food for sale.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 29-year old energetic  and a hardworking mother of 5 children. 

She is from the Kitale area of Kenya, which is an area mostly referred to as the bread basket of Kenya because half the food that Kenya consumes comes from that region. 

Emily is very hard working and she always says, “My parents taught me to work hard from a very young age, and now I am independent.” Emily is very dedicated and she does mixed farming and some small business  to supplement her income. Emily makes sure that she gives the best to her 5 children so that they can be productive in the future and  support themselves. 

Emily enjoys  farming, especially  milking and grazing her dairy cows.
 Emily has farmed for 16 years and is recognized as one of the best farmers in her village. Because of this, most villagers want products from her farm. This has increased her profits. Although she enjoys selling her products to the nearby market and to neighbors, her income is not sufficient to enable her to  comfortably take care of her family.  Therefore, she plans to start a poultry farm.

 Emily requests 60,000 KES to start a poultry farm  to improve her income.
Kitale area is a populated area and there is a market for eggs and poultry products but the supply is low. Emily plans to take advantage of that and reap more profits.

Emily has been  trained by Juhudi kilimo and is financially disciplined. She believes that she will be able to  repay the loan and open other business ventures.

If you are a mother from Africa, getting your hands on financial services is difficult, but Emily is sure that through your kindness, she will be able to acquire the loan, help her family, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to start a poultry farm.

loans.name: Maram Group

texts.en:
This group is called Maram. It consists of four women, from Sana'a city, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Ilham is a 24-year-old married woman with a 2-year-old daughter. She is the leader of the group.

Ilham is an uneducated woman but she is very dynamic and active. She has a lot of house work but doesn't own a washing machine. She currently does the washing by hand. This is exhausting work.

She asked  her husband to buy a washing machine to help her with her chores. Unfortunately, her husband's income is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. For this reason, Ilham applied for  40,000 YER from AMB  to buy a washing machine for her household.

Ilham looks forward to using home appliances to make a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her house.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha was born in 1990, she has an elementary level of education, and is a married mother of one baby. Her husband is a mechanic but his income is not good enough to cover all of their family’s needs so she decided to stand beside him and work in order to provide her family a suitable life.
 
She strived seven years ago, through working in a mobile selling shop, to save the requested capital to open her own business. She recently established her business, which has to do with selling cleaning detergents. 

Now, Maha wants to expand her shop and buy new goods - that’s why she is requesting a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. She will also invest part of it in covering necessary medical needs. By expanding the shop, Maha will be able to build a better future for her baby and cover all his needs and expenses, as he is her priority.

loans.use: to expand her shop and buy new goods, and cover necessary medical needs.

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en:
Nahida is a 47-year-old woman who has been engaged in milk and dairy product sales for the last 22 years. She is an IDP (internally displaced person). Nahida is widow  and has four children. 

Milk and yogurt are very popular products among Azerbaijani people and they use it in everyday life. Her son helps her to run the business. Monthly income from her business is 120 AZN. Now she has 3 milking cows and she would like to purchase one more. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of 500 AZN to purchase one more cow. She hopes very much for a positive outcome and thanks Aqroinvest in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow

loans.name: Sabougnouma 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à OUOROFOURA un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur DABA débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  SABOUGNOUMA 1. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of Sabougnouma 1 Group are married men whose average age is 43 years old and who have an average of six children [each], and live for the most part in traditional families in Ouorofoura, a village in the Dogoni commune, Sikasso region (third administrative region), Mali. These men work with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully complete their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan cycle growing corn with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, the previous loans having been properly repaid.

The crop to be grown is corn, with Mr. Daba, standing second from right to left in the photo of the Sabougnouma 1 Group of men. With his loan, Mr. Daba plans to purchase eight 50kg sacks of fertilizer and 10 containers of varying qualities of herbicide, and to pay the labor costs to maintain one hectare.

After the harvest, the crop [will be] sold in the village, in Sikasso, to a group of customers made up of men and women, for cash and credit. Mr. Daba expects to see an average profit of 160,000 CFA francs per crop. This profit will allow him to [re]pay his loan and his interest, as well as to contribute to the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, [and] pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the dairy pen and buy dairy feeds

loans.name: Sop Mame  Bousso 4" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Bousso 4 « Beug Manal Sa Bop » est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes commerçantes et transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Madame Coumba Demba est la présidente, elle évolue dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires et gère une mini boutique qu’elle veut renforcer. Grâce à ce financement, elle pourra acheter du riz, du sucre, du lait en poudre et divers autres marchandises pour mettre dans sa boutique et revendre. Avec cette activité, elle ravitaille la famille en petit déjeuner, cela est sa participation à la dépense quotidienne.
Elle rêve de détenir un grand magasin de vente d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
The Sop Mame Bousso 4 "Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group is a sub-group of a network of female retailers and producers of fishing products. The group is made up of five women who have been in business for several years and who have joined together in order to benefit from financial support that will allow them to strengthen their income-generating activities.

Mrs. Coumba Demba is the president; she sells foodstuffs and runs a small shop that she wants to strengthen. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to purchase rice, sugar, powdered milk, and various other goods to stock in her shop for resale. With this business, she provides the family's breakfast, which is her contribution to the daily expenses.

Mrs. Coumba Demba dreams of having a large grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to stock in her shop for resale.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
María es una muy emprendedora y trabajadora mujer que debe alternar los oficios de ama casa con su negocio de confección directa ya que realiza unos hermosos vestidos y trajes para personas de una edad ya avanzada como los que se pueden observar en la foto. 

Madre de 2 hijos de 10 y 18 años que dependen netamente de ella para estudiar y alimentarse y con un sueño el cual es tener un taller de confección con toda la maquinaría y poder emplear muchas personas que le ayuden hacer parte del proyecto de fabricar ropa para estas adorables personas. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina plana y tela para confeccionar sus hermosos trajes, con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá agilizar sus tiempo de producción y quitarle una gran carga laboral puesto que trabaja de 12 a 14 horas diarias entre sus dos trabajos de ama de casa y confeccionista.
texts.en:
María is a very enterprising and hardworking woman who alternates her roles as a housewife with her direct dressmaking business that produces beautiful garments for people of advanced age, such as those shown in the photo. 

She is mother to two children, who are 10 and 18 years old and who are completely dependent on her for their education and sustenance.  Her dream is to have a dressmaking workshop equipped with all the necessary machinery and to be able to employ many people who will help her in her  project of manufacturing clothing for these lovely seniors.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a flat-bed sewing machine and fabric in order to make her beautiful apparel. With help from this loan she will be able to streamline her production time and dispense with a large workload since she works from 12-14 hours a day at her two jobs as housewife and dressmaker.

loans.use: to purchase a flat-bed machine and fabric to make clothing for the older adult.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past three years Prossy has been working hard to manage her small retail business, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soda and water for sale, and will help Prossy to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standards of living. Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more soda and water for sale.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María una mujer de 48 años de edad dedicada de lleno al cuidado de sus nietos pues tiene 6 hijos ya todos ellos mayores de edad, quiere iniciar su propio negocio de venta de productos de peluquería por lo que quiere solicitar nuevamente un crédito para iniciar su vida como emprendedora pues la abandono por el cuidado de sus nietos. 

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de vitrinas, estanterías y surtido en general, fijadores, gel, tinturas, variedad de productos capilares, barnice etc. etc. etc. 

Con la ayuda de este crédito lograra una independencia pues depende de lo que sus hijas le den por cuidar los nietos y no quiere depender de esto quiere consolidar su negocio y generar su propio capital por dicha razón el crédito es tan trascendental pues marcara su vida y su futura independencia económica.
texts.en:
Maria, 48, looks after her grandchildren full time. She has 6 children, all of whom are adults. She wants to start a business selling hair salon products and is asking for a new loan to start her life as an entrepreneur, which she abandoned to look after her grandchildren. She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of glass cabinets, shelves and supplies in general, styling gel, hair dyes, a variety of hair products, nail polish, etc.
With the help from this loan, Maria will gain financial independence, because now she relies on what her daughters give her for looking after her grandchildren and she doesn't want to depend on this. Maria wants to consolidate her business and generate her own income and that is why the loan is so important, because it will mark her life and her future financial independence.

loans.use: to open her store of hair salon products. She will purchase glass cabinets, shelves, hair products, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Armando Antonio

texts.es: Armando de 42 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hijo de 3 años de edad. Él es reconocido en su cantón por ser una persona trabajadora y responsable, ya que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de seguridad. Armando desea terminar de construir su vivienda ya que le hace falta construir unas paredes. Por lo anterior  solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir unas paredes y lograr así terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en: Armando, 42 years old, lives with his wife and his three-year-old child. He is well known in the group of houses where he lives for being a hardworking and responsible person, because he makes a living providing security services. Armando wants to finish building his house because he needs to build some walls. That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build some walls and finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build some walls in his house.

loans.name: God Is My Helper Group

texts.en:
The God is My Helper group is composed of four people who live in the same quarter. They are into the sale of cosmetics, wigs, dough nut, foodstuff and fast food. 

The featured borrower of the group is Mercy. She is 45 years old, and a single mother of one child. She pays for her child to attend school. To cope with her needs, for the past four years, Mercy has been selling cosmetics and wigs as a secondary saleswoman in her quarter. Mercy buys her products at a market in Ghana. Hoping to give her customers better service, Mercy would like to reinforce her business by increasing her stock of products. To do this, Mercy and the other members of this group request a loan from ID-Ghana.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and wigs for resale.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 16 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Faith has been working hard to manage a small business, which sells small silver fish. 

To help expand her business, Faith has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more small silver fish for resale, and will help Faith to generate greater profits and open up a saving account. Faith hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a vehicle. 

Faith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more small silver fish for resale

loans.name: Patience's Group

texts.en:
Patience's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Patience is 16 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda; she is wearing a sleeveless white blouse in the picture. For the past year, Patience has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Patience has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more different types of clothes for resale, and will help Patience to generate greater profits and pay school tuition for herself. Patience hopes that in the future  will be able to increase her capital. 

Patience is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more different types of clothes for resale

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en:
Moreen is 16 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Moreen has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Moreen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food, and will help Moreen to generate greater profits and take care of her basic needs. Moreen hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a finished house of her own. 

Moreen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food for her business

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang would like to take a new loan to buy more soft drinks to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family, and she hopes that another one will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. Hang also hopes it will help her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of beverages in bulk.

loans.name: Franco

texts.en:
Franco is an old client of the institution whose previous loan of UGX 3,000,000 was repaid well. He is now graduating to UGX 5,000,000 such that he can increase his income. He operates two dairy shops and drives a motorcycle in the outskirts of the city. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy a new cooler so that he can maintain the quality of the milk even when power is off. He hopes this will save him losses caused by milk going bad after power cuts. He is an honest and hardworking man, but he has always been constrained by financial issues in his business. 

Franco says he will be able to have a bigger market will allow him to serve more than just those who buy dairy products from him. He has future hopes of expanding his business, given the loan amount for which he has applied.

loans.use: To buy a new cooler for his dairy business

loans.name: Al- Motahdon Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Motahdon. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Afaf is a forty-one-year-old married woman with four daughters living in a rented house in Sana'a, Yemen. She has a university education. Now, she works in a private clinic and earns a good salary. Afaf wants to improve her family's living conditions by purchasing some home appliances and furniture. In order to make the necessary improvements to her house, Afaf applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. This loan will be used to purchase a new washing machine.

Afaf hopes to open a savings account in AMB in order achieve a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a new washing machine for the house.

loans.name: Benah

texts.en:
Bernah is twenty years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Bernah has been working hard to manage a food market stall, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Bernah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food like sweet potatoes, and will help Bernah to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standard of living. Bernah hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her capital. 

Bernah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food like sweet potatoes

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en: Allah Rakhi is a fifty-two-year-old, married woman and mother of two. She has been running a business of cloths for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells to the people in her vicinity. She has become known for selling good quality cloth in her community. She has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy stocks of different cloths for the summer season. This will allow her to take into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy stocks of different cloths for the summer season

loans.name: Grupo Xojolá 8 Group

texts.es:
Mujeres emprendedoras se han convertido en el motor de nuestro país que día a día con su esfuerzo se dedican a los que mejor saben hacer en campo es el caso de doña Francisca de 34 años de edad residente en Suchitepéquez con dos hijos que son estudiantes de la comunidad donde ella tiene que hacer el esfuerzo para poder sacar a la familia hacia adelante, (Francisca es la que se tiene una blusa morada la que esta de primero en la derecha y gorda).

La actividad que ella dignamente realiza es la producción de banano en su aldea, dicha actividad lo aprendió de sus padres desde hace 25 años que lo han venido haciendo  para luego venderlas en el mayoreo de su comunidad, es la única actividad que ella realiza para poder tener un ingreso económico y obtener ganancias y mejorar la condición de vida en la que ella y su familia.

El uso respectivo que ella le dará al crédito que ella está realizando es para la compra de insecticidas para el mantenimiento de bananos con que ella cuenta en su terreno para que mejore la producción de las mismas.

Ella es un ejemplo de las mujeres emprendedoras y es por ello que se unieron a ella un grupo de mujeres para emprender junto a ella el negocio para un desarrollo mejor de su comunidad.

Una de las aspiraciones de doña Francisca es poner un negocio de abarrotes en la comunidad donde ella vive para tener mejores ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Enterprising women have become the engine of our country. With their efforts, day by day they make a living doing what they know best in the fields. That is the case of Francisca, 34 years old, a resident of Suchitepequez. She has two children, who are students in the community where she has to make the effort to be able to get her family ahead.

(Francisca is the one with a purple shirt, to the far right, and is chubby). The work that she does with dignity is banana tree production in her town. She learned that work from her parents 25 years ago. They have been doing it to then sell the bananas at the wholesale market in their community. It is the only work that she does to be able to have income and earnings and improve her and her family's life conditions.

What she will do with the loan that she is getting is purchase insecticides for maintaining the banana trees that she has on her land, to improve production. She is an example of the enterprising women, and that is why a group of women got together with her to start up a business with her, to improve the development of their community.

One of Francisca's dreams is to start a general store in the community where she lives in order to have better earnings for her family.

loans.use: to maintain banana trees.

loans.name: Agape Group

texts.en:
The four members of the group call Agape live in the same neighborhood and have been active for several years in their respective businesses. Each member is seeking financial support to help them bolster their enterprises.

Emmanuel,  the group’s representative, has been selling second hand clothing for over 16 years. He will use his loan portion to purchase a bale of used clothing to sell from door to door. 

Responsible for covering household expenses with the help of his wife, Emmanuel's future plans include building his own house.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 47-year-old woman. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She is a widow and has three daughters. 

She raises seasonal fruits and vegetables such as pomegranates, queen-apples, pears, and cherries. In the summer she raises fruits and in the autumn and winter she raises vegetables such as potatoes, pumpkins, and carrots. Shahnaz's monthly income is 180 AZN. 

She usually sells her crops to the local market vendors. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, like pilau and dolma, are made with vegetables. Fresh fruits are served on every Azerbaijani family's table and also used to make fresh punch. 

Shahnaz's daughters help her a lot in raising her crops. She applied for a loan of 800 AZN to buy more seeds and fertilizers. This will be her seventh loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es:
Norma, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia, ya que es cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo. 

A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 7 años de trayectoria en el sector.

Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando en su negocio y por ello desea fortalecerlo con la compra de surtido en productos de abarrotes como granos, galletas y productos de la canasta familiar, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas.

Norma manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo con su negocio y, en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten y así mejorar la rentabilidad y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is a charismatic, helpful woman who earns a living running her own business, a grocery store she started to earn income to help her family get ahead.  She is now the head of the home since separating from her husband.   Despite of adversities, Norma has had the strength and determination to get up and keep going and thanks to that has a 7 year track record in this area of business.

Her goal in life is to keep making progress in her business.  To do this she wants to strengthen it by purchasing groceries such as grains, crackers and basic food products, to increase her sales and income received.  Norma states that her greatest desire is to keep growing with the business and in the future, convert the store into a supermarket.  This would be a place where the customers could find the things they need, with better profit for her, and the ability to offer a higher standard of living to her family.

loans.use: .to buy groceries, grains and basic food products to stock her store

loans.name: Almaas

texts.en: Almaas is a fifty-four-year-old woman and a mother of four children. A few years ago, she began a business of stitching. Over the years, her business has flourished. She is also assisted by her son, also shown in the picture. Today, she has a strong customer base and is known in her area for good quality stitching. She also sells thread in her small shop. In her fourth loan cycle, Almaas has requested for a loan amount of 45,000 PKR. With this loan amount, she wants to purchase another sewing machine and spools of thread. She is thankful to Kashf foundation for its help, which enabled her to own her own business today.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine and spools of thread.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a forty-year-old married woman. She is running a business stitching clothes. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household or the educational needs of their children. Together with her husband, Kalsoom manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads along with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers. Her regular customers are neighbors and members of the local community. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads along with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Tin Son Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s YinMarPin township, this community currently has 50 village customers, including 6 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. The whole village relies on the water supply from the stream for farming, so farmers will plant crops, such as onions, in ditches near the stream.

The new loan would help borrowers buy small pigs, which each cost $50 and can be resold for $100 after seven or eight months. This additional income would help them save for larger investments, such as buying a cow or small tractor, either of which would dramatically expedite the planting and harvesting processes. Additionally, livestock manure can be used as a natural fertilizer. As farmers in this village grow various crops such as paddy, beans, cotton and onion, they are also planning to use a portion of the loan to buy chickpea, wheat and groundnut seeds to grow during the monsoon season.

Pictured above are the committee members from Tin Son Village CBO: U Chit, U Nyunt, U Mg, U Bo, U Zaw and U Than. Included in the photo (third from the left) is 57-year-old U Chit, who lives with his six family members. He grows groundnuts and potatoes. The new loan will enable him to purchase two small goats for his goat farm.

loans.use: to help 50 villagers buy livestock, such as pigs and goats, to raise and sell for a profit.

loans.name: Rekha

texts.en:
Rekha hails from Dhupguri. She is 27 years old and a mother of one toddler.  Her husband Tapas, aged 30 years, is a cultivator by profession.  Both could not complete secondary education as their family could not afford their education expenses.

Rekha's husband strives harder to make a living. All his life, he has worked in agricultural pursuits: growing vegetables.

He has worked in unity with his wife; with the profits obtained from their farming, they have managed to build their modest little house which is made of mud and straw, but in the future, he plans to build it of concrete. First, he wants to get a good harvest from the land, continuing to save up other earnings little by little to cover household expenses. For now, the need that has arisen is the cultivation of a profitable crop as his present income is insufficient for covering all the expenses of his family. He decided to cultivate paddy but lacks the capital.

Rekha is requesting this loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy fertilizers, paddy seeds, and herbicides.  She wants to take advantage of the rainy season to obtain a good harvest with all the care and management possible, to achieve her intended future earnings which will allow her to meet the needs of his family.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Parul

texts.en:
Parul is 42 years old, married, and a homemaker of Dhupguri.  She is the mother of three children (one son and two daughters) who are students in different grades of secondary schools. She couldn't receive education due to the scant financial resources of her parents.  She was married to Ganesh at a young age. He is also illiterate;  both of them can sign their names only. 

Parul's husband, aged 49 years, has sound experience in farming.  As the only breadwinner for the family, he works tirelessly on his farmland.  He grows vegetables like potatoes, beans, gourds, etc.  He, along with Parul, carries the produce to the nearby market for sale.
