Despite their hard work, they are unable to provide a decent lifestyle for their family and are unable to bear the educational expenses of their children.  In order to earn more income, they have decided to cultivate paddy. They have chosen this crop as it is staple food for the people of their locality.

That's why Parul has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She needs the loan to buy farm supplies (seeds, pesticides, manure, etc.) for paddy cultivation since she wants to handle things well to have better crop yields in the future.

Her dream is to have a good harvest of the crop to fulfill all her dreams, including acquiring more land, with the profit.  She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds for cultivation of paddy crops.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La historia de marina es una bella historia de esfuerzo y noches sin dormir por lograr un objetivo pues ella toda la vida fue una empleada con grandes responsabilidades como lo son mantener a dos hijos de 17 y 12 años pero siempre en cada pago ahorra un pequeño monto pues soñaba con ser una persona independiente y fue así como al tiempo logro comprar dos máquinas de confección y comenzó con su taller. 

Hoy en día y con la ayuda de otros 3 créditos logro constituir un buen taller de confección que cuenta con 7 empleadas todas ellas madres cabeza de hogar, presenta un gran problema y es la competencia desleal que ofrecen sus competidores, lo que la obliga a bajar sus precios o tener que despedir a una empleada, Marina consciente de este problema no quiere que ninguna de sus empeladas abandone el trabajo pues sabe que es con lo único que pueden llevar un pan a su hogar por dicha razón solicita un crédito para la compra de maquinaria plana con ella mejorara sus tiempo de producción y así poder rebajar sus precios para competir.

Sueña con seguir creciendo su negocio y generar a mas madre de familia la oportunidad de un trabajo.
texts.en:
Marina's is a beautiful story of hard work and sleepless nights to reach a goal. Her whole life she was an employee with big responsibilities, like supporting two children, ages 17 and 12. But from every paycheck she always saves a small amount because she dreamed of being independent, and that is how over time she managed to buy two sewing machines and she opened her shop. Today, and with the help of another three loans, she has managed to set up a good sewing shop that has seven employees, all of them mothers and heads of household.

She has a big problem and that is unfair competition by her competitors. It is forcing her to lower her prices or to have to let an employee go. Marina, aware of this problem, does not want any of her employees to stop working, because she knows that it is the only way they can put food on their tables. 

For that reason she is requesting a loan to purchase a tabletop sewing machine. With it she will improve her production time and thus be able to lower her prices to compete. She dreams of continuing to grow her business and giving more mothers the opportunity to work.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine in order to improve production time.

loans.name: Manuja

texts.en:
Manuja, who is only 25 years old, is a very committed and hardworking woman of Dhupguri. She has three lovely daughters; one of them is a student of primary standard. They live in the small village Kathapara of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (made of straw, bamboo, and mud) . She is illiterate and can only sign her name, but her husband studied until grade 8.

Her husband, Mahabul, is engaged in agricultural activities. He mainly grows paddy. Manuja helps her husband every day to keep their crops healthy, which is an arduous and difficult job and worthwhile at the end of the season.

Manuja’s family's income depends on this agribusiness. Her husband has an experience in this job. The land is his own. With the growing expenses of his family, he needs to expand his business by cultivating paddy in larger quantities. This will not only meet the customers' demands but also earn an additional profit. They need financial help, so Manuja is seeking a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to purchase more quality seeds and fertilizers to better cultivate paddy. She hopes for good revenue to meet all her dreams.

She wants to support her daughters in their studies so that they can become noble and generous citizens. She also aspires to build a concrete-made better house for them with the profit because the house in which they are living at present is lacking all the minimum amenities. She gives heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Min Kan Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Yaysagyo township, this community currently has 44 village customers, including 6 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle to find access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.

Most people in the village rely on traditional farming and cultivate various crops such as pigeon peas, sesame, chickpeas, cotton and groundnuts. The new loan would enable the community to pay for farming inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and compost, and lease equipment, such as tractors and bulls, for the planting and harvesting seasons.  

Pictured above are the committee members from the Min Kan Village CBO: U San, U Win, U Tin, Daw Aye, Daw Myint and Daw Kyi. Included in the photo (farthest to the right) is 50-year-old U San, who has eight family members. He works not only as a farmer, but also as a construction worker in nearby villages. He used his past loan to invest in compost and fertilizer. He will invest his new loan in sesame and cotton seeds for the coming cropping season.

loans.use: to help 44 villagers buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers, and equipment.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 45-years-old married woman. She has six children and her husband used to be the only earner of the family. 

In order to assist her husband in taking care of their family, she began her business of cloth selling. She purchases cloth from wholesalers and sells it in her town. Now, she is playing a vital role in providing for her family. 

She is currently in her fourth loan cycle and has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. With this loan amount, she intends to buy more cloth with greater variety. She is hopeful that her business will prosper and generate more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cloth with greater variety.

loans.name: Khan Sat Kone (West)Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Taung Thar township, this community currently has 23 village customers, 6 of whom are CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members helping to lead the loan program in the area.

The main businesses for this village are cultivating crops, rolling cigars and tapping toddy palm for sugar. Many young people are migrating to other cities, as there are no job opportunities for them in the village. These new loans will help farmers purchase better groundnut, sesame, and butter bean seeds for the upcoming cropping season. Additionally, the loans will fund necessary farming investments, such as fertilizer and hired labor.

Pictured above are U Thein, U Kyaw Myo, Daw Han, Daw Nu, Ma Khin, and U Kyaw Min. They are the committee members from the village CBO who vouch for loan applicants. Included in the photo (farthest to the right) is U Thein, who is 25 years old and the father of one child. He purchased fertilizer for his farms with his previous loan and is planning to use his next loan to buy high-quality peanut and groundnut seeds.  These will boost his crop yields and, therefore, his income from farming.

loans.use: to help 23 villagers purchase high-quality groundnut, sesame, and butter bean seeds that will boost crop yields.

loans.name: Diana Milena

texts.es:
Que hijo no sueña con darle a su madre una casa propia después que la veía todos los días alimentándole y dándole su amor y en muchas ocasiones quitarse el pan de su boca y dárselo al hijo. 

A sus 34 años de edad es la mano derecha de su madre vive con ella y la mantiene gracias a una tienda que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logro montar aparte de que tiene aspiraciones de estudiar y conseguir un buen empleo para comprarle la casa a su madre. 

Solicita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de una nevera, una vitrina, surtido de la canasta familiar y una estantería para mejorar su tienda y poder abarcar los gastos del hogar, del crédito y sus estudios.
texts.en:
What child does not dream of giving her mother her own home after she saw her every day feeding her, giving her love and often taking bread out of her mouth to give it to the child?

At her 34 years of age, she is the right hand of her mother. She lives with her and and takes care of her, thanks to a store she started with a lot of effort and sacrifice. Besides that, she has aspirations of studying and getting a good job to buy her mother a home.

She is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of a refrigerator, a cabinet, an assortment of food items and a shelf, to improve her store and be able to cover household expenses, credit and studies.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, a cabinet, an assortment of food items and a shelf.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a 34-year-old married woman. For the past five years, she has been successfully running a cattle sales and purchase business. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

With the support of her husband, she sells the cattle such as goats, cows, and buffaloes for profit. Her husband is a laborer but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Gulnaz is in her fourth loan cycle and has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR through the Kashf Foundation to purchase one more buffalo. She expects a boost in her earnings with this loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline is 34-year-old lady,  married to Maurice and blessed with two children aged eight and six years. She has been in the poultry business for the last four years and gets a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has applied for her third loan of KES 30,000 from Vision fund Kenya which she will use to buy more poultry feeds.She paid her previous loan successfully.

Seline will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds

loans.name: Zee Pin Kan Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Thaung Thar township, this community currently has 92 village customers, 7 of whom are CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members helping to lead the loan program in the area.

Farmers must buy several inputs to ensure good yields. For example, they typically purchase different types of seeds, compost, fertilizer, and pesticides, hire labor, and lease equipment and livestock. A new loan would enable this community to buy higher-quality fertilizer, compost, and pesticides, as these products must supplement animal manure to improve soil conditions and produce better crops.

Pictured above are U Aye, U Kyi, U Aung, Kyaw, Daw Cho, Daw Win, and Daw Khin. They are CBO committee members from the village who vouch for loan applicants. Included in the photo (farthest to the left) is 42-year-old U Aye, the father of a small child. With his previous loan, he bought two goats to raise and sell back for a profit. This year, he plans to use his new loan to buy special compound fertilizer to get better-quality peanut and bean crops.

loans.use: to help 92 villagers buy high-quality compost, fertilizer, and pesticides that will boost crop yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn to make arepas.

loans.name: The Strength Of God Group

texts.en:
The Strength of God group is made up of three members. The group representative is named Ernestina. The members of this group all live in the same neighborhood and are into footwear, second hand clothing, and sewing accessories. 

Thirty-three-year-old Ernestina attended school to the elementary level. She is married with four children, who are receiving an education and who live under their parents' care. 

Ernestina has been supporting her husband in the various expenses in her household. In order to do this, Ernestina has been selling assorted footwear for the past ten years. This business generates revenue, which helps her to meet her various needs, as well as those of her family. Ernestina gets her supplies from the market. 

This will be the sixth time she has sought a loan from ID-Ghana, along with the other members of the group. This loan will help her grow her business and increase her turnover and revenue. The previous loans have been paid back in full.

loans.use: To buy assorted footwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es:
Flor es una bella mujer de 36 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 6 años criada con las buenas costumbres pueblerinas, desde el colegio desarrollo una gran pasión por todo lo relacionado con el salón de belleza  y desde que salió comenzó a realizar cursos.

Inicio su etapa en salones de belleza hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio en su hogar. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido pues también quiere vender productos para complementar sus servicios, como crema de manos, gel, productos capilares, tinturas para cabello, barnice y cambiar su equipo mejorando su plancha para cabello, secador e instrumentos como máquina para motilar, cepillos, peines, entre otros.

El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese y tenga muchos clientes ya que será determinante porque dejo su hogar para aventurarse en la ciudad buscando un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Flor is a lovely woman, 36 years old, brought up in accordance with good small town customs, and is the mother of a 6 year old son.  Since high school she has developed a great interest in everything having to do with beauty salons, and on finishing high school, began to take classes. She began her  work in beauty salons.  One day she took a chance, deciding to go in search of her own customers and starting a business in her home.

Flor wants a loan to buy stock to sell, since she wants to sell products complementary to her services, such as hand cream, gel, capillary treatments, hair dyes and gloss.  She also wants to replace her equipment, improving her styling iron, hair dryer and tools for cutting hair and eyebrows, and her combs, among other items.

The loan is very important to Flor because she will thus finish building her business with all the equipment needed to operate and offer any service customers come in and ask to have.  Her dream is that her business will make progress and she will have many customers. Succeeding is key for Flor because she left her home to take a chance in the city looking for a better future.

loans.use: to buy capillary treatments, gel, dyes, chemicals and everything related to hair are, also to buy blades and razors for cutting hair

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 25-year-old woman, married to Samuel, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children.  Alice has been selling fried potatoes and chips for three years earning an income of KES. 15,000 at the end of every month.

Alice was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her 1st loan of KES. 20,000  and intends to use the amount to buy some potatoes to prepare take away fries, fried potatoes, and assorted juices to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Alice plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and open a restaurant, and she hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy potatoes to make chips and fried potatoes for her customers.

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en:
Hanifan is a married woman. She has successfully run a small general store with her husband. Her husband assists her by purchasing  goods from the market and deals with customers. Over time, she has become popular in her community because she provides quality products and makes enough to meet the expenses of her 4 children. 

She has requested 40,000 PKR to buy salt, oil, grains, biscuits and beverages to meet with the customers' increasing demands. She is expecting to increasein her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy salt, oil, grains, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 51-year-old married lady with eight children. She has sold used clothing for 24 years and earns a monthly income of 4,000 KES.

She has applied for her first loan of 5,000 KES from Vision fund Kenya after being introduced to VISION FUND; she will use the loan to increase her clothing inventory.

Judith will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs, grow her business, and be financially stable.

loans.use: to increase inventory and purchase clothes.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 54 years old and her son (shown in the photo) had manufactured steel taps for the 3 years. He buys raw material from the market, shapes it, and sells it at the local market. 

Her son’s business makes enough profit to contribute to the family income. She has 6 children and  is responsible for providing them with good food, health care, and clothing.   She requires more income to support her family. 

She has requested 50,000 PKR to buy  iron plates and screw drivers. She expects an increase in her son's earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of the business.

loans.use: to buy iron plates and screw drivers.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a married woman with 3 children. She has helped her husband in his  shutter-making business. She is a hard worker. 

She and her husband support their entire family, but she has many household expenses and finds it difficult to invest in the business. Therefore, Shumaila has requested 40,000 PKR to purchase good quality wood from the market to meet the increasing demands. She hopes to provide a quality  education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood from the market.

loans.name: Rohini Baidyanath Mahila Samuha Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Rohini Baidyanath Mahila Samuha Self-Help Group is formed of five industrious women who are trying to improve the social and economic condition of their families. This group is managed by the local NGO, MESP. MESP aims to develop women’s empowerment, and educates women by giving different training to improve their livelihoods, which will help the women to improve their standard of living.

Uma is the featured borrower and is standing with her hand raised. She lives in Rohini village of Deoghar district in Jharkhand with her husband and a daughter and son. Her son is working, and her daughter is studying in school. Her husband is a priest. 

Uma is into the photo frame-making business. Initially, she started this business to spend her leisure time, but later it has become her main source of income because there is good demand in her community. 

Since there is a lot of demand, Uma wants to use this opportunity to earn more income. She wants increase her output, for which she is requesting a loan to buy materials needed to make photo frames. She hopes to save enough for her daughter’s education.

Currently, she sells the frames to small local shops, but in the future, she wants to supply her frames in bulk directly in the market.

The other four women are also seeking loans to improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to make photo frames.

loans.name: Phionah's Group

texts.en:
Phionah's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Phionah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Phiona has worked hard to manage her food market. 

To help expand her business, Phionah has requested  300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sweet and Irish potatoes for sale, and will help Phionah to generate greater profits and buy food for the family. Phionah hopes that in the future, she  will be able to build rental houses. 

Phionah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy baskets of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is an energetic lady and mother of 6 children. She decided to work with her husband to support her family and better their future. 

She opened a beauty salon in her house to provide services for women who live close by. She uses the income to support her entire family and her business has flourished. 

She is in her 8th loan cycle and has requested 60,000 PKR to meet the daily demands of her customers. She wants to purchase facial kits, skin whitening products, and hair styling tools. She expects to increase her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase facial kits, skin whitening products, and hair styling tools.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married woman who lives at a rental house without electricity or running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over three years, she has operated a home-based power saw rental business and rents to carpenters  and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of changing seasons in her business. 

She wants to use the 20,000 KES to purchase another power saw. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase another power saw for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Nancy, 29 years of age and a small-scale farmer from Kericho, a rural town in Kenya that is famous for its high-quality tea. It is also home to some of the world’s best long-distance runners, many of whom have won gold medals in international events. Nancy is a young mother of one child and has been practising mixed farming for the past four years. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, tea and other crops, and some personal business.

Nancy passionately loves farming, but dairy farming is close to her heart and looking after her dairy cows makes her a very proud farmer. Although Nancy has made profits through farming, she has been experiencing losses because of ineffective farming techniques. That is why she is kindly requesting a loan to buy farm inputs.

Through the loan, she will be able to buy good-quality and high-grade seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to be used in her farm. This will assure her of immediate profits because the production level will go up, which will generate better profits.

Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and inputs, and Nancy is eager to access them. Through increased profits, she will be able to realize her dream of improving her living conditions and seeing her business expand in leaps and bounds.

Nancy is very disciplined with finances and has gone through Juhudi Kilimo training. She is sure to accumulate more income and be able to fully pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy good-quality and high-grade seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Cissy has  worked hard to manage a small shoe business. 

Cissy has requested 950,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes and will help Cissy to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standard of living. Cissy hopes to open a clothing business. 

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Hello! The above picture presents to you Abraham, a very hardworking person who is 36 years of age, who hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area referred by many as the bread basket area of Kenya. He is a family man and has five children that he really adores and you can always notice a pleasant feeling when he arrives home from the farm. He has been practicing mixed farming for over five years and through milk selling, crop selling, and personal business he has been able to earn a decent income. Abraham loves farming but dairy farming is passionately close to his heart. He has even nicknamed one of his cows “Maua,” which means flower, and that’s really what the cow is to him. Abraham has been selling milk to his neighbors and villagers but the demand has been too big for him to satisfy, which is why he is kindly requesting a loan to buy a good quality cow that can produce more milk.

Abraham has large space in his farm and also animal food will never be a problem and is therefore assured of reaping maximum profits through milk selling. Through the loan Abraham will be assured of immediate profits because the demand for milk is high and profits from it will be used in improving his living conditions and paying tuition fees to his school-going children.

Abraham is an aspiring farmer, and through partners such as Kiva he is sure of making his dream come into a reality through their loan financing. Abraham waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with one child who attends school. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a door-to-door business to sell clothes to her neighbors. She lacks the capital needed to expand her business.

She is requests 50,000 KES to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is married, and has two children going to school. They live in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a business selling clothes, selling from her home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting KES 20,000.  She wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 36-year-old married woman and a mother of 4 children. Her husband (shown in the photo) is a professional driver and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses.  THe rickshaw is in need of  proper maintenance to keep the rickshaw functional. 

For this reason, Robina has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy new tires  and pay for maintenance. This will the ride to be smoother and provide better transportation service to the passengers. 

Robina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for the vehicle and pay for  maintenance .

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther's group is comprised of  hardworking women. Esther is 16 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past one year, Esther has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food to sell and will help Esther to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a supermarket. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food for sale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is a married woman with five children all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Patience wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise profits. For that reason, with the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, and mangoes, and water.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, water and sacks of fruits such as oranges, and mangoes.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with eight children, six of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a matatu (mini-bus) transport business, where her potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season it becomes hard to operate. Her dream is to purchase another matatu in the near future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to service her matatu and purchase new spare parts. She decided to join Yehu because of affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to service her matatu and purchase new spare parts

loans.name: Anointing Group

texts.en: This group is made up of three people who live in the same district. The group's representative, Akua, is 60 years old and standing in the middle of the photograph. They are into foodstuffs, pears, onions, cosmetics, materials, and cloth. Akua lives alone and all her children are grown taking care of themselves. Akua did not attend school but has 12 years experience in trading. In order to be able to meet her needs and manage her customers' needs, Akua buys foodstuffs, onions, and pears, which she will sell via the distribution system. Akua gets her supplies from the farmers in the village. Akua would like to strengthen her business so that she is better able to meet her customer demand. In order to do this, Akua is requesting a ninth loan from ID-Ghana, together with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, onions, and pears, which she will sell via the distribution system.

loans.name: Jazirah

texts.en:
Jazirah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jazirah has been working hard to manage her small fish business, which sells fresh fish. 

To help expand business, Jazirah has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to sell, and will help Jazirah to generate greater profits and increase her savings by working harder to achieve her goals. Jazirah hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Jazirah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en:
Priscillar, age 25 years, is married and has two children both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past four years, she has operated an open-air food business, selling to her neighbors and students at a neighboring school. In addition, she also does a faming business, which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate. She dreams of establishing a retail shop and a café in the business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, salt and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, salt, and sugar.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a married woman with children who still attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. She has operated a kiosk retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay loans. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jacqulin

texts.en:
Jacqulin is married and has five children, all of whom attend school and are working.  They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also does farming, which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish in the near future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase two sacks of dried fish to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of dried fish

loans.name: Francisco Leonel

texts.es:
Francisco un orgullo y muy trabajador agricultor dedicado al trabajo del campo hace ya muchos años el cual lo aprendió empíricamente, cultiva café, maracuyá, y plátano y al estar en temporada alta sus campos requiere cuidado y unos abonos especiales que tienen un préstamo elevado el cual el señor francisco no tiene capital para cubrir.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos, riegos e insumos para erradicar ciertos parásitos que amenazan sus cultivos. 

Con el crédito podrá tener una buena cosecha y obtener buena ganancia para seguir ejerciendo esta admirable labor por muchos más años.
texts.en: Francisco is a proud and hardworking farmer who has worked in the fields for many years.  He learned through experience how to cultivate coffee, passion fruit, and bananas.  Since it is the high season, his crops need care and some special fertilizers that are costly that Francisco does not have the money to buy.  He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, irrigation equipment, and supplies to eradicate certain parasites that threaten his crops.  With this loan, he will have a better harvest and will obtain greater earnings so that he can continue carrying out this important work for many more years.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an industrial stove.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Bahati dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
El señor José es un agricultor muy habilidoso con experiencia en varias áreas de la agricultura, con un talento innato para el trabajo en equipo y una gran mente emprendedora.

Tiene un pequeño cultivo de yuca que atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Actualmente vive solo y el dinero que consigue es para su sostenimiento y el de su cultivo, ya que con este ha podido sobrevivir con gran esfuerzo.

El desea darle un impulso a su cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos de este por eso pide un auxilio económico para invertirlo en insumos agropecuarios como abonos, riegos y pesticidas, adicionalmente comprara semillas de yuca, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de tener un producto de mejor calidad.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y tener una vejez tranquila.

Apoye a José con su proyecto de vida y sus ganas de salir adelante!
texts.en:
Jose is a highly skilled farmer with experience in various areas of agriculture. He has an innate talent for teamwork and a great entrepreneurial mind. He has a small harvest of yuca [cassava] that he tends to every day from the early hours of the morning. Currently he lives alone and the money that he makes goes towards his sustainability and the sustainability of his harvest. He has been able to survive with this with a great effort. 

He wants to kick-start his harvest and get a better income. Thus he is asking for financial assistance to invest in farming supplies such as fertilizers, irrigation, and pesticides. Additionally he will buy yuca seeds. The loan will give him the opportunity to have a better quality product. His biggest dream is to have a his own house and have a peaceful old age. Support Jose with his project and his desires to succeed!

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, irrigation, and elements for land preparation

loans.name: Maria Belen

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 52 años de edad que comenzó con una tienda general hace aproximadamente 4 años con la esperanza de ayudar en su familia a su hijos de 20 y 22 años de generar recursos de ser independiente de no esperar nada de nadie. 

Con el ánimo muy en alto y llena de aspiraciones y entusiasmo quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una nevera y surtido en productos de refrigeración como leche, embutidos como salchichas, mortadela y salchichón. 

Con el crédito podrá seguir creciendo y convertir su pequeña tienda en algo mejor con miras a futuro.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old and opened a general store about four years ago in order to help her family. María's children are 20 and 22 and she wanted to build savings so that they could be independent and not rely on anyone. 

María is in very high spirits, full of enthusiasm, and ambitious, so she's applying for a loan to purchase a refrigerator. She will also use the loan funds to stock the refrigerator with milk and meats such as hot dogs, mortadella, and sausages. 

This loan will allow María to grow her business, looking ahead, transform her small store into something better.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and cold items.

loans.name: Norman Alberto

texts.es:
Norman un hombre un hombre de 46 años de edad que llego hace un tiempo a la corporación con muchos sueños y metas los cuales han sido tener su propia casa y hoy pidiendo su 7 préstamo ve este sueño cada vez más cerca pues recuerda que cuando pidió el primero apenas iniciaba su empresa y hoy en vida agradece la oportunidad que le dieron. 

Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos de ferretería en general. Martillos, llaves, clavos, en general todo lo que se encuentra ya que sus ahorros los está destinando a la finalización de su casa que con tanto trabajo y esfuerzo ha ido construyendo.

El crédito ser muy importante pues podrá continuar con la construcción de su casa y demostrar de alguna manera agradecimiento y resultado a los prestadores que alguna vez le ofrecieron su ayuda y decirles triunfe miren casi termino mi hogar y en gran parte ustedes son los responsables por darme la confianza de crear y hacer crecer mi negocio.
texts.en:
Norman is a 46-year-old man who arrived at the institution some time ago with many dreams and goals including having his own home. Requesting his 7th loan today, he sees his dream even closer. He remembers that when he requested his first loan he was just starting his business and now gives thanks for the opportunity he was given.

He is requesting a loan to purchase general hardware supplies such as hammers, wrenches, nails, etc. since he has decided to use his savings to finish his house, which he has been building with hard work and great effort.

This loan is very important, for it will allow him to continue building his house and to somehow show appreciation and results to the lenders who at some point have offered him help. He wants to tell them, "I succeeded. Look, I have almost finished my house and you are greatly responsible for giving me the confidence to create and expand my business."

loans.use: to buy general hardware supplies such as hammers, wrenches, paints, etc.

loans.name: Adriana Patricia

texts.es:
Más de 9 años de experiencia son los que tiene la señora Adriana en la venta de productos de uso domésticos pedidos por revista o catálogo, en su hogar tiene una pequeña vitrina donde exhibe que vende pero quiere expandirse y llegar a muchos lugares por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de una moto que le permita llegar a varios municipios cercanos ofertando sus productos en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para ella y sus 4 hijos de 17, 15, 11 y 9 meses de edad que depende netamente de ella. 

Sueña con poder ser la vendedora número 1 de la revista y gozar con sus hijos una vida donde el amor y el estudio desborden en su hogar.
texts.en: Adriana has over nine years of experience selling household products that she orders from magazines and catalogs.  She has a small store in her home where she displays the products.  She wants to expand and reach more places, which is why she is seeking a loan to purchase a motorcycle that will allow her to get to different towns near her to sell her products.  She is seeking a better quality of life for her and her four children who are ages 17, 15, 11 and 9 months old who depend on her.  She dreams of being the top seller for the magazine and being able to enjoy a life with her children in which love and education overflow in their home.

loans.use: purchase a motorcycle to distribute her products on sidewalks and nearby towns.

loans.name: Victor Raul

texts.es:
Victor es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 33 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.

Actualmente posee cultivos de yuca, ñame y plátano, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo donde reside en el municipio de Montería, esta actividad le permite sobrevivir y llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa e hijos.

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidado de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.

Victor manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Victor is a humble farmer and a 33 year old worker who since childhood learned all the field work, thanks to his father's lessons. He currently has yuca, yam, and plantain harvests. His crops are collected and sold in the town market of Monteria. This work allows him to survive and carry out the daily tasks of his home and fulfill the basic needs of his wife and children. 

He is motivated to apply for this loan in order to invest in the wholesale purchase of farming supplies (fertilizers, pesticides, fertilizers). This will allow him to continue taking care of his crops and improve production for the next harvest, which will beneficial to the income received for each sale. Victor says that his greatest desire to continue fighting to achieve financial stability and provide his family with better living conditions and well-being.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, irrigation, and pesticides.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a widow and a mother of seven children. They all live in a four-bedroom house in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon.  Margret has faced so many difficulties in life, including the death of family members, sickness in her family, an accident that almost took one of her brothers, and the general poverty in her family that required them to leave school at tender ages.

With the new loan requested, Margret will pay for the labor of her farm, buy fertilizer, buy two piglets, and buy feed for the piglets. She will use part of the loan to pay for the transportation cost of bringing her crops from the farm to the market.  She believes her business will succeed because her farm is right by the river that provides water for the crops. She has regular customers who buy her crops from the farm at times because she has been farming for so long. With this business activity, the community will benefit from the moderate prices she will offer on the crops. The population will not suffer malnutrition again and the distance to buy food will be reduced.
 
With the profit from this loan, Margret will expand her farming business, pay her children's school fees, and save some money. She will also provide medication for her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of their low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and also training in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to pay for the labor of her farm, buy fertilizer, buy two piglets, and buy feed for the piglet

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 64 años de edad, vive en el distrito de La Matanza, es una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población es amable, se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon , perteneciente al departamento de Piura , costa norte del Perú.

Miguel se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y piqueos junto con su esposa, además el comercializa limones en su moto taxi, con una antigüedad de más de 5 años. Él a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la construcción de su casa ya que es ahí donde atiende a sus clientes que consumen sus productos (chicha de jora, piqueos), de esta manera tendrá un mejor local de atencion, consecuente aumento de clientela y mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 64 years old and lives in the district of La Matanza.  It is a community with a warm climate and very friendly people who work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.  The community is located in the Morropon province which is in Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Miguel works selling chicha de jora, beer and snacks with his wife.  He also sells lemons on his moto taxi.  He has been doing this for over five years.  He is seeking a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in building his home since this is where he serves his customers who purchase his products (chicha de nora, snacks).  This way, he will have a better place to tend to his customers, which will increase his clientele and improve his earnings for his family.

loans.use: invest in building his home and improving his quality of life.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 30-year-old man, divorced with two children both of whom go to school.  He is a first time borrower from Ugafode Microfinance Ltd and a resident of a city town council. He trades wines, whiskeys and beer. He is so grateful for the support given to them as low-income earners, especially those that are trying to better their lives. His future plan is to expand his business into an export and import trade because of is bigger profit margin.

loans.use: to buy wines and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Jose

texts.es:
EL señor Manuel es un hombre que trabaja diariamente como cultivador en tierras arrendadas y siempre se ha soñado con tener su propio terreno para poder trabajar y trabajar y solo trabajar con el sueño de asegurar un futuro a sus dos hijos de 7 y 8 años de edad los cuales son su inspiración y su motivo de levantarse todos los días muy en la madrugada a laborar. 

Al estar en temporada necesita iniciar de la mejor manera posible sus cultivos por eso quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos para preparar la tierra como abonos, riegos y semillas esperando una productiva cosecha y ahorrar dinero para pensar en comprar su propio terreno.

El crédito le será muy importante pues con el comenzara el cultivo de no poder acceder a este no sabría que hacer le tocaría prestar dinero a tasas de interés muy altas con personas del sector poniendo en riesgo lo poco que ha conseguido.
texts.en:
Manuel is a man who works daily as a cultivator on leased land. He has always dreamed of having his own land to work and rework, with the dream of securing a future for his two children aged 7 and 8 years old. His children are his inspiration and the motivation to get up every day before daybreak to work. 

When in season, he needs to start growing his crops in the best way possible, which is why he is applying for a loan: to purchase supplies to optimize the soil including fertilizers, irrigation and crop seeds. He awaits a productive harvest and being able to save money to consider buying his own plot of land. 

The loan will be very important to him since he needs to start the harvest, and without access to the loan he will have to resort to other loans at high interest rates from people in the industry and this would jeopardize the little income he can manage.

loans.use: purchase supplies to prime the soil, such as as fertilizers, irrigation and seeds.

loans.name: Fiorela

texts.es:
Fiorela tiene 29 años de edad, su estado cilvil es conviviente, reside en el barrio Santa Julia de Buenos aires, Morropon - Piura - Perú, desde hace más de 20 años siendo natural de la zona. Ella indica que la vida en la comunidad es tranquila ya que se dedican al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

La actividad a la que se dedica la señora es a la venta de servicio de loza y plástico, triciclos para niños, además de la compra de ropa y entregar por pedido, ella cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el negocio, con clientela fija en la zona, esta actividad la realiza los días lunes, martes y viernes de cada semana en buenos aires y caseríos aledaños.

La señora necesita el crédito para la construcción de su vivienda en material noble.(ladrillo y cemento) el cual será pagado con su trabajo y el de su conyugue que se dedica a la pesca en puerto de Paita por el cual el nucleo familiar aumenta sus ingresos por lo que el pago del prestamo esta garantizado.
texts.en:
Fiorela is 29 years old and lives with her partner.  They live in the Santa Julia de Buenos Aires neighborhood of Morropon in Piura, Peru.  She has lived in this region for over 20 years.  She states that life is this community is relaxed because its people work in commerce and raising livestock.

She works selling plastic utensils and tricycles for children, as well as purchasing clothing and delivering by orders.  She has four years of experience in this business and has loyal customers in the region.  She conducts business on Mondays, Tuesdays and Fridays every week in Buenos Aires and neighboring towns.

She is in need of this loan to build her home of quality materials such as bricks and cement.  The loan will be repaid through her work and her husband who works as a fisherman in Puerto de Paita.  He supplements the family's income, so repaying the loan is guaranteed.

loans.use: build her home out of quality materials such as brick and cement.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a 32-year-old woman, married to Lucas, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children.  Mwanasiti has been selling fried potatoes, chips, and snacks, alongside a motorcycle business as a secondary investment for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES 25,000 at the end of every month.

Mwanasiti is now servicing her 4th loan of KES 120,000 with VisionFund Kenya, and she intends to use this amount to buy potatoes, assorted juices and frying pans to add to her current stock. Mwanasiti plans to use the anticipated income to open a restaurant and hopes to become a successful businesswoman in her hometown.

loans.use: to buy additional juices, frying pans and potatoes to prepare chips and fried potatoes for her customers.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders! Meet Celia, a 39-year-old mother who is married, and is blessed with four adorable children that she really values and treasures. She hails from Chuka area of Kenya, a rural town in the slopes of the famous Mount Kenya. She has been practicing farming for the past 14 years and through mixed farming she has been able to always put food on table for her family. Celia loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one of her cows “kairu” (from a person’s name) and anytime she is attending to her animals she feels very proud.

Profits from selling milk and vegetables have not been sufficient to sustain her family, and she has always wanted to supplement her income by selling cereals.  This is why she is kindly requesting a loan to buy cereals. Chuka area has a ready market for cereals. This is because of the high population rate and hence Celia is assured of immediate profits.

Through a partnership between Juhudi  Kilimo and Kiva, aspiring women such as Celia are assured of achieving their dreams through loans and technical financing. Profits from the loan will be used to fully repay the loan and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
En la fotografía aparece Blanca junto a su esposo.

Blanca de 44 años de edad, estudio una carrera universitaria, es maestra de profesión. Su pareja es comerciante tienen en común 2 hijos,  los cuales son menores de edad y están estudiando educación básica, viven con ellos aún. 

Blanca es docente en una escuela de su comunidad. Es decir, que enseña la educación a niños de primer grado hasta noveno, es una labor que la ha desempeñado desde hace 19 años. Decide dedicarse a esta profesión porque desde que estaba pequeña le llamo la atención eso de enseñar y ayudar a otros a través del estudio, sus padres le enseñaron valores que le permitieron decidir que estudiar. Su lugar de trabajo está a unos 8 kilómetros de su casa, los que recorre en bus todos los días y su horario de trabajo es 8 horas diarias.

El préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de material para la construcción, cemento, hierro y contratar la mano de obra calificada para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, que ya está deteriorada por el pasar del tiempo. El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su casa y por tanto la estabilidad de sus hijos que estarán en un lugar más seguro que antes.
La necesidad a satisfacer será la de tener un lugar más digno para vivir.

Los sueños del cliente son  ayudar a todos los niños y jóvenes atreves de la enseñanza, y que ellos logren sus sueños de la mano con el estudio que es una herramienta que transforma las sociedades, hacia un desarrollo mejor. Para su familia sueña con que sus hijos logren terminar una carrera universitaria y  les permita ser mejores personas dentro de la sociedad, espera para el futura ser una persona proactiva en las decisiones de su comunidad y su familia y encaminarlos al desarrollo laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Blanca and her husband appear in the photograph.

Blanca is 44 years old and completed a college degree as a teacher.  Her husband is a businessman.  Together, they have two young children who are in primary school and live with them.  Blanca is a teacher at a local school.  She teaches first grade up to ninth grade.  She has performed this work for 19 years.  She decided to devote herself to this field because since she was a young girl, she was attracted to teaching and helping others through education.  Her parents taught her the values that allowed her to decide what to study.  Her workplace is 8 kilometers from her house and she travels there everyday by bus.  She works eight hours a day.

She will use the loan to purchase construction materials, cement, iron and pay for qualified labor to repair her home since it is in poor shape.  The loan will help her to repair the home and provide stability to her children since they will be in a safer place.  This loan will satisfy their need of having a dignified place to live in.  The client's dreams are to help all of the children through education and for them to reach their own dreams through education, which is the tool that transforms societies.  

For her family, she dreams that her children will be able to complete a college education and be better people in society.  She hopes that in the future she will be a proactive person in her community and in her family, and that she can lead them to develop professionally and personally.

loans.use: purchase construction materials, cement, iron and hire qualified laborers to repair their home since it is in poor shape.

loans.name: Babra's Group

texts.en:
Babra's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Babra is 16 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past two years, Babra has been working hard to manage her small clothing business, which sells second hand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Babra has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy different types of clothes to sell and will help Babra to generate greater profits and have a better standard of living. Barbra hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a rich woman. 

Babra is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm oil and lemon juice, which will be resold

loans.name: Ukurikiyeyezu

texts.en:
Ukurikiyeyezu is 26 years old and single. 

He sells different items in his boutique. With the loan, he wants to buy more boutique items such as soaps, salts and cooking oil for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business for a better future.

loans.use: To add in his boutique items such as soaps, salts and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 45-year-old businesswoman living in Ghana’s greater-Accra region. She has been successfully operating an egg business for three months now. Alice likes to serve her customers well and they appreciate her service. She would like to take a fifth loan to expand her business. With the loan, she intends to increase her purchases of eggs to improve sales and profits. The loan will also help her to improve her standard of living and provide for her family (husband and children).

loans.use: To purchase additional eggs to improve sales and profits.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, Maggi, salt, pepper, rice, flour, etc., wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Look Up To God Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Look Up to God, which is composed of two persons who are friends residing in the same district. They are selling cloth and eggs.

Gifty, the group’s representative, is the cloth seller. She is 36 years old and did not attend school. She single and stays alone without any children. To cover her personal needs, Gifty has been selling cloth at her home for about seven years. She gets her supplies from a market in Ghana. 

With the goal of increasing their businesses, Gifty and the other member of the group are requesting a loan for the sixth time from ID Ghana.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to sell to customers.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is a peasant who lives in the city outskirts. Being a single mother, she had to devise a means of survival and started by selling fingers of bananas, and slowly managed to raise enough money to buy a bunch, then two, and finally acquired a loan to be able to buy more. 

She is now grateful that the business is doing well. She is applying for a loan to buy much more of the banana bunches, since they will cost less if she buys in bulk.

Teddy is grateful to the Kiva lenders and UGAFODE for the financial support. She is a hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy green bananas for selling

loans.name: Teresa Dominga

texts.es: Teresa en su sueño por poder ver finalizada su vivienda, acude nuevamente a AFODENIC, para poder seguir invirtiendo en la mejora de su vivienda, esta vez comprará materiales de construcción como bloques, cemento, hierro y piedrín. Su esposo le continua ayudando con los gastos del hogar, y juntos como familia están saliendo adelante. Espera poder muy pronto terminada su vivienda, y así poder ver el fruto de todos los esfuerzos que ha hecho en su vida para mejorar
texts.en: To achieve her dream of being able to finish her house, Teresa has turned to AFODENIC again to keep investing in home improvements. This time, she will buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, iron and gravel. Her husband is still helping her with the household expenses and together as a family they are getting ahead. She hopes to finish her house soon and then see the fruits of all her efforts she has made in her life to improve.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, iron and gravel.

loans.name: Illary Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ILLARY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yuli Karen ella es soltera y tiene 44 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de venta de joyas, la socia vende aretes, collares y pulseras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de joyas. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar aretes, pulseras y collares.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “ILLARY” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cuzco in the province and department of Cuzco.  

Yuli Karen is a member who is single and 44 years old. She works in her business selling jewelry. She sells earrings, necklaces and bracelets. She works from 8:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m. She has had this business for 8 years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to expand the jewelry selling business. She is asking for the loan to buy earrings, bracelets and necklaces.  

The other members have businesses selling snacks, selling clothes, a convenience store and a restaurant.

She is grateful to the people who are a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy earrings, bracelets and necklaces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more used carpets, cupboards, DVDs and furniture for resale.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Ebenezer, composed of three people who live in the same district. They sell fish. 

The group's representative, Sarah, is standing on the left in the photo. She is 55 years old. Sarah is married to Jonathan. The couple have one dependent child. Sarah lives with her husband and child. Sarah has been selling smoked fish at the market for 10 years now. Sarah gets her stock from the wholesale cold stores, smokes it and sells it to customers. 

This is the fifth time that Sarah will benefit from a loan from ID Ghana. Faced with growing customer demand, Sarah aims to increase her working capital and her level of business so that she can better respond to her customers' needs. This is why Sarah is requesting a loan from ID Ghana, together with the other members.

loans.use: To buy fish from the wholesale cold stores to smoke and sell to customers.

loans.name: Iye

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Iye she is a 42-year-old from Goderich Western Urban in Freetown. She is married with 4 children.  She began her business to empower herself. 

Iye runs a general stock business; she sells a variety of rice, soft drink and pure water. She has been running this business for 5 years. She works at the business 11 hours per day and 6 days per week. Iye says that sometimes purchasing power is very low.

Iye has requested a loan in order to buy a greater variety of cigarettes, soft drinks and pure water for resale.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and change her status of living. In the future, she plans to expand his business more than even. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cigarettes, soft drinks and pure water for resal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for resale.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Mohamed from Goderich Western urban area in Freetown. He is married with 3 children. He started this business because he wanted to take care of his family's welfare. 

Mohamed runs a general stock business; He sells soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes. He has been running this business since 2004. He works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week.  Mohamed says that despite his hardship he desires to educate his children.

Mohamed has requested a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.  The extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children and improve his standard of living. In the future, He plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarette, drinks and provisions to expand her business.

loans.name: Unisa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Unisa from Goderich Western Urban in Freetown.  He has 3 children; He began his business because he wanted to create a permanent source of income to take care of his family.   

Unisa runs an electronics business within a busy market area; he sellin a variety of electronic part and devices.   He has been running this business for 8 years. He works at the business from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm, 6 days per week.  Unisa says that the major problem for his business is insufficient capital to expand his business.

Unisa has requested a loan in order to purchase different kinds of electronics items like cables, lights, fans, plugs, bulbs, radios and switches.  The extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and take care of his family's welfare. In the future, he plans to expand his business more than even. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase electronic items like cables, lights, fans, plugs, bulbs, radios and switches for resale.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Abu from OIC Ropolo Northern in Sierra Leone. He is married with one child.  He started this business to be self reliant and to be able to take care of his family. Abu runs a retail business. He sells soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes. He has been running this business since 1999. He works at the business 12 hours per day, six days per week.  Abu says that the main challenge to his business is relocation of his shop.  

Abu has requested a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes. The extra income from this loan will allow him to become a successful business man and improve his standard of living. In the future, He plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soft drink, pure water, butter, soap and cigarette.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio de 65 años de edad,  estudio hasta octavo  grado.  Esta acompañado desde hace 6 años, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar tienen una  hija en común que esta pequeña y vive con ellos. 

Julio se dedica  a la pesca artesanal. Se dedica  a esta labor desde que es joven un tío le enseño a pescar y a ganarse la vida de esa forma, decidió dedicarse a esta actividad ya que no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia. Otra actividad económica que él tiene es el de electricista. El lugar de trabajo del cliente está a unos 4 kilómetros de su casa, los que recorre a pie, a veces en bicicleta y a veces en carro, y su actividad de pescador se desarrolla la mayor parte en las noches su horario es de aproximado 6 horas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar  un trasmayo para la pesca artesanal, que es una red de 5 metros de largo que se usa para la pesca. Además, de eso comprara dos paletas de remo para movilizarse y hacer su trabajo. La necesidad a satisfacer será la de tener las herramientas necesarias para hacer  lo que le gusta  y seguir sacando a su familia adelante 

Los sueños del cliente son un poner su propio negocio de venta de pescado, ya que actualmente  no lo tiene. Para su familia desea darles lo que ellos necesitan para que alcancen sus objetivos. El préstamo le ayudara a mejor la productividad de su negocio y tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar los ingresos a través de la venta y así cubrir necesidades puntuales que tiene.
texts.en:
Julio is 65 years old and studied through the eighth grade. He has been in a relationship for the past six years. His partner takes care of the household duties. They have a young daughter who lives with them.

Julio is a small-time fisherman. He has worked in this trade from the time he was a young man. An uncle taught him how to fish and now he earns his living in this manner. Julio decided to devote himself to this trade because there was no other way for him to help his family. Another trade that he engages in is his work as an electrician. His workplace is located about four kilometers from his house, so he travels by foot. Sometimes he will travel on bicycle or in a car. His work as a fisherman occurs mostly at night and his schedule lasts approximately six hours.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to buy a driftnet for his fishing business. The net measures five meters in length and will be used for catching fish. In addition, Julio will purchase two rowing paddles so that he can travel and perform his work. Having the proper tools will satisfy this particular need, which will help him to continue the job he enjoys and to keep supporting his family.

Julio dreams of having his own business of selling fish, which does not exist at the moment. He wants to provide his family with what they need so that they can reach their goals. This loan will improve the productivity of his business, which will give him the opportunity to increase his earnings from what he sells and to cover unexpected needs as they arise.

loans.use: to buy a driftnet and rowing paddles for his fishing business.

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es: A sus 69 años de edad Edith solo tiene su pequeña tienda con lo que se mantiene por lo que tiene como prioridad surtirla pero tiene un problema y es que su tienda no es muy grande pero para competir necesita muchos productos, solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos de la canasta familiar y poder seguir con su tienda que es lo único que le da de comer a esta humilde pero muy trabajadora mujer que solo sueña con seguir operando su tienda y envejecer atiendo su gente.
texts.en:
At 69 years of age, Edith only has her small store to support herself. Her priority is to keep it stocked, but her problem is that her store is not very large. In order to remain competitive, she needs many products. Edith is requesting a loan in order to buy household goods. This will enable her to continue her store since it is the only means of supporting herself.

This hardworking woman’s only dream is to keep her store in operation so that she can continue to serve people as she gets older.

loans.use: to buy household goods such as beans, eggs, corn cakes, brown sugar, milk, and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: José Fredis

texts.es:
José tiene 36 años de edad, está acompañado pero  aún no es padre de familia, solo vive con su pareja y los dos se apoyan mutuamente.

José  se dedica a las construcciones de albañil, y sus trabajos los entrega por obras terminadas y es así como ha logrado salir adelante.

EL crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales de construcción, ya que su presupuesto no cubrió los gastos que tenía previstos.

En un futuro, José quiere poner el piso en su casa para tener una mejor vivienda, comprar más muebles y electrodomésticos.
texts.en: José, 36, is in a common-law relationship, but he is not a parent yet.  He lives with his partner and they support each other.  He is a construction worker, and he is paid in installments for completed jobs, and this is how he has managed to get ahead.   He needs to loan to purchase building materials since his budget did not cover expenses as he had anticipated.  In the future, José wishes to install a floor in his house to improve his home, purchase more furniture, and appliances.

loans.use: to purchase building materials since his budget did not cover expenses as he had anticipated.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene una menor hija, radica en el distrito de La Matanza, la comunidad se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, y está ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece al departamento de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, además trabaja como jornal agrícola en la empresa Natucultura. Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4000 nuevos soles para la construcción de su casa, creando un mejor ambiente de trabajo para ella y sus clientes que presentan buenas perspectivas de clientes. De esta manera generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 44 years old, married, and has a dependent daughter. She lives in the La Matanza district, where the community works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It is located in the Morropon province, which belongs to the Piura region in the northern coast of Peru. 

She makes a living selling beer. She also works as an agricultural laborer for the company Natucultura. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 4000 nuevos soles for the construction of her house in order to create a better work environment for herself and her customers, who provide good prospects. This way, she will earn a greater income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Doña Maura es comerciante de pulpería desde la comodidad de su hogar, ella mantiene sus gastos gracias a este negocio y el apoyo de su esposo que labora en una institución del gobierno, Maura mantiene sus ingresos porque se ayuda a través de financiamiento que solicita a largo plazo teniendo la dicha de ser beneficiada con Kiva y Afodenic, requiere de otro crédito para invertir nuevamente en el pequeño negocio con productos como granos básicos, cereales, enlatados también desea probar vendiendo un poco de cosméticos lo cual es muy demandado.
texts.en:
Doña Maura is a merchant who operates a store from the comfort of her own home. She is able to keep up with her expenses thanks to this business and the support of her husband, who works for a government institution.

Maura is able to maintain her earnings as a result of the benefits gained from long-term loans that she requested from Kiva and AFODENIC. She is requesting another loan so that she can invest once again in her business. Maura will purchase products such as basic staples, cereals, and canned goods. She also wants to try selling a few cosmetics since there is great demand.

loans.use: to buy basic staples, cereals, canned goods, and cosmetics to sell in her store.

loans.name: Daniel Elias

texts.es:
Construyendo el país de la eterna primavera y del desarrollo, don Daniel de 32 años de edad soltero con un hijo que apenas cinco meses de nacido, se a vuelto el más grande reto para el ya que tiene que hacer el esfuerzo de luchar por su familia cada día para darles un buen futuro y educación a su hijito.

La actividad principal de el es la albañilería en la comunidad donde el vive, desde niño el tomo la decisión de aprender a construir casas de su comunidad dicha profesión a la venido trabajando desde hace 9 largos años de sacrificio pero que lo ha hecho con mucho orgullo parque lo hace por su familia porque necesitan de un ingreso económico para la satisfacción de las necesidades de su familia y para el desarrollo de su comunidad donde vive.

El propósito del crédito que el desea realizar es para la compra de herramientas de construcción en la albañilería ya que es de importancia para el y sin esas herramientas el no podrá trabajar para seguir construyendo en su comunidad.

Uno de los más grandes sueños de don Daniel es ver crecer a su hijo y darle educación para que llegue a ser un profesional y poner una constructora para el servicio de su comunidad y el desarrollo en un futuro.
texts.en:
Helping construct the "country of eternal spring" [Guatemala's nickname], 32-year-old Daniel is a single father of a boy who is just barely 5 months old. This has become his most important challenge because he needs to work hard each day to give his family a good future and ensure an education for his little boy.

He mainly works in construction in his community. When he was a child, he decided to learn to build houses in his community, which he has done for 9 long years full of sacrifice but also full of pride because he does it for his family. They need a source of income to cover the cost of the family's necessities and for the sake of the development of the community in which he lives.
