She dreams of continuing her quality of life because she is very depressed because of the situation she is facing.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Javier Esneider

texts.es:
Javier vive en Rionegro y vende ropa en las veredas cerca de este municipio. Lleva dos años vendiedo su mercancía por encargo o puerta a puerta.

Con el crédito Kiva podrá comprar mas mercancía y asi poder apoyar económicamente a su madre. Este seria su primer préstamo con Interactuar.

Javier tiene el sueño de montar un dia su proprio almacen de ropa para no tener que vender puerta a puerta. 

¡Puedes aportar al futuro de este joven emprendedor con un crédito Kiva!
texts.en:
Javier lives in Rionegro and sells clothing in the nearby neighborhoods.  He has been doing this for two years, selling door to door.

He will be able to buy more merchandise with this Kiva loan and be able to support his mother.  This will be his first loan through Interactuar.

Javier dreams of setting up his own clothing store on day, so that he will not have to go door to door.

Can you support this young entrepreneur’s future with a Kiva loan?

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Gregoria Catalina

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 62 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su conyugue en el Caserio de la Maravilla, una comunidad pequeña que se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia perteneciente al distrito de Buenos Aires, ubicado en la Provincia de Morropon, perteneciente al departamento de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para la implementación de su bodega, de esta manera estará más surtida y atraerá mayor cantidad de clientes, posterior mejora de sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 62 years old and in a common-law relationship. She lives with her companion in the village of Maravilla, a small community that is known for agriculture and livestock breeding. It is in the District of Buenos Aires in Morropon Province, which is part of the Department of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Gregoria has been selling groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, and soups for several years. Her business is located in her home. In addition, she raises and sells poultry. She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,200 PEN so that she can keep her store in operation. This will help her to acquire more stock and attract a larger number of customers. As a result, she will improve her earnings and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products in order to keep her store in operation.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is a businesswoman from Ozamiz. She is 42 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She sells snacks and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Marites is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy ingredients for snack vending. Marites continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Sandra Miley

texts.es:
Sandra es una muy trabajadora mujer de dedicada netamente al trabajo pues sabe que de ella depende ya sus padres de avanzada edad, vende mercancía puerta a puerta en busca de un cliente que le agrade los estilos que vende. 

Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una vitrina y variedad de ropa de hombre y dama con la ayuda de este crédito lograra que su mama venda desde la comodidad de la casa y juntas trabajaran por mejorar las condiciones de vida.

Su gran sueño es tener un almacén y ver que su madre disfrute de su vida sin tener que trabajar pues le quiere retribuir todo lo que ha hecho en vida por ella.
texts.en:
Sandra is a very hardworking woman, dedicated to her work because she knows that her parents are elderly and depend on her.  She sells merchandise door-to-door, searching for customers who will like the items she sells.

She wants to request a loan to buy a display case and a variety of men’s and women’s clothing.  With the help of this loan, she and her mother will be able to sell from the comfort of her home and together improve their quality of life.

Her greatest dream is to have a store and seen her mother enjoy her life without having to work.  She wants to repay her for all she has done for her.

loans.use: to buy a display case and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for crop maintenance

loans.name: Sharron Denisse

texts.es:
Sharron es una mujer de 21 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene una hija y se dedica a la producción y venta de chinelas bordadas
Ella es una persona, humilde, de buen carácter, luchadora, emprendedora y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en el barrio de ‘plan 3000’ situado al sur de la ciudad, esta zona se caracteriza por la creciente población desde hace varios años y por el incremento de la producción en todas las ramas.
Sharron es de tez morena, estatura mediana, pelo largo color castaño, su forma de vestir es a la moda y su negocio lo realiza en un puesto de venta improvisado cerca al lugar donde vive. Ella realiza la compra de chinelas para verano y también de biyuteria, borda y decora las chinelas con la biyutería dándoles un toque especial y moderno, luego se ocupa de la venta.
Ella sueña tener un puesto fijo de venta donde poder exponer sus creaciones y tener clientes estables. Ella desea mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia para eso ella necesita realizar la compra por mayor de chinelas y biyuteria para abaratar gastos y costos y tener material con cual trabajar.
Es por esos motivos que Sharron solicita un préstamo para al compra por mayor de chinelas y biyuteria y con los beneficios mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija.
texts.en:
Sharron, 21, lives with her partner and daughter, and she makes and sells embroidered flip-flops.  She is a humble person with a kind disposition who is enterprising, determined and very hard working.   She conducts business in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood in the southern part of the city, which is known for its growing population over the last few years and for its increase in production in all areas.

Sharron has a dark complexion, is of average height and has long, dark hair.  She dresses fashionably and works out of an improvised stall set up near her home.  She buys the flip-flops for the summer season and decorates them with beads to make them special and modern.  Then she puts them out for sale.

Her dream is to have a fixed sales point where she can exhibit her creations and attend to fixed customers.  She wants to improve her family's quality of life and therefore needs to buy flip-flops and beads wholesale to reduce costs and have material on hand to work.  This is why Sharron is requesting a loan to buy flip-flops and beads wholesale so she can use the profits she earns to improve her daughter's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy flip-flops and beads for embroidery.

loans.name: Rizalie

texts.en: Rizalie signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the financial help that PMPC has extended to her. Rizalie is making good sales these days and wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eve is 51 years old and three of her children are still in school.

Eve has a buy and sell of dry goods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like pillowcases, blankets, bags, etc. to sell to her customers.

Eve has been in this business for two years. In the future, Eve would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more pillowcases, blankets, and bags to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Delia has been in this business for one year now.

Delia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan tiene 39 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Buenos Aires provincia de Morropon, departamento de Piura. Reside en una zona rural, en la cual se dedican a la agricultura (arroz, platano), ganaderia(crianza de ganado vacuno, bovino, caprino, equino), avicultura y comercio de los mismos.

Juan se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral como son patos, gallinas y pavos, asi como también a la comercializacion de los mismos, además se dedica a la pesca de agua dulce, comercializando los peces. Él ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de s/ 500,00 Nuevos soles para la compra de aves de corral y posterior venta a mejor precio, de esta manera generara mayores ingresos para él y la tranquilidad de sus familiares.
texts.en:
Juan, 39, is single and lives with his parents in the district of Buenos Aires, province of Morropon, in the department of Piura.  He lives in a rural area and works in agriculture (rice, bananas), livestock farming (cattle, sheep, goats, horses), poultry farming and sales.

Juan raises and sells barnyard poultry such as ducks, chickens and turkey.   He also catches and sells freshwater fish.  The loan he is requesting through Edpyme Alternative, in the amount of 500 PEN, is to buy barnyard poultry to sell at a good price.  This way he can earn more income so his family will not have to worry.

loans.use: To buy more barnyard poultry.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
This is Jessa, 28, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her three children. She manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jessa operates a peanut butter making business. She buys raw peanuts and other ingredients needed in making her product from the market, processes them, repacks them and sells them per piece to individuals, general store owners and the local community. Peanut butter is repacked in 250 and 500 gram plastic bottles. She also sells fish and frozen food products for additional income. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional stock of raw ingredients used in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Jessa wants to add, grow and expand her business. She desires to save more so she can buy their own house and lot and give her children a better education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional ingredients and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 55 years old and a widow with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Sylvia has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Mekaletioa

texts.en: Mekaletioa is 29 years old and married with two children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. Mekaletioa has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, material, brushes, stencils, wooden carved designs and rollers. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, material, brushes, stencils, wooden carved designs and rollers

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She is married and has an internet cafe business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts and an additional unit of computer for her business.

Emma has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and an additional computer for her business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of glass and aluminum supplies business in the Philippines.

Corazon requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more glass and aluminum supplies. 

Corazon has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more glass and aluminum supplies for her business

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es una mujer de 26 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y se dedica a la venta de comida.
Ella es una persona amable, divertida, emprendedora, comprensiva, conversadora, luchadora y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘huayna potosi’ de su ciudad, un lugar caracterizado por el creciente comercio y su respectiva demanda.
Alejandra es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, estatura mediana y su vestimenta es a la moda, ella vende comida típica nacional como; sajta de pollo (picante de pollo), sopa de chairo (papa deshidratada), picante de lengua (lengua de vaca picante). Ella sueña ser dueña de un restaurante amplio, cómodo y generar mejores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograr sus metas ella necesita realizar la compra de sillas y mesas para su negocio para mejorar la atención de sus clientes.
Es por esos motivos que Alejandra solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles de restaurante y comenzar a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 26 years old, single and has no children. She makes a living selling meals.

Alejandra is friendly, fun, enterprising, understanding, talkative, plucky and very hard-working. She has a business in the Huayna Potosi area of her city, a place known for its growing trade sector, and increasing demand.

Alejandra is dark skinned and has long black hair. She is of medium height, and fashionably dressed. Alejandra sells typical dishes such as "sajta de pollo" (a chicken soup), "sopa de chairo" (a potato soup) and "picante de lengua" (a cow tongue soup). Alejandra's dream is to own a large and comfortable restaurant and to earn a higher income in order to improve her quality of life. In order to achieve her goals, Alejandra needs to buy chairs and tables for her business, so as to improve customer service.

Alejandra is therefor applying for a loan in order to buy restaurant furniture and start to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy restaurant furniture and start to achieve her dreams.

loans.name: Jose Asencion

texts.es:
José de 37  años de edad,  padre soltero con dos hijos menores de edad, es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en el occidente del país.  Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio  obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar, ingeniería civil.  En la actualidad lucha día  a día para  brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica el servicio de ebanistería y elaboración de muebles, actividad que la inicio por ayuda y herencia de su papa que también se dedicaba a  dicha actividad.  El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias,  el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar materia prima para la elaboración de muebles. Como madera, pintura, barniz, make, sierra, clavos, tornillos, ciner. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. y de dicha forma poder lograr sus sueños y metas como formar a sus hijos en profesionales, y  a su terminar de construir su casa.  José agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old and a single father to two children. José comes from León in the west of Nicaragua. José is hard-working, responsible and has a desire to prosper. Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, José was not able to study at university and had to work from a young age. Nevertheless, he would have like to have studied civil engineering. José now fights every day in order to offer his children a better future.

Thanks to his efforts and his will to get ahead, José works as a carpenter and builds furniture. He started this business with the help of his father, who also worked in this trade. José's business is in his home. He works around ten hours per day. This loan will be used to invest in working capital. José will use it 
to buy basic materials - such as wood, paint, varnish, a saw, nails, screws, and paint thinner - for making furniture so that, in the not-too-distant future he can earn a better income. With a higher income, José can achieve his goals and dreams to give his children a university education and of finishing building his house. José is grateful to Kiva investors who are supporting poor countries - such as Nicaragua - and giving people the opportunity to have a decent job.

loans.use: to buy basic materials - such as wood, paint, varnish, a saw, nails, screws, and paint thinner - for making furniture.

loans.name: Irinia

texts.en: Irinia is married with eight children and operates a service-based business with her husband for a living. For the 10 years she has been running a transportation business, Irinia is happy to say that it  helps her family a lot. Some of her children have their own family and live on their own. She never stops finding ways just to improve their business. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microfinance to buy vehicle spare parts to improve their vulcanizing shop. In the future, she wants to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts to improve her vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge en el distrito de Morropon una comunidad de clima caluroso que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, y los fines de semana a la venta de comidas como es: tamales, hornados con una antigüedad de más de 10 años. Adicionalmente ella comercializa con frutos de estación, como Mango, Limón. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para poder comprar mas cerveza y limón para poder abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and lives with her partner in the Morropon district of the Morropon province. Morropon is part of the Piura region of Peru's northern coast. Here the climate is hot and the locals make a living in farming, trade and cattle-raising.

For over ten years, María has made a living selling beer and, at the weekends, foods such as tamales and roasted pork. In addition she sells seasonal fruits such as mangoes and lemons. María's business is in her home. María has applied for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more beers and lemons. This will stock up her business and María will be able to generate a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy beers and lemons.

loans.name: Luis Hernan

texts.es:
Luis tiene 42 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, vive en casa familiar con conyugue e hijos en el Caserio Chisca Blanca, Distrito de Morropon, provincia de Morropon y departamento de Piura es una zona rural, en la cual se dedican a la agricultura( arroz, frejol, yucao), además a la ganaderia y comercio.

Luis se dedica a la compra y venta de fréjol de palo, también comercializa yuca, adicionalmente trabaja en el campo como jornalero de su propio terreno. Él ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar abono para su plátano que ha sembrado lo que le permitirá tener una mejor producto y venderlo a mejor precio de esta manera genera mayor ingreso a su familia mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, 42, is single and lives with his common-law wife and children in the rural area Chisca Blanca in the district and province of Morropon in the department of Piura.  The locals in this rural area work in agriculture (rice, beans, yucca) and in livestock farming and commerce.

Luis buys and sells beans and yucca.  He also works as a day laborer on his own land.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer for his banana plantation in order to improve the crop and sell it at a better price.  This will generate mroe income for his family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his banana crop.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liza is 36 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Liza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Liza has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of frozen products business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jennifer would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to sow and look after this year second harvest of corn and beans.

loans.name: Enrique Santiago

texts.es:
Uno de los servicios públicos de mucho contacto con las personas de Suchitepéquez  es el transporte público.  Las personas suben y bajan para transportarse cada día.  Cada una de ellas tienen su historia.  Pero también los transportistas o choferes también una variedad de historias personales y vivencias.

Enrique, de 35 años y padre de 5 hijos, aprendió a ser chofer mientras vivía con su padre y fue como él también lo aprendió, con un poco de ahorro que el tenia  compró un vehículo y se dedicó a este servicio público de transporte.
El ha solicitado un préstamo para darle el mantenimiento requerido por el vehículo y poder servir de esa manera a su ciudad, además que su actividad laboral es una fuente de ingresos para su familia.
Dentro de sus metas es lograr comprar otro vehículo y ampliar su negocio.  Y como resultado darles un mejor panorama económico a sus hijos.  Mientras los pasajeros de suben y bajan en su vehículo llevan sus propias vidas como Diego la suya.
texts.en:
One of the busiest public services in Suchitepéquez is public transportation.  People from all walks of life use it every day.  The transporters and drivers also have a variety of personal stories and experiences to tell.

Enrique, 35, is the father of five children.  He learned to be a driver while living with his father.  With a small amount of savings he bought a vehicle and started working in public transportation.

He is requesting a loan to provide maintenance for his vehicle in order to serve the city.  His work activity is a source of income for his family.

One of his goals is to buy another vehicle and expand his business so he can offer a better economic situation to his children.  Meanwhile, passengers come and go and lead their own lives, just like Enrique does.

loans.use: To buy land.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 49 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Crispina is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Crispina has been in the pig fattening business for six years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: B.c. Rio Grande Unidos Group

texts.es: Pablo, tiene 49 años de edad, es casado, tiene 8 hijos y reside en una aldea de Intibucá junto a su esposa y 6 de sus hijos. Siempre se a dedicado a la agricultura con su familia. Cultiva maíz, frijoles y papas. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local principalmente la papa. El préstamo que solicita es el cuarto ciclo y es por 5,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y semillas de papas para una nueva siembra. Su plan es mejorar los cultivos, seguir produciendo y mejorar la calidad de vida con su familia. El préstamo que ha solicitado es en forma grupal, el grupo se llama B.C. Rio Grande Unidos, formado por 10 personas que se dedican a la agricultura de granos básicos y papas, todos viven en la misma comunidad. El total de préstamo grupal es por 91,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y semillas de papas para volver a sembrar. En la foto se identifican así: De pie a la izquierda esta Jeremías, Víctor, Pablo, Dionicio y Pedro a la derecha. sentados están a la izquierda María Dolores, Agustina, Felicita, María Leonza y José Cupertino a la derecha.
texts.en:
Pablo, 49, is married and has eight children.  He lives in the village of Intibucá with his wife and six of his children.  He has always worked in agriculture with his family.  He grows corn, beans and potatoes.  He sells mainly potatoes at the local market.  The loan he is requesting in the amount of 5,000 HNL is to buy fertilizer and potato seeds for a new planting season.  His plan is to improve his crops, continue producing and improve his family's quality of life.

The loan is being requested through the communal bank B.C. Rio Grande Unidos, which consists of ten members who work in agriculture growing basic grains and potatoes.  They all live in the same community.  The full amount of the loan is 91,000 HNL and it is to buy fertilizer and potato seeds.  In the photograph, standing left to right are Jeremías, Víctor, Pablo, Dionicio and Pedro.  Seated from left to right are María dolores, Agustina, Felicita, María Leonza and José Cupertino.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seeds to plant.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 48 years old and married with seven children.  With one child in school, Beverly works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a dried fish making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

Beverly has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Beverly would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Emelita has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Emelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Elpedia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Elpedia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 50 years old and has six children. Victoria is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Victoria has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Victoria has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Eutemia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Eutemia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Eutemia is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Eutemia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Avencia

texts.en:
Avencia works hard to support her family. Avencia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Avencia has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Avencia has been in this business for 20 years now.

Avencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita works hard to support her family. Emelita is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Emelita has requested a 27,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Emelita has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Emelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs and bags of cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs and bags of cement to construct a pig unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs and bags of cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs and bags of cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs and bags of cement

loans.name: Paul-Jumbe

texts.en:
Paul-Jumbe, known as P.J., is 49 years old. He is an elder in his church, the chairman of a market and is a modest man wondering why people tend to choose him as a leader. He left school in grade 9 to work and bring up his 6 brothers and sisters, and got married young. He and his wife, have 8 children. 3 are married and he dreams of sending the younger ones to college. He has a shop selling over-the-counter medication. He is warm and caring and people come to ask for his advice on many matters. 
He is asking for a loan to buy a stock of gasifying cook stoves and biomass pellets to sell in his shop. He wants to use his leadership to promote and sell a healthier, faster, cheaper alternative to charcoal, because charcoal is bad for people’s health and destroys the forests of his country. He sees the stoves and pellets as an extension of his business and hopes to develop it more and maybe open more stores some day.

loans.use: to pay for a stock of cooking stoves and biomass fuel

loans.name: Norris

texts.en:
Norris is 48 years old. He and his wife Veronica are shown together in this photo. They started a restaurant 5 years ago in a market in Lusaka. They also raise quails and make peanut butter to sell. They have 5 children. They all go to school. The oldest is in college and the youngest twin girls, Hope and Faith, are in 1st grade. His dream is to be able to send them all to the best schools possible so they will be better people in society and have a better life. 
He is asking for a loan to buy a stock of gasifying cook stoves and biomass pellets to sell to other restaurant owners in the market. He is a respected leader there and wants to promote and sell a healthier, faster, cheaper alternative to the charcoal they use to cook in their restaurants. He also wants to help save the forests of Zambia, which are being cut down to make charcoal. The money he will gain will give him capital to develop his restaurant and a food supply business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cooking stoves and biomass fuel

loans.name: Karanjung Indah Group

texts.en:
The Karanjung Indah group makes their payments and all the members attend the meetings. MUK’s staff come to the field to collect the payments. Most of the group members breed pigs. The pigs grow well and are without disease. They sell the pigs for a satisfactory price and the group earns some profit. Six of the members decided to resign from the group and change their business to farming at the moment. They will join the pig program again after they finish harvesting the crops.
Ni Komang, as head of the group, also raises pigs for fattening. She sells the pigs every three months. She said thank you to all the lenders, Kiva and MUK for their support. Now she can improve her income and support her husband. 
The group has one new member. With five members, the Karanjung Indah group continues to borrow from MUK to expand its business. They want to succeed and improve their families' welfare. Ni Komang will use the loan to buy two more piglets for fattening and feed. Currently, she already has a sow. Cages have been prepared to accommodate the piglets when they are born. She has a plan to sell the piglets. Her husband is very supportive of her efforts as they have improved the welfare of his family. Ni Komang hopes her efforts will be successful.

loans.use: to buy two more piglets for fattening and feed

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 20 years old and unwed with no children. She has a small farm where she raises cattle to earn an income by selling meat to the local supermarkets. She has been doing this for two years. Caroline needs a loan to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, cattle feed and a new wooden tub for water. She just joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. Caroline will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, cattle feed and a new wooden tub for water

loans.name: Leovigilda

texts.en: Leovigilda is 54 years old, married to a driver, and blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost two years, and earns a net income of 500 PHP daily. Her net income goes to her savings for her granddaughter. Due to insufficient funds, she would like a loan amounting to 30,000 PHP to purchase noodles, eggs, bread, rice and candies to sell. She is looking forward to improving her business so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase noodles, eggs, bread, rice and candies to sell.

loans.name: Soncia

texts.en: Soncia is a 62-year-old widow from Oroquieta. She runs a store that gives her a promising income that supports her family. Soncia is a full-fledged member of Paglaum MPC and is happy with the programs and services that she has availed from the cooperative. Now, Soncia is increasing her inventories and has borrowed the needed capital from PMPC. She will restock her store with basic commodities. Soncia is saving for her retirement.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic inventories

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. Lorna is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Lorna has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married with three children. Maribel is 33 years old and lives in Tudela-Dolores, Clarin, Philippines.
Maribel is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides.
Maribel has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Maribel hopes to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en: Yohanna remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Yohanna, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yohanna  is ambitious and is aiming to reap more than 30 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Yohanna   With this loan, Yohanna is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 43 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene tres hijos y se dedica a la confección de faldas y polleras.
Ella es amable, divertida, emprendedora, fuerte, luchadora, comprensiva, comunicadora y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas, a una altura de cuatro mil metros sobre el nivel del mar, la lengua principal del área es el aymara pero se utiliza el español para el comercio.
Sonia es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, ojos obscuros, estatura mediana. Su negocio es la confección de polleras (ropa típica tradicional), la cual lleva colores y diseños a la moda que es utilizada por personas de vestir tradicional (cholitas). Su pareja (está en la foto) la acompaña en todas las actividades y se encarga de la venta de polleras en un puesto de venta en inmediaciones del lugar.
Ella desea mejorar su calidad de vida realizando unas refacciones a su vivienda que también es su taller de costura, para conseguir su objetivo ella necesita incrementar su mercadería para abastecer a sus clientes y generar mejores ingresos económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas por mayor y con los beneficios refaccionar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sonia is 43 years old. She lives with her partner and has three children. She works making skirts. She is a kind, funny, enterprising, strong, hardworking, tolerant and talkative person. She works in an area called “16 de julio”, where there are a lot of commercial activities. The area is located 4,000 m [around 13,000 ft.] above sea level. Aymara is the main language spoken, but Spanish is used for making business.

Sonia is short and dark skinned. She has dark and long hair, and dark eyes. She works making polleras (traditional skirts), which are worn by women who stick to traditional costumes (cholitas). Her partner (the man in the picture) works with her and is in charge of selling the polleras in a stall that is closely located.

Sonia wants to improve her living conditions. She wants to make some renovations at home, where she also has her workshop. To achieve this goal, she needs to increase her stock in order to better serve her customers and generate more income. This is why Sonia is requesting a loan to buy wholesale fabrics. She will use the profits to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabrics to make traditional skirts (polleras).

loans.name: Sabougnouma 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à OUOROFOURA un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur SEYDOU assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  SABOUGNOUMA 2. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The six members of the Sabougnouma 2 Group are married men with an average age of 35. They have an average of 5 children and live for the most part in traditional families in the village of Ouorofoura, a village in the commune of Dogoni, in the area of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region in Mali. The men work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance organization to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth corn production loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Mr. Seydou, the person sitting at the far right of the photo, grows corn. With his loan, he plans to buy eight 50-kg bags of fertilizer, 10 containers of different quality herbicide, and to pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of land. After the harvest, the output will be sold at the village level in Sikasso to a clientele of men and women, for cash and credit. He plans to earn an average profit of 160,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and the interest, as well as contribute to his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil soltero vive en casa familiar en el Distrito de Morropon, Provincia de Morropon perteneciente al departamento de Piura, costa norte del Perú. Alli la poblacion se dedica a la agricultura, ganaderia y comercio

Él se dedica a la siembra y comercialización de grano; como es el arroz y el frejol caupi; el cliente almacena sus productos y luego los vende a los mayoristas. El cliente está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de granos y poder tener mayor materia prima y luego venderlo a un mejor precio; de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Omar is 29 years old and unmarried. He lives in the family home in Morropon District, Morropon Province, in the department of  Piura on the north coast of Peru. There, the population works in agriculture, livestock and trade.

Omar works in the planting and selling of grain such as rice and black-eyed peas. He stores his products and then sells them to wholesalers. Omar is asking Edpyme Alternativa for $725 (2,000 PEN) to buy grain and have more raw material and then sell it at a better price; thus generating more income for his family and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: by providing working capital (for buying and selling grain)

loans.name: Sabougnouma 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à LOUTANA un village dans la commune de KLELADOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur septième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur FOUSSENI débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  SABOUGNOUMA 1. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The 10 members of the Sabougnouma 1 Group are married men with an average age of 41. They have an average of 5 children and live for the most part in traditional families in Loutana, a village in the commune or Kleladogoni, in the area of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region in Mali. The men work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance organization to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Mr. Fousseni, the person at the far right of the photo, grows corn. With his loan, he plans to buy eight 50-kg bags of fertilizer, 10 containers of different quality herbicide, and to pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of land. After the harvest, the output will be sold at the village level in Sikasso to a clientele of men and women, for cash and credit. He expects to earn an average profit of 160,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and the interest, as well as contribute to his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: Achat des engrais, les frais de labour, payer les frais de labour

loans.name: Khelcom 1" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Khelcom 1 est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. La présidente s’appelle Khady, elle s’active dans la transformation de poisson frais, en poisson fumé. Elle a hérité l’activité de sa grand-mère qui évoluait dans ça il y a des années ; d’ailleurs, Khady a une expérience de plus de 40 ans, elle a même construit sa maison grâce à cette activité. Avec le crédit, elle compte acheter du poisson, du sel et du charbon pour mener à bien son activité. En ce qui concerne la gestion de la maison, c’est elle qui s’occupe de la part la plus grande, aidée de ses grands enfants (le mari étant à la retraite).
Son ambition future sera de construire un étage chez elle et de la mettre en location, afin de mieux préparer sa retraite.
texts.en: The Khelcom 1 Group is a subgroup of a network of female processors of fish products. The group consists of five women who have been active for a few years. They regrouped to benefit from financial assistance that enables them to strengthen their income-generating activities. Khady is the president. She runs a business turning fresh fish into smoked fish. She inherited the business from her grandmother who had been active for many years. Khady herself has over 40 years of experience and she even built her house thanks to this business. With this loan she plans to buy fish, salt, and charcoal to carry out her business. With respect to managing her household, she is responsible for the majority of its expenses, with help from her grandchildren because her husband is retired.  He goal is to add a second floor to her house and to rent it out to better prepare for her retirement.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry helps her husband in managing their own fishing business to make a living. For five years in their business, Cherry earns well and has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC that she used in their business. Improving her business becomes easier with her access to GDMPC.  To improve production, she took a new loan recently to buy fingerlings and feeding supplies for fish production.

Cherry plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fingerlings and feeding supplies for fish production

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is a 59-year-old widow with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Merlie has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Merlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby works hard to support her family. Ruby is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ruby requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Ruby has been in this business for 20 years now.

Ruby would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn has been running a buy-and-sell business for a living. She sells assorted groceries and snacks in their village earning well to sustain her needs. To improve sales, she took a new  loan  from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare food and snacks for sale. 

In the future, Juvelyn wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare food and snacks for sale

loans.name: Feres

texts.es:
Feres tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad de clima caluroso que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, esta ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al servicio de reparación de artefactos eléctricos ya que es Radiotecnica, ademas se dedica a comprar arroz y en menor escala a la crianza de animales menores tales como: pavos, gallinas, patos y su posterior comercialización .

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles ya que desea terminar de pagar un terreno para vivir, el cual ya hizo parte del pago (60%). De esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de s familia.
texts.en:
Feres is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and son in the district of Morropon, a community living in a hot climate where people are engaged in agriculture, trade and livestock. It is located in the province of the same name belonging to the Piura Region, on the north coast of Peru.

She repairs electrical appliances as she is a radio engineer. She also buys rice and, to a lesser extent, raises small livestock such as turkeys, chickens, ducks and then sells them.

She has requested a loan of $725 (2000 PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa because she wants to finish paying for some land on which to live. She has already made part of the payment (60%). In this way, she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy land for a house. She has already paid 60% of the cost.

loans.name: Las Abejitas Group

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 51 años de edad, casada, madre de un hijo y se dedica a la repostería.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, fuerte, alegre, muy social y muy trabajadora, la necesidad por conseguir sus metas la ha llevado a formar una banca de personas con necesidades afines para solicitar un préstamo, su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de sacaba, un lugar de clima cálido y medianamente seco, situado a 13 kilómetros en dirección este de la ciudad.
Sonia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, viste a la moda, sus manos son fuertes y de aspecto seco denotan el cansancio de su trabajo (de pie al costado derecho, sueter verde), su labor es la repostería, hace 20 años que ella se dedica a este arte de preparar o decorar pasteles u otros postres. Su especialidad son las tortas, pasteles, galletas y budines, el secreto para prepararlos es mantener al mínimo la agitación de la masa, una vez agregada la harina, ella opta por usar ingredientes como la levadura o el bicarbonato sódico (polvo de hornear) esto causa que los pasteles sean esponjosos.
Sonia quiere aumentar la cantidad de producción debido a la demanda que tiene, para incrementar sus beneficios económicos y mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograrlo necesita realizar la compra por mayor de; azúcar, huevos, harina, mantequilla, vainilla, chocolate, crema, levadura, etc. Ella desea mantener el mercado de sus clientes.
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para comprar ingredientes de repostería por mayor y con los beneficios mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 51-year-old woman, married and the mother of one child, who works in pastry making.

She is enterprising, determined, strong, happy, very social, and very hard-working. The need to achieve her goals has brought her to form a bank of people with similar needs to apply for a loan. Her business is located in Sacaba, a place with has a warm climate and is moderately dry, located 13 kilometers to the east of the city.

Sonia has a tanned complexion, long black hair, dresses fashionably, and her hands are strong and look dry which indicate the weariness of her work (she is standing on the right side, in a green sweater).  Her work is in pastry making, she has worked for 20 years in this art of preparing or decorating pastries and other deserts.  Her specialties are cakes, pastries, cookies, and puddings.  The secret to prepare those is to limit the mixing of the dough.  Once the flour has been added, she decides to use ingredients such as leavening or sodium bicarbonate (baking powder), and this makes the pastries spongy. 

Sonia wants to increase her production quantity due to the demand that she has, grow her economic profits, and improve her quality of life. To achieve this, she needs to purchase the following products in bulk: sugar, eggs, flour, butter, vanilla, chocolate, cream, leavening, etc. She wants to maintain her customer's market.

It is for these reasons that Sonia applies for a loan to purchase pastry-making ingredients in bulk and with the profits, improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pastry ingredients in bulk and with the profits, improve her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah's group comprises two hardworking women. Sarah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Sarah has been working hard to manage a restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food and other items for the restaurant, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and take care of her parents. Sarah hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food and other items for the restaurant.

loans.name: Anielka De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Anielka de 28  años de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos de menores de edad. Es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del Leon.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor  a sus hijos, y cumplir sus sueños y metas.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, aceite, jabón, tiste, jugos, galletas.  La rutina de trabajo de esta mujer es de unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Anielka agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Anielka, 28 years old, is a single mother with three young children. She is originally from Leon, a place located in the western area of Leon.  Sadly, for the lack of economic resources, she couldn't go to school.  Currently she fights day by day to offer a better future for her children, and to meet her dreams and goals.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she has a general store as her business.  It is a small store that sells food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, oil, soap, tiste (a drink made from a base of corn and chocolate), juices and cookies. This woman's work routine is about 12 hours per day offering her products. The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business in the purchase and sale of food products so that, in the not so distant future, she can have a better income.  Anielka is thankful to the Kiva investors who offer people with limited resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua a way to have better income.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business in the sale of food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, break, eggs, detergent, oil, soap, tiste (a drink made from a base of corn and chocolate), juices and cookies.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 48-years-old and married with four children who are in school.  Charita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Charita has been in this business for 9 years.

In the future, Charita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el Centro Poblado Menor: Laynas, Distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad de clima seco y caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella brinda servicios de elaboración y venta de Chicha de Jora, piqueos tipicos de la zona y ademas venta de cerveza, realizando esta actividad desde hace 5 años. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra materiales de construcion; como calamina, adobe y mano de abra para la ampliacion y mejoramiento del local de su negocio, esto le permitira obtener más cientes, lo que le generará mayores ingresos y posterior mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 46 years old and lives in the small populated area of Laynas, in La Matanza district, a community with a dry and warm climate. Its population works in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry, and it is located in the Morropon province, which is part of the Piura region on the northern coast of Perú.

She offers services of making and selling Chicha de Jora, typical appetizers from the region, and in addition she sells beer. She has had this business for the past 5 years. She is applying for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative to purchase construction material, such as corrugated iron, adobe and labor costs to expand and improve her business space. This will allow her to get more customers, which with generate increased income, and later will improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials to grow her business.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto tiene 32 años de edad, vive en el Caserio Paltashaco, Distrito de Santa Catalina de Mossa, una comunidad de clima lluvioso y frio, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Él se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como son; arroz, azucar, pollo, verduras y afines. Gracias a ello a logrado adquirir 2 computadoras, las cuales cuentan con señal de Internet, las cuales son alquiladas en su local, El cliente a solicitado un prestamo de s/ 3000,00 para poder ampliar su negocio ya que cuanta con una clientela permenente y aumentado los clientes que piden internet. Esto le permitira obtener más cientes y generar mayores ingresos, lo que mejorará de su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Humberto is 32 years old, lives in Caserio Paltashaco, in Santa Catalina de Mossa district, a community with a rainy and cold climate, whose population works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in the Morropon province, which is part of the Piura region, on the northern coast of Perú. 

He works selling groceries such as rice, sugar, chicken, vegetables and other related products. Thanks to this, he has managed to acquire 2 computers, which have internet, which are rented in his retail space. The customer has applied for a loan of s/ 3000.00 to be able to expand his business since he has a permanent customer base and the number of customers who have asked to use internet has increased. This will permit him to have more customers and generate more income, which will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 computers to provide internet service.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 59 años de edad, de estado civil separada, vive con su hija y su yerno con un nieto recien nacido, en el Sector de Nuevo Mexico – Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace 10 años su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales como patos y gallinas que le permitan ofrecerlo a un mayor precio, generando así mayores ingresos, y por ende mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario is 59 years old. Her marital status is separated, and she lives with her daughter, her son-in-law and a recently born grandson, in the sector of Nuevo Mexico – Cayalti, a community where the people dedicate themselves to agriculture, ranching and commerce. It is located in the Province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru. 

Rosario works raising and selling small farm animals. She has done this for 10 years, and her business is located behind her home. She has applied for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3000 new Peruvian soles to buy animals such as ducks and chickens, This will allow her to offer a better price, thus generating more income and ultimately improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Yaritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yaritza de 35 años de edad, originaria de león, madre soltera con una hija menor de edad, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Esta joven mujer tiene mucha ganas de superación por lo tanto de dedica en un cien por ciento a su negocio porque quiere ver crecer su negocio y sus ingresos, para tener mejor estabilidad económica y brindarle un futuro mejor a su pequeña  hija.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa de niños como: vestidos, faldas, pantones, camisas, short, calcetines, ropa interior,  en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su mercadería a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Yaritza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Yaritza, 35 years old, originally from León, and a single mother with a young daughter, can be characterized as being hard working, responsible, with the desire to improve herself. This young woman has a great desire to improve herself, so she commits herself one hundred percent in her business because she wants to see her business and her income grow, in order to have better economic stability and offer a better future to her little daughter.

Thanks to her efforts and her wish to get ahead, she has as her business the sale of children's clothing such as dresses, skirts, pants, shirts, shorts, socks, underwear, and she sells them in her home and as a street vendor.  She works in this business some ten hours a day, offering her merchandise to regular and occasional customers.  The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business so that in the not so distant future she can have more income.  Yaritza is thankful for the help the Kiva investors offer to people with limited resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they have have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business with the purchase and sale of children's clothing.

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 3 hijos, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Él se dedica a la venta de leche y crianza de animales, con más de 5 años de experiencia, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales como cuyes, patos y gallinas que le permitan ofrecerlo a un mayor precio, generando así mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old, single, has three children and lives with his partner in a community that works in agriculture, commerce and cattle, located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region in Peru's Northern coast.

He has been working by selling milk and raising animals.  With over five years of experience, his business runs out of the rear of his home.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 new soles to buy animals like guinea pigs, ducks and chickens that he will sell at a higher price, thereby raising more income.

loans.use: Buy several different types of animals.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 46 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, vive en casa propia con su madre y sus 2 hijos, familia unida, la comunidad es tranquila, de clima variado se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero desde hace más de 11 años, adicional a eso cria y vende animales como cuyes y cerdos tabien desde hace mas de 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para la compra de una vaca lechera lo que le permitirá mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Delia is 46 years old, single, and lives in her own house with her mother and her 2 children, a close family. The community is quiet with a variable climate. They work in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry and it is located in the Chiclayo province which is part of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.

She has worked raising dairy cows for the past 11 years, in addition she raises and sells animals such as guinea pigs and pigs, also for more than 10 years.  Her business is located behind her home, and she has applied for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a dairy cow, which will allow her greater income and so to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Palacios De Taulabe Group

texts.es:
Elvin, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa y reside en una aldea del municipio de San José, Comayagua, cerca de Taulabe. siempre a sido agricultor, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a su propio cultivo de maíz y frijoles. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos. La producción es vendida en la misma zona. Elvin ha invertido ya nueve prestamos con el actual, el cual es por 5,000 Lempiras que utilizara en la compra de fertilizantes para dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz. Esta inversión le ayudara a sacar mejor cosecha y ganancias para mejorar su condición de vida y su vivienda.
El préstamo es en forma grupal. El grupo se llama Palacios de Taulabe, formado por tres miembros que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma zona. El total de préstamo grupal es por 15,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y dar mantenimiento al cultivo de maíz. en la foto están: a la izquierda Juan, Elvin y Marco Tulio a la derecha.
texts.en:
Elvin is 31 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. He lives in the municipality San José, Comayagua, close to Taulabe. He has always worked in agriculture and has been working for seven years on his own, growing beans and corn. This activity is his source of income. He sells his produce locally.

Elvin has received nine loans, including this one. He needs 5,000 Lempiras [HNL] to buy fertilizers for the maintenance of his corn plantation. With this investment, he will be able to improve his harvest and increase his profits, which will result in better living conditions.

This is a group loan. The group’s name is “Palacios de Taulabe” and is comprised of three members who work in agriculture and live close to each other. The total amount requested is 15,000 Lempiras [HNL] and will be used to buy fertilizers and perform maintenance on the corn plantations. In the picture, Juan is standing to the left, Marco Tulio to the right, and Elvin in the middle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the corn plantations.

loans.name: Carmila

texts.en:
Carmila is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of a 9-year-old child from Leyte, Philippines. Carmila runs a sari-sari or variety store business,  selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. 

Last year, Carmila's business was affected when Typhoon Haiyan hit the Philippines. As of this moment, Carmila needs a loan to bring back her business again and augment her stock.
 
Carmila hopes that she will be able to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income. Furthermore, she wants to continually send her daughter to school for a better education.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, cooking oil and seasonings

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Palompon, Leyte. She has been engaged in a food vending business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a fisherman. Ermelinda's livelihood was greatly affected when typhoon Haiyan hit the country several months ago. As of now, she is starting again to rebuild her house and business.

Ermelinda is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, seasonings, flour, and sugar. With this loan, she will be able to cook more food for her customers. In the future, Ermelinda dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, seasonings, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba earns a living from her transport-service business. Her husband operates their vehicle personally to take care of their business. Her previous loan that was used for vehicle repair was successfully repaid.

Melba wants to maintain good service to their clients, for in this way, she could earn a living. She borrowed a new loan to buy vehicle tires to replace the old used tires. In the future, Melba wants to have another unit of motorcycle to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vehicle tires to replace the old used tires

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es:
José tiene 61 años edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en casa propia junto a un sobrino, en el anexo de santa sofia – cayalti , una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Él se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, además recibe pension de jubilados, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales como cuyes, patos y gallinas que le permitan ofrecerlo a un mayor precio, generando así mayores ingresos y por ende mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 61 years old, single, and lives in his own house with a nephew, in the annex of Santa Sofia - Cayalti, a community which works in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry, located in Chiclayo province, which is part of Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. 

He works raising and selling farm animals, in addition he receives a retirement pension. His business is located behind his house, and he has applied for a loan of 1,5000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative to purchase animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, and hens that will permit him to offer them for a better price, generating more income and in turn improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his crops and to purchase animals.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 49 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. Flora is borrowing 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Flora has been farming coconut for 25 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Amy works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fermented shrimp in the Philippines. She also earns income from fattening pigs. Amy is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients such as shrimp, salt, etc. for her fermented shrimp business.

Amy has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as shrimp, salt, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es un claro ejemplo de las muchas mujeres que hacen un esfuerzo por sus hijos día a día para darles lo mejor, es la historia de una mujer de 53 años de edad y que cuenta con cinco hijos, tres de ellos viven con sus familias y los dos aún viven con ella por los cuales ella se ha decidido a trabajar duro por el resto de sus días para verlos crecer y que lleguen a ser ciudadanos de bien en su comunidad.
La actividad principal que ella realiza es la elaboración de forros para biblia y la fabricación de recuerdo de cuero, su taller se encuentra ubicado en su casa donde laboran hace 15 años su esposo era el encargado del negocio pero desafortunadamente el murió y desde entonces se dedican al comercio. La segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de tostadas en cada rincón de su comunidad.
El uso respectivo que ella le dará al crédito que solicita es para la compra de cuero para seguir fabricando los artículos y la compra de una máquina de coser para facilitar el trabajo y que mejoran la producción para obtener mejores ganancias.
La aspiración de Juana es darles educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales en la vida y mejorar su negocio y comprar más maquinas par una mayor producción.
texts.en:
Juana is a clear example of the many women who work hard for their children day by day to give them the best. It is a story of a 53-year-old woman who has five children, three of whom live with their families and two who still live with her for whom she has decided to work hard for the rest of her days to see them grow and become good citizens in the community.

Her primary work that she does is to make Bible jackets and souvenirs from leather. Her workshop is located in her home, where they work. Fifteen years ago, her husband was in charge of the business but unfortunately he died and since then she has worked in the trade. The second job that she does is sell tostadas in every corner of her community. 

The use that she will give to the loan that she applies for is to purchase leather to continue making the products and to purchase a sewing machine to facilitate the work and to improve the production to get more income.
