Juana's aspiration is to provide education for her children so that they become professionals in life and to improve her business and purchase more machines for an increased production.

loans.use: to purchase leather and a sewing machine

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 35 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Daisy has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.en:
Laureana is 52 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Laureana is borrowing 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase an additional piglet, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Laureana has been in pig fattening for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional piglet, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: G.s Filipenses Group

texts.es:
La señora Noemí es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio, venta de abarrotería, y molino de maíz, actividades que realiza desde hace 11 años, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación.
Doña Noemi vende  todos los días de la semana, sus clientes son las personas que viven en su misma comunidad, su negocio le ayuda de gran manera, ya que las ganancias le sirven para cubrir sus gastos familiares y de igual manera le ha ayudado a mejorar su nivel de vida.
Doña Noemi nos está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de producto para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, agua, queso, leche, etc. y así obtener las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante en su negocio y poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
Doña Noemi solicita el préstamo de manera grupal y al igual que sus compañeras de grupo espera que esta inversión les sea de mucha ayuda para cubrir sus necesidades.
Doña Francia se dedica al comercio, su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio venta de rosquillas, desde hace 7 años.
Doña Limne se dedica al comercio, su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio, venta de nacatamales, desde hace 7 años. 

Danlí, Honduras – Julio  2014
texts.en:
Noemí is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business. She has a convenience store and a corn mill. She has done these activities for 11 years. Her business is in her house.  

Noemi sells every day of the week. Her customers are people who live in the same community. Her business really helps her, because the earnings are used to cover the household expenses. It has also helped her improve her quality of life.
 
Noemi is asking us for a loan to buy products for her business, such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, water, cheese, milk, etc., in order to make the earnings necessary to get ahead in her business and keep supporting her family. Noemi is asking for the loan as a group loan and just like the other group members, she hopes that this investment will be a big help for meeting her needs.

Francia works as a merchant and her main source of income has been selling doughnuts for 7 years. Limne is a merchant and her main source of income has been from her business selling nacatamales for 7 years. 

Danlí, Honduras – July,  2014

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, water, cheese, milk, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Neptali

texts.es:
Neptali tiene 61 años de edad, de estado civil viudo, vive en casa propia con su suegro y nieta, familia unida y amable, vive en una zona urbana de Cayalti y goza de buenas referencias por sus vecinos; una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Neptali tiene una bodega que se dedica a la venta de cerveza y otros productos con mas de 15 años aproximadamente, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para abastecer su tienda y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Neptali is 61 years old, a widower, and lives in his own house with his father-in-law and granddaughter, a close and friendly family. He lives in an urban zone of Cayalti and enjoys good references from his neighbors. It is a community that works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in Chiclayo province, which belongs to Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. 

Neptali has a store where he has worked selling beer and other products for more than 15 years, approximately. His business is located in his home, and he has applied for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a variety of products to stock his store and in this way offer them to his customers.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of beer, panetones, and other products to stock his business.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, her husband also does construction work when he is not at the farm. Mom lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and she has three daughters - two are garment workers and the other one is attending school.

Mom is applying for a loan in order to buy a motorcycle for her daughters to drive to work because they do not have their own transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughters to drive to work.

loans.name: Leodivina

texts.en:
Leodivina is a married woman from the town of Palompon, Leyte. She is engaged in a retail sales business where she sells various goods and items to the people in her community. This is the source of her income. 

Last year, Leodivina's business was damaged by the typhoon Haiyan, causing major loss in her income. Leodivina is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, bread and snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to augment her stock, thus attracting more buyers. 

In the future, Leodivina hopes to expand her store so that she will be able to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, bread and snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
Ilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. Ilyn earns additional income from raising chickens and food vending.

Ilyn is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Ilyn dreams of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 45 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Nancy has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns income from farming rice and raising chickens. Nancy aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell for her dried coconut meat business.

Aurora has been in this business for four years. Aurora earns more income from selling recyclable materials.

Aurora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: March

texts.en:
March (in the photo) is 38 years old and lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has two daughters who are attending school.
   
March is a teacher and also assists with her husband’s rice farming business when she is free. She wants to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. Therefore, she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Dovilyn

texts.en:
Dovilyn is aged 42, married to a driver, and they are blessed with four children. She has been managing a food vending business in their village for almost 20 years and earns a net income of PHP 1,500 daily. Her net income was spent on their house for repairs.

Dovilyn is now asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase food seasonings, vegetables, raw pork, and chicken meat to cook. She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her food stall so that her costumers will continue to purchase her cooked meals.

loans.use: To purchase food seasonings, vegetables, raw pork, and chicken meat to cook.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is aged 34. She is married to a teacher, and they're blessed with three children. She owns and operates a retail store, and she earns a net income of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) daily. Her income on this business is usually spent on their daily expenses. 

Due to lack of capital for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase beverages, canned goods, breads, cooking oil, chips and biscuits to sell. She's hoping that her store will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, canned goods, breads, cooking oil, chips and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is a food vendor from Leyte, Philippines. She is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. Liezl has been in the food vending business for more than six years now. This is the source of her income. Liezl's business was greatly affected when typhoon Haiyan hit her place several months ago. She wants to start again, but she lacks the capital to do so. 

As a result, Liezl asked for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, and seasonings, as well as kitchen utensils. With these items, she will be able to cook and sell more food to her customers thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Liezl hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income so that she will be able to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, and seasonings, as well as kitchen utensils

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman and a mother of three young children from Palompon, Leyte. Maricel operates a sari-sari, or variety store, business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Maricel's business was drastically affected when typhoon Haiyan hit the country several months ago. 

As of now, Maricel is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and seasonings, and soda and beverages. With this loan, she will be able to augment her stock of goods thus attracting more buyers. In the future, Maricel dreams of making her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and seasonings, and soda and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of seaweeds business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more stock of dried and fresh seaweed to sell for seaweed business.

Sonia has been in this business for 12 years. Sonia earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dried and fresh seaweed to sell

loans.name: Reynilda

texts.en:
Reynilda is 31 years old and has five children. Reynilda is married, and four of her children are currently in school.

Reynilda is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Reynilda requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Reynilda has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Reynilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 50 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Vilma has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Consuelo

texts.es:
Sanda tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus hijos de 11 y 7 meses en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Ella se dedicaba, a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz  Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida con la finalidad de mejorar la producción de sus cultivos. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es mejorar la producción de sus cultivos. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver las noticias y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Sandra is 27 years old and single. She lives with her children, ages 11 and 7 months, in the canton of Ventanas in the Rios Province. 

She is a corn farmer. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizer, insecticide, manure, urea, and fungicide in order to improve crop production during planting. The purchases will be made in Ventanas. Her goal is to improve crop production. Her challenge is transportation. In her spare time, she likes to watch the news and play sports.

loans.use: to improve her corn crop

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Susan earns additional income from selling dry goods and charcoal.

Susan is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Susan dreams of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sector La Cuchilla 1 Group

texts.es:
De 20 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, es casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, (ella tiene una blusa amaría y se encuentra en la segunda fila de la izquierda a la derecha).
El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de embutidos negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de tres años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su comunidad.
Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Glendy para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.
El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería o corte típica para luego su respectiva venta por los alrededores. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Glendy is twenty years old and already has great ambitions to demonstrate to her community and to all who visit her the work that she carries out with such effort and dedication. She is married and lives with her husband. She has the desire to get ahead in life and reach the great dreams that she wants to achieve in life. (She is the second from the left in the photo, wearing a yellow blouse.) 

The work that she carries out with such dedication is buying and selling traditional clothing. She does this work at her house and in places near the community where she lives. The second type of work she does is selling processed meat. She has operated this business with one of her sisters for more than three years, because it generates earnings for her family's well-being and also improves the economic conditions of her community. 

She has been an example in her community, and for this reason a group of women has come together with Glendy so that they can pursue their businesses and each one of them can get ahead and earn a significant income. 

The purpose of this loan she is requesting is to buy merchandise in the form of traditional clothing, so that she can sell it later in her area. One of her aspirations is to have a shop in the market in her community.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: G.s Sartenajas Group

texts.es:
La señora Yaira es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio que es la venta de cerdos y cuajada, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, sus ventas las realiza de manera domiciliar y ambulante, atiende personalmente a sus clientes.
Doña Yaira sus principales clientes son las personas que viven en su misma comunidad, su negocio le ayuda de gran manera, ya que las ganancias le sirven para cubrir parte de sus gastos personales y de igual manera le ha ayudado a mejorar su nivel de vida familiar, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cerdos y leche para elaborar la cuajada, solicita el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas.
Doña Karen Daniela su fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado, joyería, perfumes y achinería desde hace  4 años.
Doña Elba su fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, se dedica a la venta de cerdos y destazo del mismo, actividad que realiza desde hace 16 años.
Doña Ramona De Jesús se dedica a la venta de cerdos y destazo de los mismos, actividad que realiza desde hace 11 años.
Doña Elsy su fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, venta y destazo de los mismos, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años.
 

Danlí, Honduras – Julio  2014
texts.en:
Yaira is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business selling pigs and cheese curds. She has done this for 10 years. Her sales are done in her household and as a street vendor, she serves her customers personally.
Yaira's main customers are the people who live in the same community. Her business will help her greatly sincere her profits serve to cover part of the personal expenses. It has also has helped improve her family life. She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and milk for curds. She is applying for the loan as a group with the following persons. 
Karen Daniela gets her main source of income from her business selling clothes, shoes, jewelry, perfumes, and other consumer goods for four years. 
Elba's main source of income is derived from her business. She sells pigs butchers them as well. She has done this work for 16 years.
Ramona de Jesus sells pigs and butchers them which she has done for 11 years.
Elsy's main source of income is derived from her business which is sales and butchering which she has done for 4 years.

Danlí, Honduras – July 2014

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is working with determination to be able to forge ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her children. She needs to pay for her children's school miscellaneous supplies and also cover her household expenses.

Rosalinda is striving for a better life through her business, and she says that she is requesting this loan to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell, so that she can offer more varieties of food and achieve her goal of renovating their house. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving, which will be very helpful to her life.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en: Laarni, 27 years old, is married to a tricycle driver and they're blessed with three children. She has managed a hog raising business for almost four years and earns a net income of PHP 7,000 every two hogs. Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase one piglet to raise and hog feed for her hog raising business. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase one piglet to raise and hog feed.

loans.name: Reneboy

texts.en:
Reneboy is 32 years old and married with one child. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental where he operates his service-based business, carrying passengers and baggage to earn a living.

Reneboy successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying tires. To improve the services, he took a new loan recently to cover motorcycle maintenance costs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has been selling ready-to-wear clothes in order to make a living. In the many years running this business, her ability has improved with GDMPC as her partner in business. Her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. Finding ways to augment their living with GDMPC microfinance services has assisted in improving the business. 

Recently, Gloria took a new loan to purchase more ready-to-wear goods to sell. 

In the future, she hopes to be more successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear goods to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amalia is 50 years old, and four of her children are currently in school.

Amalia has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Amalia requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc., for her food-production business.

Amalia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Amalia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc., for her food-production business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of scrap materials business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more scrap materials to sell for her scrap materials business.

Carmelita has been in this business for six years. Carmelita earns more income from vehicle transport.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Dioleta

texts.en:
Dioleta works hard to support her family. Dioleta is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like linens, needles, etc.

Dioleta has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Dioleta would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like linens, needles, etc.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel works hard to support her family. Ethel is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Ethel requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Ethel has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ethel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie works hard to support her family. Girlie is widowed and has a beauty salon business in the Philippines.

Girlie requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Girlie has been in this business for nine years now.

Girlie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Brenda Judith

texts.es:
La señora Brenda  es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y  responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia.  Se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, desde hace ya 7 años.
Doña Brenda tiene su negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de gran variedad de ropa como pantalones, blusas, vestidos, faldas, calzonetas, toallas, etc. y así seguir realizando su negocio el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Doña Brenda con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos que ahora le exigen sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por ellos a diario.
Doña Brenda espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar y en un corto plazo desea hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para  tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio del  2014
texts.en:
Brenda is a humble, hardworking and responsible person. She lives in a community in Southern Honduras, together with her family. She has been selling brand-new clothes for seven years.

Brenda runs her business at home. She needs this loan to buy different types of clothes, such as pants, blouses, dresses, skirts, shorts and towels and continue with this business, which represents a large share of her total income. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her sales, as she is aware that she does not have everything her customers order every day.

Brenda hopes to improve her family’s living conditions by increasing her income. In the short term, she hopes that her business expands in order to continue supporting her family and make sure her children receive the education needed to have access to more opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2014

loans.use: to buy assorted clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hon

texts.en:
Hon, 49 years old, is a hardworking rice farmer in a small community of Kampong Speu Province. She has two children who are already married and three children who are enrolled in a school. Hon and her husband manage and operate rice farmland, which is located just behind their house. So far, it is almost thirty years for them as farmers. The earnings that this couple can generate are $10 USD a day. 

Hon would like to improve her living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a Kiva loan to build a small biogas digester under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and will lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal. She is very happy and thankful because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate better than its general loans. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a small biogas digester

loans.name: Estelvina

texts.es:
La señora Estelvina  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  su esposo y sus   hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  pulpería y venta de pan desde hace más de 5 años. 
Doña Estelvina el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de café, azúcar, refrescos,  maíz, manteca,  carne, etc. Con el préstamo espera  que sus ventas aumenten gracias a que contara con más capital fresco y  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan.
 Doña Estelvina así mismo espera que mejore su situación económica en el hogar y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años sueña con que su negocio  este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad y con mejores oportunidades.


Choluteca, Honduras – Julio    del 2014
texts.en:
Estelvina is a very entrepreneurial person who lives with her husband and children in a community in southern Honduras.  Her business is a small grocery store along with bread sales and she has been in this work for more than five years.

Estelvina is asking for a loan in order to purchase coffee, sugar, soft drinks, corn, butter, meat, etc.  With the loan she hopes that her sales will increase since she will have more fresh items to offer her clients when they visit. 

Estelvina also hopes to improve the economic situation in her home and that is reflected in this investment.  In a few years she hopes that her business will be positioned as the largest and most well-known in the area and that she will be able to continue supporting her family so they can have better opportunities and be able to assist the society.  

Choluteca, Honduras.  July 2014.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sugar, soft drinks, corn, butter, meat, etc. for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Srey Mom’S Group

texts.en:
Srey Mom was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. There are two members:  Srey Mom and Srey Moch and they they live in a village in the Phnom Penh suburbs.

Srey Mom, aged 24, is single. She is now a third year student, majoring in Accounting at the Accounting Institute in Phnom Penh. She wants to continue her studies, so she decided to apply for a loan to pay her school fees. She hopes she will become an Accountant for a bank or microfinance institution after she finishes her studies. 

Srey Mom is on the left and Srey Moch in on the right.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul is a kind and hardworking woman. She always tries to go ahead and provide good living conditions for her family. She is a careful mother of three children. Jumagul is divorced. She is only source of food and income for her children. 

Eight years ago, she began own business with animal husbandry. She feeds cows and sells meat. Also she cooks shashlik and sells it to local people. Her son helps her with managing the business. She began her business with her own savings and little by little with the passing of the time, she developed her business. 

Now, she works hard from early morning every day to offer high quality meat and food to her clients. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy cattle as she is going to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle, as she is going to increase her working capital

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para los sembríos. Las compras lo realizan en Ventanas. Su meta es mejorar la producción de la siembra. Su desafío es las plagas. En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Carlos is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Cantón Ventanas, in the Rios Province. 

Carlos is a corn farmer. He is requesting the loan to purchase agricultural supplies for his crops. He will purchase the products in Ventanas. His goal is to improve crop production, and his biggest challenge is the pests. He plays sports in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bicycles and spare parts for her bicycle transport business.

Leonora has been in this business for six years. Leonora earns more income from her general store.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bicycles and spare parts for her business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. Arlene is married and has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spices to sell for her business.

Arlene has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spices to sell for her business

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
La señora Eulalia es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  su esposo y sus   hijos, su negocio es una  pulpería y venta de pan desde  hace más de 4 años.
Doña Eulalia el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de café,  azúcar, refrescos,  maíz, manteca, carne, arroz, aguas, papel higiénico, etc. Con el crédito  espera que sus ventas aumenten debido a que contara con más capital fresco y mas producto que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan.
Doña Eulalia desea que mejore su situación en el hogar y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años sueña con que su negocio  este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia e hijos para que se convierta en personas de bien  y con mejores oportunidades.


Choluteca, Honduras – Julio    del 2014
texts.en:
Eulalia is a very entrepreneurial person, who lives with her husband and children. Her business has been running a small grocery store and selling bread for over 4 years.
 
Eulalia is requesting this loan to buy coffee, sugar, drinks, corn, butter, meat, rice, water, toilet paper, etc. With the loan she expects an increase in sales, as she will have more capital and products to offer her customers. 

Eulalia wants to improve her situation at home, which she will do with the gains from this investment. In a few years, she dreams of having her business be the largest and most well-known in the area, and to continue to support her family and children so that they can become good people with better opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2014

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, drinks, corn, butter, meat, rice, water, toilet paper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
La señora Eufemia  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  su esposo y sus   hijos. Su negocio es una  pulpería  hace más de 8 años. 
Doña Eufemia el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  café,  azúcar, refrescos,  maíz, manteca,  carne, arroz, queso, leche, huevos, aceite, etc. Con el crédito  espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco y  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan.
 Doña Eufemia espera que gracias a la inversión que realice a su negocio pueda y así cubrir sus necesidades,  así mismo espera que mejore su situación económica en el hogar y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. 
Doña Eufemia en unos años sueña con que su negocio  este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia  a que se e hijos para que se conviertan en personas de bien  para la sociedad y con mejores oportunidades.


Choluteca, Honduras – Julio    del 2014
texts.en:
Eufemia is a very enterprising person who lives with her spouse and children. Her business is a small store she has been running for more than 8 years.
Eufemia needs the loan to buy coffee,sugar, soft drinks, corn, butter, meat, rice, cheese, milk, eggs, oil, etc. With the loan she hopes for an increase in sales since she will have more fresh goods to offer to the customers who visit her store.  

Eufemia hopes that thanks to the investment she is making her business can grow and she can cover her needs.  She also hopes the financial situation at home will be better, reflecting the investment.  Eufemia's dream is that in a few years her business will be positioned as the largest and best-known in the area.  Then she will be able to continue supporting her family so that her children will become good people in society, with better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy coffee,sugar, soft drinks, corn, butter, meat, rice, cheese, milk, eggs, oil, etc., for her business

loans.name: Ma. Juditha

texts.en:
Ma. Juditha is 51 years old and married with five children. Ma. Juditha works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Juditha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, eggs, candies, salt, sugar, etc. to sell.

Ma. Juditha has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, eggs, candies, salt, sugar, etc. 

Ma. Juditha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, eggs, candies, salt, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena works hard to support her family. Jena is married and has a business selling roasted whole pigs in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase pigs to make roasted pigs.

Jena has been in this business for 10 years now,.

In the future, Jena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to make roasted pigs

loans.name: Iris Ondina

texts.es:
La señora Iris es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa clasificada, desde hace 8 años.
Doña Iris su negocio funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y también sale vender a diversos lugares aledaños. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más producto como blusas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas, calzonetas, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos.
Doña Iris con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
Uno de sus sueños es que en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio del  2014
texts.en:
Iris is a very hard-working and responsible person, who lives in a community in southern Honduras with her family.  Her business for the past 8 years has been the sale of used clothing.  Iris does business from home in the city where she lives and also goes out to sell at several nearby places.  She needs the loan to buy more products such as  blouses, skirts, dresses, pants, shirts, footwear, etc, to continue the work which provides most of her income.

With the loan, Iris hopes that her sales will increase. This will help a lot because she doesn't have enough of the necessary goods to cover the daily requests of her customers.  Thanks to this she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

One of Iris' dreams is that she will soon be able to make her business grow.  If this happens she can continue supporting her family, and she wants her children to get the education they need to have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, pants, shirts, footwear, etc., to stock her business

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 33 years old.  She is married and has four children. She earns a living with a poultry business in the Philippines. Merlita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins for her chickens.  Merlita has been in the poultry business for five years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, two of whom are in school, Josephine works hard to support her family.  She has a wood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling charcoal. Josephine is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy wood to sell for her wood business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.  Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional wood to sell

loans.name: Sabougnouma 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à LOUTANA un village dans la commune de KLELADOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur septième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur MOUSSA S assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  SABOUGNOUMA 2. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The seven members of the Sabougnouma 2 group are married men averaging 43 years of age, with six children. They live mainly in traditional families in Loutana, a village in the township of Kleladogoni in the district of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to successfully manage their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their seventh Soro Yiriwaso agricultural loan for growing corn. Their prior loans have been duly repaid. They grow corn, which is what Mr. Moussa S, does for example. He is the first one seated from right to left in the group photo. With his loan, he plans to buy eight 50-kg [110 lbs] of fertilizers, 10 jugs of herbicides of various quality grades and pay the cost of labor to work 1 ha [2 acres] of land. After harvesting, he sells his produce in his village and in Sikasso, to a mixed clientele, for cash and on credit. He plans to earn an average of 160,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle. This revenue will allow him to pay off his loan with interest and also contribute to the everyday family needs.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and cost of labor.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is an 18 year-old single young lady from Nablus city.   She lives with her family in a very small house.   Her father is a worker with a low income.   This is the only source of income for the family.  Aya is a student in the university, where she studies Information technology.  She wants to take a BA degree and find a job to help her family with part of their expenses.
Aya requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester.  With the BA degree, she will improve herself.
Aya appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: From Ozamiz City,  Judith finds pleasure in doing farming activities. Judith also does snack vending which gives her daily promising sales. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase ingredients for snack vending.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela, is aged 36, married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has managed a recycling business for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 weekly. Her net income is usually spent on their daily expenses at home. Due to insufficient fund, she would like to get a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase assorted bottles, scraps materials, steel and old newspapers to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase assorted bottles, scraps materials, steel and old newspapers to sell.

loans.name: Dalia Luz

texts.es:
Dalia Luz tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive en casa familiar con sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti, goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Dalia es la crianza y venta de animales, como cerdos y patos, desde hace 3 años en su propio domicilio, adicionalmente vende productos de belleza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y alimentos para el engorde de los animales.
texts.en:
Dalia Luz is 40 years old. Her marital status is single, and she lives in her family home with her parents and siblings. They live in a large community in the urban zone of Cayalti. She has excellent personal and work references from her neighbors. The population of the area dedicates itself to agriculture, ranching and commerce. The community is located in the Province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru. 

Dalia's work is raising and selling animals such as pigs and ducks. She has done this work for 3 years at her home. She also sells beauty products. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 new Peruvian soles to buy pigs and also to buy feed to fatten up her animals.

loans.use: to buy more animals as well as feed to fatten them up.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Mr. Rolly was born around 1978 in Isabela. He resides in Dalena in his traditional family home, and is the married father of one kid. He has been engaged in the farming business for ten years. 

He is a very responsible person, and he always seeks to supply the needs of his family. For that reason, he is asking for a loan amounting to Php 12,000 to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides. Mr. Rolly sees his capacities strengthened and expects average monthly profits of 140,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Handi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a married woman from Attel, a village near Tulkarm city.   She is a mother of three kids, all of whom are under 10 years old. Hanadi and her husband work in their farm where they plant seasonal crops, using greenhouses.They sell their crops in the local market. 
Hanadi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to rebuild the greenhouses on her land. By taking this loan, Hanadi will be able to improve the farm and increase its productivity. 
Hanadi appears in the photo

loans.use: to rebuild the greenhouses on her land.

loans.name: Naheel

texts.en:
Naheel is an 18 year-old single young lady from Nablus city.  She lives with her family in a very small house.   Her father is a worker with a low income.  This is the only source of income to the family.  Naheel is a student in the university, where she studies business administration. She wants to take a BA degree and find a job to help her family with part of their expenses. 
Naheel requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester.   By taking this loan, Naheel will be able to take the BA degree and improve herself. 
Naheel appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Mariconie

texts.en: Mariconie is 36 years old. She is known in the Molave Zamboanga del Sur area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as an individual member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Cesario

texts.en: Cesario is a 37-year-old rural entrepreneur from Dalena. Cesario is asking for a loan to start producing corn on his own. With this loan, he will be able to buy seed and pesticide for his farm. He lives with his family, and he is a very loving father.  His goal is to earn enough money to buy their own motorcycle and to expand their production.

loans.use: to buy seed and pesticide for his farm.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. Maricel is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like snack foods, biscuits, juice, etc.

Maricel has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like snack foods, biscuits, juice, etc.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin is 33 years old and married with five children. With four children currently in school, Marvin works very hard to provide for them.

Marvin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Marvin has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, canned goods, soft drinks, beers, cooking oil, noodles, etc. 

Marvin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Eloisa is 53 years old and has seven children.  Eloisa is married and has three children who are in school.  She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Eloisa requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Eloisa has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Segundo Amado

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con su tres hijos de 35, 38 y 39 en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El se dedica a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es comprar un terreno propio y mejorar sus productos. Su desafío son las enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar con la familia y leer.
texts.en:
Segundo is 53 years old, single, and lives with his three kids aged 35, 38, and 39 in the Canton Ventanas Province of Ríos.

He makes a living by sowing corn. He is asking for the loan in order to buy agricultural supplies. His purchases will take place in Ventanas. His goal is to buy a field of his own and to better his products, though he is challenged by illness. In his free time, he likes to enjoy his family and to read.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Shodmonoy

texts.en:
Shodmonoy was born in the year 1959. She is an industrious woman who is working hard every day. 

Shodmonoy has been working in a local hospital, as a cleaning woman, for more than eight years. She does her job well and her colleagues know her as a good-natured woman. She has a daughter. Her daughter is Intizor, who is 25 years old. Her husband, Hamid, is a farmer. They live poorly because their income is small. 

Now, Shodmonoy needs financial support because her daughter is ill and she must buy medicine for her treatment. She is asking for a loan of TJS 1,100 (somoni) with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicine for treatment of her daughter.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 10 years, she has operated a shell craft business in the Philippines. Veneranda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials such as shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business. Veneranda would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more materials such as shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Tuinuane Group

texts.en:
Georgina is a businesswoman in her early thirties. She is married and has two daughters who are at school. For the past three years, Georgina has been supporting her family with two businesses: a beauty salon and a charcoal store. She wakes up early in the morning to perform her house activities prior to business. She works for her business from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is Georgina's first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, to be apportioned among TUINUANE's seven group members. Georgina  and her group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Georgina will invest her portion of the loan in her businesses: to buy salon hair products and sacks of charcoal to resell.  Her ambition is to be a successful woman.

loans.use: to buy hair products and sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.en: In 2010, Maria Norma joined PMPC. She has taken several loans and successfully repaid all her obligations. Maria Norma earns a living through pig raising and is happy to earn well for the family. She has applied for a loan to purchase additional pigs. She wants to sell her pigs commercially for more profit. In the future, Maria Norma hopes to establish her own meat shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en: Renilda, 42 years old, is married and has 2 children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past two years, Renilda has runs a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from rice retailing. Renilda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has previously borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF. Renilda aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melchorita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Melchorita works hard to support her family. She has a business making dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Melchorita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to make for her business.

Melchorita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Wenie

texts.en:
Wenie is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Wenie is 37 years old and has one child who is in school.

Wenie has a selling clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of clothing to sell.

Wenie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Gloria successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van would like to take a further loan to buy more clothes to sell from her store. Van's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell at her store.

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en: Thoa is requesting a new loan to buy rice and bread to sell at her shop. Thoa's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. Thoa also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice and bread to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is 23 years of age. She is married to a farmer and they have been blessed with two children. She has been selling corn to their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 250 daily. She also sells frozen foods to generate more income. Her net income in her business is usually spent on their daily expenses at home. Due to lack of capital for her business, she is asking for a loan again from those generous lenders amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase more corn to sell. Leah is hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase more corn to sell.

loans.name: Lane

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lane works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling food supplements in the Philippines. Lane is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of food supplements to sell for her business.

Lane successfully repaid her previous loan and has requested this additional loan to further build her business. Lane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of food supplement products to sell

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en: Trinh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Trinh's previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and her sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and over sewing machine.

loans.name: Perina

texts.en:
Perina, 47 years old, currently resides with her family in Cavite, Philippines. She has been operating her own variety store and canteen for years, and she profits well from this. Perina also owns and operates a computer shop and apartment business. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Perina earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Perina would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. An amount of 20,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) would enable her to purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Perina could also improve her profit from her canteen, computer shop and apartment business with the help of this loan. She sincerely offers you her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Perina hopes to have more sets of computers for her business. She dreams for her family to always be happy and healthy. Perina meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

Perina is shown in the photo in her grocery store.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jati Ayu Group

texts.en:
The head of the Jati Ayu group, Ni Nengah, represented the group to make their repayment because most of the members work at the garden. In this period, all the members sold their pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. With more knowledge from their training, they can now manage the pigs well. Most of the members of Jati Ayu group raise sows and local pigs for pig barbeques. The local pigs will sell every 2 months.

Ni Nengah sold all her pigs. With the profit she earned, she can save and renovate her kitchen. She is very happy and decided to borrow a new loan to increase her business. She said thanks to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business.

For their fourth loan, the group will receive the same amount as in their previous loan. As the group leader, Ni Nengah has become a good example for her friends. She now plans to purchase super quality piglets. She will sell the piglets for fattening. She’s really happy and thankful to Kiva, MUK and lenders for supporting her and the group's businesses. Ni Nengah can now support her husband's income to fulfill their daily needs.

One member doesn't appear in the photo because she just had a baby.

loans.use: To purchase super quality piglets

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa, 57 years old, is married and has six children, two of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 25 years, Elsa has operated a dry goods business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items such as toys, home products and other dry goods. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as toys, home products and other dry goods

loans.name: Roque

texts.en: Roque thanks all Kiva lenders for helping him finance his agricultural inputs. Roque is a very responsible father who is married and has three children. He is a simple farmer who manages 1 hectare of corn. He is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business. In the future, Roque hopes that he can expand his business so that he can save enough money for his future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his farming business.

loans.name: Meri Rose

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Meri Rose works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Meri Rose is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Meri Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha, 53 years old, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 10 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from making nipa (vinegar). Editha has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. Editha has previously borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hop

texts.en: Hop would like to take a further loan to buy a larger stock of garments to sell from her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. Hop hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of garments to sell

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Lo más bonito de Guatemala son sus mujeres porque hacen el esfuerzo de cómo sacar a la familia hacia adelante porque es la que se interesa por el bienestar de los hijos y la economía de la familia, es el caso de Josefa de 45 años de edad que tiene que velar por cuatro hijos que son el motivo de levantarse cada mañana y hacer el esfuerzo de como tener un ingreso económico en la familia para darles a sus hijos una condición de vida mejor.
La actividad que ella realiza es la compraventa de abarrotería en su comunidad de origen y es por medio de ello puede tener un ingreso, ella tomo esa iniciativa hace 5 años por medio de su esposo que lo aconsejo de que dicho negocio dejaba buenas ganancias económicas.  La segunda actividad con que ella cuenta es una agropecuaria ubicada también en su comunidad ella ha encontrado un punto de venta muy importante porque tiene clientela y no tiene competencia en su campo laboral.
Uso del préstamo que ella hará es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotaría para tener surtido su tienda.
Sus metas personales en los próximos años de acuerdo a las ganancias que obtengan es ampliar su negocio y comprar más terrenos para sus hijos y darles educación para que lleguen a profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
The most beautiful thing about Guatemala is its women because they fight to give their families a good chance in life. They are the ones who are concerned with the wellbeing of their children and the family's economic situation. This is true in the case of 45-year-old Josefa, who has to look after her four children who are her motivation to get up every morning and fight to make a living to improve their living conditions. 

Her job involves buying and selling stock for grocery stores in her community and it is through doing this that she is able to make an income. Five years ago her husband told her that you can make a good income doing this kind of business and so she took the initiative. The other work she does is in an agricultural supplies store which is also in her community. She has found a big business opportunity because she has customers and doesn't have any other competition in this field. 

She will use the loan to buy stock for her general store so she can have a range of goods on sale.

Her personal goals in the next few years, depending on the profit she makes, are to expand her business, buy more land for her children and give them an education so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan emprendedor y con mucha ambición hacia el futuro de poder llegar a ser alguien diferente en la vida es soltero de 34 años de edad tiene 4 hijos de 16, 14, 6 y 4 años de edad los tres de ellos son buenos estudiantes en la escuela de la comunidad donde residen y el cuarto aun no estudia, sus hijos se ha sido el motivo por el que él se ha decidido a emprender dicho negocio ya que deja una muy buena ganancia en un futuro.
La actividad que el dignamente realiza es la compraventa de abarrotería pues los aprendió en un trabajo que el tubo unos cuantos años atrás y le genero algunos ahorros por su trabajo realizados en dicha empresa donde trabajo por más de diez años experiencia suficiente para Juan para poder emprender su propio negocio en su propio comunidad y obtener sus propias ganancias para el bienestar de su familia.
El uso respectivo que él le dará al crédito que solicita es para la compra de mercadería para poder surtir su tienda y así no perder a sus clientes porque por medio de ellos es que puede tener un ingreso para la satisfacción de sus necesidades y la de su familia 
Uno de sus aspiraciones en los próximos años es ver a sus hijos convertirse en mejores profesionales y comprar un molino de nixtamal para tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan is an entrepreneur with a lot of ambition for the future to become someone different in life. He is single, 34 years old, and has 4 children aged 16, 14, 6, and 4. Three of them are great students in the community school where they live, and the fourth does not study yet. His kids were the motive for him in deciding to undertake a busines, as it will lead to a lot of revenue in the future.

The activity that he carries out—with dignity—is the buying and selling of groceries, which he learned in a job that he had a few years back that generated some savings for him. From the work he did in that business, where he worked for more than ten years, Juan had enough experience to be able to launch his own business in his own community, and to obtain his own earnings for the wellbeing of his family.

The use of the loan he is asking for is to buy merchandise to be able to stock his shop, and therefore not lose clients because, due to them, he has been able to have a satisfactory income to buy his and his family's necessities.

One of his aspirations in the next few years is to see his children become professionals, and to buy a corn mill to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 29-year-old married man from Attel, a village near Tulkarm. He lives with his wife in a small house in the village. Fadi works as a construction worker, earning an unstable income dependent upon demand. He also has a chicken farm near his house, where he raises chicks and sells the meat to the local meat store. 

Fadi took a loan from FATEN to help him to expand his poultry coop. This loan will enable Fadi to increase the number of chicks he raises and increase productivity. Fadi appears in the photo next to his poultry coop.

loans.use: to expand his poultry coop

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Aneth, in her early forties, is married and the mother of three daughters, all at school. Aneth has a food business where she cooks soup, tea with snacks and lunch food, and sells soft drinks, sodas, water and juices. She has been in business for five years and is able to realize a very good profit each month. Aneth works from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily.

Aneth is now approaching Tujijenge for her more than tenth loan cycle. She has been with Tujijenge since 2011, taking various credits. Aneth has managed to repay all loans successfully. Her business now looks better than before and she is so proud of Kiva lenders' support, which has made a great change to her life. She used the previous credits to buy more food cooking ingredients (rice, cooking oil, sugar, maize and baking flour) which she normally keeps in her store and then takes what she needs, little by little. By doing this, she is sure to maintain her business needs and see a good return. Aneth bought a fridge which is now defective. She needs to buy a new one and replace other defective business equipment, such as chairs, tables and charcoal cooking stoves. Aneth will invest her new loan in buying a new business fridge and cooking ingredients. Her dream is to open another big branch. 

Aneth will share this credit with UNITY's other two members, and they will all hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Tumaini  A Group

texts.en:
Octavian, who is in his mid 40s, is married with three children who are still in school.  He has been a carpenter since 1991.  He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make good monthly profits.

This will be Octavian's 18th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to acquire more carpentry equipment and he also bought a machine for cutting big wood.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to build his own house, pay school fees, and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy better wood to make good doors and to buy normal wood for roofing purposes.  He dreams of building another house.

Octavian will share this loan with his loan group Tumaini A, which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy better wood to make good doors and to buy normal wood for roofing purposes.

loans.name: Phu

texts.en: Phu would like to take a further loan to buy more materials to make clothes to sell from her stall. Phu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. Phu hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy material to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick, aged 40, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married and has five children aged between 5 and 20, four of whom attend school. Patrick has a boda boda  (motorcycle taxi) and earns additional income from rentals. He started his business to improve his financial status. His dream is to expand his business by increasing the number of motorcycles on the road. Patrick's main business challenge is competition. He is acquiring credit to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma, 50 years old, is from San Clemente, Tarlac. The family's source of income is farming, but they do not earn enough to send her son, Filmar, to school. Hopefully, Vilma can borrow a PHP 10,000 loan with the help of Kiva lenders. Filmar is taking up Food and Beverage Services at St. Paul College of Technology. He chose this course because it is in demand in other countries. He is hopeful that he will be successful in this field so he'll be able to help his family get out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is 59 years old and married with four children.

Hermenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Hermenia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water.

Hermenia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan would like to take a further loan to repair her house and buy food and household items to sell from her store. 

Loan's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To repair her house and buy eggs, sugar, and sanitation items to sell.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred, aged 28, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a married, hardworking man with one child. Fred sells beans and maize, and also does farming. He started his business to make profits. Fred's major business challenge is price fluctuations. He desires to expand his business. Fred will use the money to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia. She is 51 years old and currently resides with her family in Taguig City, Philippines.
