She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than twenty years, and she profits well from this. She also manages a house rental business which helps with their everyday expenses. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner have to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Cecilia would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to have more rooms for rent. She dreams that her children will complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 16 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past year, Irene has been working hard to manage her small clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy different types of clothes for sale, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and access more capital and make more profits. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to have a better lifestyle. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes for sale,

loans.name: Japet

texts.en: Japet, 32 years old, is married and has one child, who is in school. Japet works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 5 years, Japet has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. Japet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Eva Isabel

texts.es:
Eva de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, se casó a la edad de los veinte  años, procreo tres hijos con su pareja. La mayor tiene diecinueve años, está haciendo su quinto ciclo en la universidad,  la segunda hace noveno grado, y la última séptimo, su pareja se marchó hacia los estados unidos para poder darles a todos una mejor estabilidad, solo vive el núcleo familiar en el hogar y son sus hijas las que dependen de su buena administración de las remesas.   

Ella no tiene ningún tipo de negocio, por lo que solo se dedica al cuido del hogar y de sus hijas, es la que se encarga de todos los quehaceres del que le  corresponden como mamá, desde que estaba en casa de sus padres su madre le enseño todo respecto a la cocina, por lo que es ella quien le enseña a sus hijas. 

Anteriormente se le había tramitado un crédito con línea kiva, con lo que se le ayudo a instalar la energía en su casa, proyecto que realizo a la perfección, porque tiene iluminación por las noches y sus hijas pueden estudiar mejor en la noche.


El crédito se está tramitando como un refinanciamiento, ya que por problemas de salud de un pariente muy cercano suyo le ha tocado realizar grandes gastos y no pudiendo manejar ambos compromisos se le ayuda cambiando la forma de pago. La necesidad que satisface es el poderse dedicar de lleno a su familia.

Desea que sus hijas sean profesionales, poderlas sacar adelante por medio del sacrificio  que incurre tener hijos estudiando, espera que sus hijas se preparen para que un día sean ellas las que la mantenga en su vejez, todo esto lo logra con la bendición de Dios y su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Eva, 40 years old, went to school up to sixth grade. She married at twenty and had three children with her husband. The oldest is nineteen and is in the fifth semester in college. The second is in ninth grade and the third is in seventh grade. Her husband went to the United States to give everyone better economic stability. Only the nuclear family lives at home, and her daughters depend on her successful management of the remittances. 
She does not have any type of business; she is solely dedicated to the care of her home and her daughters. She takes care of all the chores that she has as a mother. Ever since she was at home with her parents, her mother taught her everything about the kitchen, and she in turn teaches her daughters. 
She had a previous loan through Kiva, which helped her install electricity in her home, a project that worked out perfectly, because now she has light at night and her daughters can study better at night. 
The loan is being processed as a refinancing, because due to the health problems of a very close family member, she has had to make large expenditures and is not able handle both commitments. Changing the method of payment will help her. This way she will be able to dedicate herself fully to her family. 
She wants her daughters to be professionals; she wants to help them get ahead through the sacrifices that she must make in order to have children who are in school. She hopes that her daughters will study hard, so that one day they will be the ones who support her in her old age. She will achieve all of this through her effort and the blessing of God.

loans.use: to refinance her debt because, due to the health problems of a very close family member, she has had to make large expenditures and is not able handle both commitments. Changing the method of payment will help her.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary, aged 35, is a resident of Hoima. She is married and has three children, aged between 6 and 2. She operates several businesses: a nut grinding machine, a retail shop and farming. She started her business in 2010. Rosemary's major business challenge is competition. She hopes to educate her children. Rosemary is acquiring a loan to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Iris Milady

texts.es:
La joven Iris  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una Pulpería, desde hace 11 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. 
Iris necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, queso, leche, huevos, pan, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten considerablemente y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario.
Iris espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar y en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que su hija tengan los estudios necesarios, para que pueda tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio  del  2014
texts.en:
Iris is a very hardworking and responsible young person who lives with her family in a community in the southern part of Honduras. For the last 11 years, her business has been a grocery store that she runs in her residence in the municipality where she lives.

Iris needs the loan to purchase more products like rice, sugar, shortening, beans, cheese, milk, eggs, bread, etc., to continue carrying out her work, which provides her with a large portion of her income.

She expects that her sales will increase considerably with the loan and that it will be really useful, because she doesn't have the products she needs to fulfill the orders her customers request every day.

Iris hopes to be able to improve her family's quality of life with the increase in household income and, in the short term, to grow her business in order to be able to continue supporting her family. She also hopes that her daughter will have the education necessary to be able to have greater opportunity in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – July, 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, shortening, beans, cheese, milk, eggs, bread, etc., for her business

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta, 31 years old, is married and has three children, who are in school. Loreta works very hard to provide for them. For the past 10 years, Loreta has run a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional firewood to sell. In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her family. Luzviminda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sugar, eggs, flour and other ingredients. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, eggs, flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred, aged 46, resides in Hoima, Uganda.  He is married and has 6 children aged between 8 and 16, all attending school. Fred owns a depot for beer and soda and makes extra income through his retail shop. He started his business to increase his income. Fred's major challenge is competition. He is honest and will use the loan to buy more beer and sodas.

loans.use: to buy more beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thuy is 62 years old and lives with her son and her husband. For the past 12 years Thuy has worked as a manual labourer to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a 6-member loan group whose members live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is the first from the right wearing a striped shirt. 

Each of the other group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities. Thuy is requesting a loan to repair her house and to pay her child's school fees. She hopes that through her loan she will be able to improve  her family's living conditions and provide a better education for her child.

loans.use: To repair her house and pay for the education of her child

loans.name: Lizeth Maribel

texts.es:
Liseth Maribel tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus hijos en la casa de sus padre en una casa de familia solidaria y amable, vive en el distrito de Cayalti, la cual es una zona rural, donde se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, cosa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y venta de pan, arroz, azucar, aceite, gaseosas, etc. en su domicilio, es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes que le permitirán tener una mayor cantidad y variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, pra poder captar mas clientes y con ello subir sus ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Liseth Maribel is 25 years old, single and lives with her children in her parent’s home. Her family is supportive and kind. She lives in the Cayalti district which is a rural area where they make a living in agriculture, trade and cattle raising. It is located in the Chiclayo province which is part of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living selling general groceries and bread, rice, sugar, oil, sodas, etc. from her home. She is an entrepreneurial woman who exerts herself in the work she does. She has requested a 1,500 Nuevos Soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy as many groceries that will allow her to have the most quantity and variety of products to offer her customers and to be able to attract more customers. With this she can increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to grow her business with more quantity and variety of products.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is aged 57, married to a farmer, and blessed with four children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost fifteen years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their food expenses. 

Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase canned goods, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, chips, and beverages. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, chips, and beverages.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is aged 29, married to a farmer, and they're blessed with three children. She manages a recycling business in their village and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 weekly. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenses at home and school allowances of their children.

 Due to insufficient funds she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase used bottles, steel, scrap materials, and old newspapers to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase used bottles, steel, scrap materials, and old newspapers to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elnor

texts.en:
Ma. Elnor is 36 years old and married with one child in school.  Ma. Elnor works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. Ma. Elnor has been in this business for eight years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en:
Lieu, 55, is widowed and has a son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.  She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

Lieu started this business eight years ago. She sells sugar, toys, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. Lieu hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang, 38, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker at a local company. Trang earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

Trang started this business ten years ago. She sells sugar, toys, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. Trang hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to sell from her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough good fish to sell.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Hieu, 52 years old, is married and has three children. Her husband supports the family through the income he earns working for a local company. Hieu has run a general store, selling food, basic household goods and sanitation items, for 11 years. The family lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hieu intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy good quality products, such as foods and beverages, to sell from her general store. The additional capital  will enable her to increase her income from this business. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality products, such as foods and beverages, to sell  from her store.

loans.name: José Ulises

texts.es:
José de 25 años de edad, vive con su mamá, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a una escuela, por ser hijo primero sus padres lo mantuvieron solo trabajando, nos expresa que siempre le dijeron que de letras nadie comía que mejor se dedicara a trabajar, que dándose sin aprender lo necesario para su vida.

Él es comerciante de ganado, compra y vende, desde pequeño le gusto andar con el ganado de sus padres lo que lo hizo aprender a cuidarlos, donde nació también la inquietud por negociar con bovinos, ya tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse al negocio, también es agricultor, trabaja la tierra siembra pasto para su ganado en donde lo repasta lo engorda y luego lo vende, obteniendo así su fuente de ingreso principal. 

Tiene bueyes con carreta y arado con los que trabaja la tierra para sacar sus cultivos y pastos para los animales. En los terrenos que trabajo son de su mamá los cuales él administra, la distancia que le quedan de retirados es de dos kilómetros, el recorrido lo hace a pie o a caballo. Su horario de trabajo es de 6 am a 4 pm.  

El préstamo será utilizado para el negocio del ganado, ya que constantemente está necesitando capital de trabajo para poder seguir, está pensando en compra 5 terneros para engordarlos y posteriormente venderlos, y con esto obtener un ganancia, la necesidad satisfecha es el poder tener capital para poder trabajar.

Sus sueños a futuro son poder tener terrenos propios, para poco a poco irse haciendo de sus pertenencias e independizarse de sus padres, también cuando tenga la edad suficiente y la madures para hacer su propia familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 25 years old and lives with his mother. He did not have the opportunity to go to school. Because he was their first child, his parents kept him just working. He says that they always told him that no one puts food on the table by going to school, that he better make a living working. So he was left without learning what he needed to for his life. 

He is a livestock merchant. He buys and sells. From a young age, he liked to be around his parents' livestock, which taught him to take care of them, and it was also there that the desire to be a cattle trader was born in him. Now he has been making a living in the business for more than five years. He is also a farmer. He works the land, sewing grass for his cattle to graze in. He fattens them and then sells them, thus earning his main source of income.

He has oxen and a cart and plow with which he works the land to obtain his crops and pastures for his animals. The lands that he works belong to his mother, and he manages them. They are two kilometers away from him, a distance that he walks or rides a horse. His work schedule is from 6am to 4pm. 

The loan will be used for the livestock business, since it is constantly needing work capital to be able to continue. He is thinking of buying five calves to fatten and then sell, and with that have earnings. The need filled is that of being able to have capital to be able to work. His dreams for the future are to be able to have his own lands, in order to have his belongings and become independent from his parents little by little. Also, when he is old enough and mature enough, he dreams of having his own family.

loans.use: to buy five calves to fatten and later sell, and with that have earnings. The need filled is to be able to have capital to be able to work.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda was born in 1992. She is not married and lives with her parents in the south part of Tajikistan. She has  “golden hands.”  Mavluda sews national women’s clothes.  She has been busy with this business for some years. She services her clients in her house. She is going to buy a new sewing machine, because her sewing machine is broken and she needs a new one.  She is asking for a loan of 7,000 TJS to buy a sewing machine. In this way, she will develop her business and attract more clients. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en: Erdenebayar, 29 years old, lives with his aged parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a hospital on his own since 2004. At age 19, right after graduating from his high schol, he passed university education and began running small hospital together with his father. Now his father and mother have retired from work and get state pensions. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and loses its heat through windows and floors. Erdenebayar is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy vacuum-insulated windows and hardwood floors for the house’s renovation. After renovation, his parents can live in a comfortable and warm place and avoid potential illness. Most importantly, they will burn less coal for heating and thus release fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy vacuum-insulated windows and hardwood floors for a home renovation.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en: Agustin has a piggery business in Dipolog. He makes good sales every month that sufficiently provide for his family. Agustin joined  PMPC in 2013 and successfully repaid his previous loan. To purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins, he applied for a loan from PMPC. Agustin hopes to sustain his business and would like to be a dealer of pork at meat shops in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his moto-taxi, which is his working vehicle.

loans.name: Ana Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ana Fe works hard to support her family. She has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an Internet café. Ana Fe is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase gallons of gasoline to offer for sale.

Ana Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of gasoline to offer for sale.

loans.name: Sugey Lizbeth

texts.es:
Sugey tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con su hija de 9 meses en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Ella se dedicaba a la venta de accesorios para vehiculos. Solicita el crédito para la compra  accesorios para vehiculos con la finalidad de mejorar su negocio con variedad. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas y Guayaquil. Su meta es tener su casa propia y un carro. Su desafío es las enfermedades. En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte y a leer.
texts.en:
Sugey is 23 years old. Her marital status is single, and she lives with her 9-month-old daughter in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos Province.

She works selling accessories for vehicles. She is requesting the loan to buy vehicle accessories, with the aim of improving her business with a greater variety of products. She makes her purchases in Ventanas and in Guayaquil. Her goal is to have her own house and a car. Her challenge is illnesses. In her free time, she likes to play sports and read.

loans.use: to buy vehicle accessories to sell.

loans.name: Ernesto Alonso

texts.en:
Ernesto believes there is more to joining a gym than signing a contract and making monthly payments. He tells his clients they are not just a number, but a part of a fitness family.  At the age of 21, he is now the owner of Mayhem Fitness — a cross-training, CrossFit gym in El Paso, Texas. He prides himself on offering his clients affordable prices, a balanced fitness program and nutritional structure. 

“I have been working at fitness clubs since I was 14,” Ernesto said. “It has always been a dream of mine to open my own business and now that dream has become a reality.”

After being open for only three months, Mayhem Fitness has accumulated 100 members. Fitness assessments, customized diet plans based on body type and measurements, and a regimented training program are all a part of his fitness package.  

Mayhem Fitness is a gym that allows members to gain strength from each other, while offering a friendly, supportive environment. Ernesto shares that his clients are an inspiration to him every day. 

“We had clients who in the beginning were not able to finish four rounds of fitness and would need to stop half-way through the first round,” Ernesto said. “It is such an inspiration to see those same clients finish four rounds without hesitation."

He came to Accion Texas Inc. for a loan to purchase new gym equipment and to make improvements to his gym such as installing new shelves and racks to hang barbells, towels and other gym equipment. Ernesto is grateful for the opportunity to see his vision unfold and to watch as clients transform into healthier versions of themselves. 

“To see people change their lives all because of a vision I had makes me proud,” Ernesto said.

loans.use: to purchase new gym equipment to help make improvements to his gym.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
After a long career in the engineering industry, Lorenzo retired at the age of 65, and decided he wanted to take his work life in a different direction. For 10 years, the Korean War veteran has owned Mr. “C” Tours and Transportation service, located in New Orleans. 

The French Quarter, Metairie Cemetery and the Aubudon Zoo are just a few of the places that Mr. “C” Tours and Transportation will go. Lorenzo says he can take his passengers anywhere in the New Orleans area and give the history lesson of a lifetime.  

“I came to Louisiana when I was just 27 years old,” Lorenzo said. “I have learned a great deal about the history of this city, and boy, is there a lot to tell.”

Lorenzo’s day starts at 10 a.m. and ends at midnight. Throughout his workday, he is dropping off and picking up customers at the local airport and scheduling tours with passengers.

“The touring business is exciting, because you get to meet people from all over the world,” Lorenzo said.  

Lorenzo sought out Accion Texas Inc. to help pay for his auto insurance and vehicle maintenance costs.  

“Without Accion, I would not be able to continue running my business,” Lorenzo said. “All these years I have been opening the door for clients and someone finally came and opened the door for me. I am truly grateful.”

loans.use: to pay for auto insurance and vehicle maintenance costs to keep his vehicle running smoothly.

loans.name: Aedric R.

texts.en:
With over 20 years in the healthcare field, Aedric said he finds fulfillment in caring for seniors and the disabled. Just two months ago, he started his home health care business, Aramis Health Service. He started his career as a cardiac nurse and over the years, he developed an interest in in-home health care. 

“In-home health care is my calling,” Aedric said. “I want to give my clients the right to remain independent and in their homes.”

Aramis Health Service’s mission is to “defend the people’s right to stay at home” and to provide quality care while using cost-effective strategies to benefit his clients. 

 “The health care system is always changing and that can be challenging,” Aedric said. “It is heartbreaking to see the conditions that some people have to live in.”

Since opening in May, Aedric has employed two contract workers and has been working on obtaining a contract with the State to build clientele. He came to Accion Texas Inc. to help with payroll, office supplies, computer equipment, and advertising.  He is in the process of building his website and marketing his business.
 
“Meeting the needs of the community is very important to me and as I build my business, it’s important that our clients recognize our commitment to supporting them.”

loans.use: to pay for payroll and initial office setup costs such as office supplies, computer equipment and advertising.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep, 44, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two sons, a daughter and her husband. For the past seven years, Diep and her husband have earned money through their business selling beverages.

Diep would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of beverages. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy beverages to sell

loans.name: Karynchi

texts.ru: Карынчы 63 года, вдовец, отец 4 детей, по хозяйству помогает младший сын. Карынчы на пенсии, в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, полеводством и пчеловодством. Начав свою деятельность в 1992 году с 3,000 сом (KGS) на сегодня в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 2 теленка и 50 ящиков пчелосемей. Несмотря на свой возраст Карынчы полон сил и энергии развивать свой бизнес и заниматься любимым делом. Cегодня его ежемесячная прибыль составляет 4,000 сом (KGS), это катастрофически низкий доход и в целях расширения бизнеса, Карынчы обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец для увеличения выручки. Доходы от кредита Карынчы планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Karynchi is 63, widowed, and has four children. His youngest son helps him around the farm. He is retired and his main source of income comes from livestock, crops, and beekeeping. He started his farm in 1992 with 3,000 som (KGS) and currently has three cows, two calves, and 50 boxes of bee colonies. In spite of his age, Karynchi is full of strength and energy to develop his business and do the work he loves. He currently earns 4,000 som (KGS) per month, which is a disastrously low income. In order to expand his business Karynchi applied for a loan with the Bai-Tushum Bank in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) in order to buy calves and sheep to increase his income. He plans to use his profits to continue developing his business.

loans.use: To buy calves and sheep for fattening and resale in order to increase his income

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en:
Dieu is 60 years old and widowed with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.  Dieu runs a shop selling clothes to earn a living. 

She started her business  ten years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying more kinds of clothes to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of clothes to sell from her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil to sell.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana, who is 50 years old and a married woman, lives in small village, Rukhi. She has a school-aged daughter and a husband who is a builder and who is the only breadwinner in the family. Liana has secondary education but she was unable to find any stable job. Her husband's salary is hardly enough to meet all daily expenses and Liana decided to help him to attain financial stability. 

Liana requested a loan from MFO Credo and her application was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that gives people chance to start or re-start their own activities. So she plans to start a trading business with linens, clothing and other home products. Liana will purchase stock of products with the requested loan and will sell in her community door-to-door. She will be able to generate her own income and do her bit for the family's welfare. 

Liana and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders and will highly appreciate your help.

loans.use: To start selling linens,  clothing and other home products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cane juice to sell.

loans.name: Fadil

texts.en:
Fadil is 28 years old, married and has 2 children. He works in a kitchen for a public company but with low salary and his wife stays home to care for their children. With just the one income he was not able to fully support his family so he opened a small restaurant to supplement his income. 

In order to improve his business he is requesting a loan for the first time to change the tables and chairs. This loan will help him to improve the ambiance and atmosphere, helping him to gain more customers and then increase his income. His goal is to offer his children a better education and future. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To buy new tables and chairs for his restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different types of used clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for his shop

loans.name: Ngangnuni  Group

texts.en: Arishetu belongs to a group of women who for the past five years have been in the business of processing shea nuts into shea butter. She is a 45-year-old active working woman with nine children. Her group is called ‘Ngangnuni’ Women Association. In this group picture, Arishetu is the third person from the right as you face the group picture. She is married with nine children and lives in Nyong-Gumah, a village in northern part of Ghana. The solidarity group Arishetu belongs to had a dream of increasing production and later running a supermarket for the shea butter. Because of a lack of adequate funds the outlook was bleak but now it is rekindled by the coming of Kiva loans to their community. She is requesting a loan of GHS 5,400 to buy and process five bags of shea nuts into shea butter for the export market. Arishetu can then be able to make more profit, repay her loan and also help feed her family.

loans.use: to buy and process five bags of shea nuts into shea butter for the export market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Kpanmanga- Makayili Group

texts.en:
Alice is a hard-working woman, 41 years old, from Bimbilla, in the Northern part of Ghana. She is married and has seven children. She is the second person squatting and having the hand placed on the basin of milled local rice in their group picture. 

Alice is a member of an Agricultural produce processing group. They process local rice for the local market and shea butter for the export market. She has been doing the business over the last ten years. Their group is called ‘Kpanmanga- Makayili’ Women's Association. She makes good profits from the business because she and every member of her group have been trained by Grameen Ghana and SNV on how to process high-quality, premium shea nuts, shea butter, and local rice to sell.

Alice and the group have asked for a combined loan of GHS 15,400. Alice’s share of the loan will help her to pay for the cost of four bags of shea nuts and five bags of paddy rice for processing. By so doing, Alice would increase productivity and income and, hence, repay the loan and support her children’s educational and health needs.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of four bags of shea nuts and five bags of paddy rice.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La joven Noemí una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad en la zona  sur de Honduras junto a  sus  hijos. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas desde hace varios años, esto lo hace en su glorieta y lugares cercanos a su residencia.
Noemí necesita el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima para seguir realizando su actividad como plátanos verdes, repollo, yuca, papas, pollo, salsas, queso, aceite, etc. para surtir su negocio el cual le genera la mayor parte de sus ingresos y así mismo desea bríndales más  producto a sus clientes ya  que son bastantes y en este momento no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para satisfacerlos.
Noemí espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que su hijo tenga los estudios necesarios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio del  2014
texts.en:
Noemí, a very hardworking and responsible young person, lives in a community in the southern part of Honduras with her children. For several years, her business has been selling snacks. She does this in her plaza and other places near her residence.

To continue carrying out this activity, Noemí needs the loan to purchase more raw materials, like green plantains, cabbage, cassava, potatoes, chicken, sauces, cheese, oil, etc. This will stock her business, which generates the majority of her income. She would like to provide more products to her customers, as there are lots of them and currently she doesn't have the resources necessary to meet their needs. 

In the short term, Noemí hopes to grow her business so that she can continue supporting her family. She also hopes for her son to have the education necessary to have greater opportunity in life.


Choluteca, Honduras – July,  2014

loans.use: to buy green plantains, cabbage, cassava, potatoes, chicken, sauces, cheese, oil, etc., for her business

loans.name: Trang's Group

texts.en:
Trang is 50 years old and lives with her daughter and her husband. For the past nine years Trang has been running a food store selling meals to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a 4-member loan group whose members live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is the second from left wearing a red and black blouse. Each of the other group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities. 

Trang is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality rice and raw food to make meals for selling. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy rice and raw food to make meals to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect his home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: My

texts.en:
My is 42 years old and married. She has a daughter and she lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband run a food stall to sell meals to people in their community. They have done this activity for four years.

My intends to use her loan to buy new furniture and more kinds of food to sell from her stall.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and more kinds of food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Lecene

texts.en: Lecene has already taken out four loans to launch his clean energy retail business. He is selling his EarthSpark clean energy products on a rent-to-own basis in his community. After renting out the entire inventory, he bought clean energy products with his last loan and still has customers calling him with more orders. He is taking out a fifth loan to help meet the demand in his community for a source of renewable energy that will allow customers save money while helping the environment.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling bananas. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 59 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Julieta has been farming rice for 30 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, sand, wood, etc. to finish building his house. He will also use it to pay an assistant to help him with the work, which he will take part in as he is a mason worker.

loans.name: Ruthu

texts.en:
Ruthu is married and has nine children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

Ruthu has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Ruthu will use this loan to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Shura

texts.en:
Shura, 60 years old, lives in a small village in the Senaki district with her husband, son and his family. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 2 cows and a calf. Shura milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell locally. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize and nut trees. 

Shura is experienced in making enamel jewelry and she wants to open a workshop. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3,500 GEL. She will use the loan to open a workshop and will get orders to make enamel jewelry. Shura will sell the produced jewelry and increase the family income.

loans.use: to open an enamel workshop to produce jewelry

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 47 years old and is married. She has four daughters and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband run a general store. They started this business seven years ago.

She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products, such as food and beverages, to stock her store.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to restock her store

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana Rosa tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil soltera vive con su hija en su propia casa del Barrio urbanización nueva Mz 5 lt. 0020, en Cayalti, dicha comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de alfalfa, tambien tiene mototaxi que la alquila, desde hace varios años su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales como cuyes, patos y gallinas que le permitan ofrecerlo a un mayor precio, generando así mayores ingresos y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa is 56 years old, single, and lives with her daughter in her own home in a new district called Mz 5 lt. 0020 in Cayalti. This community makes a living in agriculture, trade and livestock. It is located in Chiclayo Province, in the Lambayeque area on the northern cost of Peru.

Juana Rosa works rearing animals and selling alfalfa. She also has a motortaxi which is rented to her. Her business has been located in the back part of her home for a number of years. She has requested a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy animals such as guinea pigs, ducks and chickens which she can get for a better price, thereby generating more income and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in buying alfalfa and animals in grow her business.

loans.name: Jormoh 2 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Jormoh 2 (Blessing 2), and are 10 hardworking women in the city of Accra. These members strive diligently to improve their lives and those of their family members by working very hard. They are into shoes, corn and cassava dough, onions, grocery, jewelry, slippers and corn.

Rita is one member of Jormoh, and she is a talented ground nut seller with a strong customer base. Rita's sacrifices and hard work are gradually ensuring the success of her business. 

She is applying for a loan because she wants to purchase more bags of ground nuts and sell to customers so that she can continue her work. Jormoh is a hardworking and tenacious woman who strives to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of ground nuts and

loans.name: José Cecilio

texts.es:
José de 42 años de edad, es reconocido en su cantón, como un hombre trabajador y honesto, en los estudios no pudo prepararse lo que él hubiese querido, ya que su familia no contaba con los recursos económicos necesarios, él tuvo que dedicarse a temprana edad a la vida laboral cultivando la tierra.  Actualmente,  está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos de estos dos estudian. Su señora realiza los quehaceres del hogar, además de apoyarle en las actividades agrícolas.

Tiene treinta años de trabajar la tierra cultivando maíz, frijol, arroz y maicillo, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padre y hermanos mayores,  se levanta a las 5:00 am a trabajar, termina sus labores a las 12:00 md., esto lo hace de lunes a sábado en las tardes trabaja en un pequeño huerto casero que tienen.

Debido a la irregularidad del invierno, este año habrán perdidas con los cultivos ya establecidos, por lo tanto,  José se está anticipando a lo que puede pasar y quiere tener otras alternativas, para ello comenzara a cultivar frijol para compensar la pérdida de los cultivos de maíz que ya sufrieron la sequía. Por eso solicita el crédito para comprar semilla de frijol, pesticidas, herbicidas y mano de obra.


Su principal sueño es poder tener una casa con condiciones dignas para su  familia, con la que cuentan en la actualidad es de bahareque y  está deteriorada, por lo cual sufren en la época de invierno por las lluvias.
texts.en:
Jose is 42 years old and is known in the group of houses where he lives as an honest and hardworking man. He was not able to go to school as he would have liked to because his family did not have the necessary economic resources. From a young age, he had to work, farming the land. Currently, he has a partner and four children, two of whom are in school. His wife does the household chores and supports him in the agricultural work.

For thirty years he has been working the land, growing corn, beans, rice, and sorghum. He learned this work from his father and older brothers. He gets up at 5am to work and finishes work at 12 noon. He does this Monday through Saturday. In the afternoons, he works a small home garden that they have. 

Because winter is erratic, this year there will be losses with the established crops. So Jose is anticipating what could happen and wants to have other alternatives. That is why he will be begin to grow beans, to make up for the loss of corn crops, which have already suffered because of the drought. 

For that he is requesting the loan to buy bean seeds, pesticide, weedkiller, and labor. His main dream is to be able to have a house worthy of his family. The one that they have currently is made of adobe and is dilapidated, so they suffer during the winter because of rains.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, pesticide, weedkiller, and labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon equipment to make the place more attractive to people.

loans.name: Wilmer Alfonso

texts.es:
Wilmer Alfonso tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su conyuge con un hijo de 3 años, conyuge se dedica a labores domesticas, vive en una comunidad ubicada a 42 Km de chiclyo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales(patos), desde hace 3 años en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para invertir en el arreglo de su casa, ya que desea construir una habitacion la cual le dara mayor comodidad a su familia, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wilmer Alfonso is 24 years of age and lives with his wife and three year old son. His wife tends to the domestic tasks. Wilmer lives in a community which is 42km from the province of Chiclayo and part of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The people in his community work in agriculture, business and farming.  

Wilmer has raised and sold animals (ducks) from home for three years. He has requested a loan of 2500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to pay for home repairs. He would like to build a room to give his family greater comfort and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a room in his house

loans.name: Blue Group

texts.en:
Blue Group is a group of two businesswomen who are joined together for the sake of searching for financial support. Currently, the group is performing better and looks as if they will get more support to make great changes to their businesses. 

Mwanahawa is one of the group members who is carrying the group profile. She is a businesswoman who is in her early forties, married, and a proud mother of two school age daughters. Since 2000, she has been supporting her family with a mamalishe business, a business commonly used by middle/low class people. Her customers are happy because she knows how to make them feel better by cooking nice and delicious food. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to realize a good profit. 

She is requesting her fourteenth loan via Kiva partner's Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous credit repaid successfully, she bought a fridge to sells cold soft drinks and cooking ingredients like rice, cooking oil, maize, baking flour, vegetables etc.  Mwanahawa received an extra income, which she used to buy a digital deck and covered part of the school fees and household expenses. She dreams of becoming a woman of more businesses. She will use her loan to replace old business chairs and tables with new ones. Mwanahawa will share this loan with her group member and together they will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replace old business chairs and tables with new ones.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nida works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Nida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish for her dried fish business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa est un jeune qui s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. Il gère une boutique de vente de denrées alimentaires et produits domestiques. Moussa est un habitué des crédits à l’IMCEC, il en est à son cinquième crédit, qui lui permettra d’acheter du thé, du lait, de l’huile, du sucre pour stocker et revendre. Moussa habite avec ses parents et ses frères et ils se partagent la dépense quotidienne. Il y a aussi son épouse qui l’appui dans les autres charges de leur foyer.
Dans l’avenir, il aimerait ouvrir un grand magasin et devenir un grossiste.
texts.en:
Moussa is a young man who has been actively involved in retail for over five years.  He is married and the father of a family.   He runs a shop which sells food products and household items.  Moussa is a regular client of the UIMCEC and this is his fifth loan with the institution.  This loan will allow him to buy tea, milk, oil and sugar to stock his shop and resell.  Moussa lives with his parents and his brothers with whom he shares the daily expenses.  His wife also helps him with the other expenses of the household.

In the future, he would like to open a larger store and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy food supplies such as tea, milk, oil, sugar and coffee to stock his shop and resell.

loans.name: Tiessiri 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Tièssiri 3 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 26 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Siradjankoro, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil, de haricot, de fonio et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, des semences, des intrants agricoles et de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame   Alimata   (la 1ère  femme debout de la  gauche vers la droite   dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Siradjankoro. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles, des petits équipements dans le village de Siradjankoro et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants, et une partie pour aider son mari pour le bien être de leur  famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Tiessiri 3 group are all married and living in traditional families. They average 26 years of age with two children each, and all live in the village of Siradjankoro in the Ségou region (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through their winter farming activities, as neighbors, and through marriage and relatives in the village. They grow groundnut, millet, beans, fonio and rice. With a view to buying small materials, seeds, agricultural inputs and to paying for labor for the hoeing of the fields, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third seasonal loan.

Alimata (who is standing on the far left of the photo) has a large winter farming activity in the village of Siradjankoro, and she is planning to use her loan to buy seeds, agricultural inputs and small materials in the village, as well as to pay youths to hoe her field. She sells her farming produce for cash at the end of the winter season, so that she can repay her loan and have enough income to provide for her own needs as well as her childrens'; part of the income is used to help her husband ensure the family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy small materials, seeds and agricultural inputs, as well as to pay for labor for the hoeing of the fields.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 23 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past two years, Betty has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh food and charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh food and more sacks of charcoal for sale, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and save money and build a house. Betty hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh food and more sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ana Nidia

texts.es:
La señora Ana es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de perfumería y cosméticos, desde hace 5 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y diversos lugares aledaños. 
Doña Ana necesita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería como perfumes, lociones, cremas, polvos, lis tic, glasé, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Doña Ana espera que sus ventas aumenten considerablemente y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los perfumes y cosméticos  necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Doña Ana espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio  del  2014
texts.en:
Ana is a very hardworking and responsible person. She lives with her family in a community in southern Honduras. For the last five years, her business has been perfume and cosmetics sales, which she does from her home in the municipality where she lives and in several neighboring areas. 

Ana needs the loan to purchase more merchandise like perfume, lotion, cream, powder, lipstick, gloss, etc. in order to continue doing her work, which makes up a large part of her income. Ana hopes to significantly increase her sales and for that to be of great help to her because she does not have enough perfume and cosmetics to satisfy the orders made each day by her clients. With this she hopes to be able to improve the family's quality of life, increasing the household income. 

In a short period of time, Ana hopes to grow her business and thus be able to continue supporting her family, and she hopes that her children will have the education necessary to be able to have better opportunities in life. Choluteca, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to purchase perfume, lotion, cream, powder, lipstick, gloss, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Keliam (1) Group

texts.en:
Jean is the father of four and a natural leader. He is an officer for the community bank group KELIAM (1) and leads a subgroup of 13 micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo.

In order to help support his family, Jean has continuously moved forward with various business ventures. Over 10 years ago he started his own small medical stand selling bandages and various over-the-counter medications. In recent years, to supplement his income and keep his children in school, Jean has branched out into selling manioc, a traditional Congolese food staple eaten with most meals, in bulk. Most recently he has also started to raise and sell chickens.

Jean joined his community bank group with HOPE Congo in 2012, and is currently on his 6th loan cycle. Hoping to grow his chicken business and open a second shop, Jean would like to take out a loan of 200,000 CFA. In addition to his wife and four children, Jean also supports his mother and four nephews. In the future, Jean hopes his children will be able to finish their studies well and continue to more forward in life.

loans.use: to invest in his chicken business by purchasing more chickens

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 48 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice seeds for her farm. She has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice seeds for her farm

loans.name: White 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Jean is an experienced father. With six children of his own, plus two nephews, Jean has his hands full. In order to support his family, Jean owns and runs a small butcher’s shop and a drink stand in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Jean recently joined a community bank group called WHITE 2 (1) with HOPE Congo. As the leader of a subgroup of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, Jean would like to take out a small loan of 250,000 CFA to invest in his businesses.

With this money Jean will be able to purchase additional soda and juices, as well as various meats such as pork, beef and chicken. In the future, Jean hopes to branch out to other businesses such as building homes and selling manioc (a local Congolese food staple made from cassava root). He hopes that through creating a stable income, his family will continue to live well and that he will have something to leave his children.

loans.use: to purchase additional soda and juices, as well as various meats such as pork, beef and chicken.

loans.name: Elidia

texts.es:
Elidia tiene 71 años de edad, vive con su conviviente quien percibe ingresos como agricultor, con hijos ya independientes, personas con buenas referencias, de familia unida, vive en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Elidia es la crianza y venta de animales, como patos, gallinas y pollos, desde hace 5 años en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos para engorde de los mismo que le permita ofrecerlo a un mejor precio en los restaurants de su distrito, y a la vez mejorar su mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elidia is 71 years of age and lives with her partner who makes a living as a farmer. Her children are independent and are well regarded as good people from a close family. Elidia lives in a big community in the urban area of Cayalti, a province of Chiclayo which is part of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The people of this community work in farming, business and cattle raising.  

Elidia has raised and sold animals such as ducks, hens and chickens from home for five years. She has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy feed to fatten up her animals. This way she can offer the animals to the restaurants of her district at a higher price and in so doing improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to improve the structure of her home

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Savet is 40 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Phnom Penh suburb. She has been married since 2000 and has one son who attends school.  

Savet and her husband sell bananas and flowers. When he is free, her husband is also a motor taxi driver. Savet needs her husband to buy bananas and flowers from their fellow villager and then transport them to sell in the Penh market by their own motorcycle. But, their motorbike is getting old and does not work well. Facing this, Savet asked for a loan to buy a new motorcycle and she will use a rest of the loan to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle and repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 47 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks and other beverages.

In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. Gorgonia earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

Gorgonia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as fish, canned goods, vegetables, and spices for her restaurant business.

Gorgonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as fish, canned goods, vegetables, and spices.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

Nyamvula has operated a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for resale.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 21 years old, single, and works hard to help her parents. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish, meat, and spices for her restaurant business.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish, meat, and spices for her business.

loans.name: Amadas De Taulabe Group

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene cinco hijos y reside en una aldea del Municipio de Taulabe. Hace 10 años que ella integra un grupo que se llama Amadas de Taulabe, su negocio a sido la prestación de servicios de lavado de vehículos de todo tipo, pesado y livianos, esta actividad la realiza con sus hijos y lo tiene a orilla de la calle donde tiene un puesto o parqueo para lavar los vehículos. Ella ha solicitado 12 ciclos de prestamos con el actual que es por 10,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar materiales como ser jabón, pastes, telas, líquidos, desodorantes para uso en el lavado de vehículos. Tiene como plan mejorar el lugar de aparcamiento de vehículos para brindar mejor servicio y también mejorar su vivienda. 
Este grupo lo integran dos personas, doña María que en la foto se encuentra a la izquierda y Juana que esta a la derecha, las dos viven en la misma comunidad y tiene el mismo tiempo de trabajar juntas en el mismo negocio. El préstamo grupal es por 23,000 lempiras que lo utilizaran para comprar materiales y herramientas como es el jabón, líquidos, telas, desodorantes, pastes, y otras herramientas que necesitan.
texts.en:
María, 59, is a single mother. She has five children and lives in a village in the municipality of Taulabe. She has been a member of this group, called “Amadas de Taulabe” for ten years. She works washing all kinds of vehicles, light- and heavy-weight, helped by her children. Her car wash is located by the road, where there is available space for parking the vehicles.

She has requested twelve loans, including this one. She is requesting 10,000 Lempiras [HNL] to buy supplies such as soap, sponges, towels, washing liquids and air fresheners. Her plan is to improve the parking lot in order to better serve her clients and also to make some home improvements.

This group is comprised of two persons: María (left) and Juana (right). They both live in the same community and started working at the same time with this activity.

The group is requesting 23,000 Lempiras [HNL] in total. They will use the money to buy supplies such as soap, washing liquids, towels, air fresheners and other tools they need.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as soap, sponges, towels and air fresheners for her car wash.

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Liduvina tiene 57 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con su esposo e hijos en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Liduvina es la crianza y venta de animales, como patos, gallinas, cuyes y pollos, desde hace 10 años en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de animales de corral para su posterior reventa, asi como también alimentos para engorde de los mismos que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Liduvina is 57 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in their own home. They live in a large community in the urban area of Cayaltí, and have good personal and work references from their neighbors. People who live there farm, engage in commerce and raise livestock. The community is located in Chiclayo province, which is part of the Lambayeque region on Peru's north coast.

Liduvina has been raising and selling animals at her own home for 10 years, such as ducks, guinea pigs and chickens.

She has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a greater quantity and variety of farmyard animals for subsequent sale, as well as feed for fattening them. This will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of farmyard animals for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Severino

texts.en: Severino is 57 years old, married, and has 13 children. Despite the large number of his family, he still ensures to sustain them. Severino provides jeepney transport services within the village and nearby villages too. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 21,000 to use in his business. He will buy gasoline and oil to use for the maintenance of the jeepney. This will help provide safe travel to all his passengers. He will save additional revenue for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and oil to use for maintenance of his jeepney.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina lives at San Roque. She operates a junkshop business and buys metal, plastic jars, and bottles. She sells them to larger junk shops for profits. 

She uses her bicycle to  travel to nearby villages to buy there, also.  She manages her business to gain enough income for her family. 

She requests 15,000 PHP to buy empty cans, jars and bottles. This will help her  to increase her profits and save money to use in the future. Eventually, she will close her business because she is getting weak and old.

loans.use: to buy empty cans, jars and bottles to re-sell.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
José de 42 años de edad, es un hombre emprendedor, a pesar de que solo pudo estudiar hasta 6° grado de educación básica, a podido aprovechar capacitaciones sobre apicultura, y hoy en día es la actividad productiva que le genera recursos para su familia. 

Está casado y su esposa realiza los oficios del hogar, además de involucrase en el manejo de colmenas. De sus cinco hijos,  3 estudian y dos trabajan con él.

Desde hace veinte años comenzó a capacitarse sobre apicultura (crianza y manejo de abejas) aprovechando proyectos comunitarios, anteriormente se dedicaba de lleno en la agricultura, pero no le era tan rentable como lo es la comercialización de enjambres y miel. Hoy cuenta con 200 colmenas, este es un negocio familiar.

El préstamo lo necesita para la reproducción de enjambres (multiplicar colmenas),  para esto tiene que comprar madera, marcos y azúcar para la alimentación de las abejas. Además quiere sustituir trajes y equipo de cosecha de miel, que se encuentran en mal estado. En este momento no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para invertir, por ello, ha decidido solicitar el crédito.
 

Su  principal sueño es que sus hijos se sigan preparando academicamente,  hasta culminar una carrera profesional, para ello tienen que hacer que crezca el negocio apícola para costearse sus gastos de estudio.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old and in an enterprising man. Despite the fact that he was only able to study until the 6th grade at primary school, he has been able to attend training on beekeeping, and today, that is the activity which earns money for his family.

José is married and his wife is a housewife, in addition to helping out with the hives. Three of his five children study, and two work with him.

Twenty years ago, he began learning about apiculture (bee rearing and keeping), taking advantage of community projects. He previously worked in agriculture, but it wasn't as profitable as selling swarms and honey. Today, he has 200 hives in his family business.

He needs the loan to create more bee swarms (increase hives), for which he needs to buy wood, frames and sugar to feed the bees. He also wants to replace his suit and honey harvesting equipment, which are in poor condition. He doesn't have enough money for this at the moment, which is why he is requesting the loan.
 
His biggest dream is for his children to continue studying, until they get a professional career. For this, they need to grow their beekeeping business to afford their study costs.

loans.use: to create more bee swarms (increase hives), for which he needs to buy wood, frames and sugar to feed the bees. He also wants to replace his suit and honey harvesting equipment, which are in poor condition. He doesn't have enough money for this at the moment, which is why he is requesting the loan.

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Samon  lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She is a widow with two children. One child is a garment factory worker and the other attends school.  

Samon sells grocery items from home. She hopes to buy additional grocery items for resale to earn extra income. Hence she deiced to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To buy  grocery items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Oruc

texts.en:
Oruc is a 43-year-old married man with two children . Oruc is an Internally Displaced Person. 

He has grown  fruits and vegetables for ten years. His father taught him how to raise crops. Oruc sells his crops in the central market. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes (pilau and dolma) are vegetable-based. Fresh fruits are popular for every meal.

Oruc would like to increase the number of products he sells and he has applied 500 AZN. He will use the loan to purchase seedsand fertilizer. He has a positive loan history and this will be his 5th loan.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a 58-year-old married woman with  six children.  They lived at Enrile. 

She manages a bibingka-selling (rice cake) business to earn income for family. She increased her production and sells to school canteens and accepts order for special occasions such as birthday parties. She hopes to continue to improve her business.  Lita would like additional capital to buy more ingredients to make her products more delectable. 

She requests 20,000 PHP to buy cooking oil, sugar, coconut, and glutinous rice. 

Someday, with continuous diligence in the business, she will be  successful.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, coconut, and glutinous rice to cook and sell.

loans.name: Ma. Petronila

texts.en:
Ma.Petronila lives at Enrile with her children. She uses her skills to sew and sell uniforms, dresses, curtains and pillow cases. She earns a monthly salary of 5,000 PHP. 

She uses the income to make meals, pay household bills,  and invest in her business. She is  asks for 6,000 PHP to buy items to help her  to produce a better quality product such as fabric, machine oil, and thread.

Ma. Petronila will continue to make good quality items and improve her sewing services. She hopes to earn additional income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, machine oil, and thread use in sewing.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 53-year-old widower with three children. 

Marites sells ukay-ukay(used clothes) and AVON products such as perfume, soap and cosmetics. She has a monthly income of 15,000 PHP. She uses the income to pay  for the family's daily meals, electric bills and reinvest in the business. 

Marites asks for 28,000 PHP to buy used clothes, bags, shampoo, accessories and perfumes. Additional items to sell will increase her income as well as her profits. She hopes to save money for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes, bags, shampoo, accessories and perfume.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 26 years old and lives in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has one young son.  

Sina is a garment factory worker and her husband works with his wife. The couple commutes to work by driving their own motorbike. However,  the motorbike is old and does not work well. 

Hence Sina decided to apply for a loan in order to buy new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur is a 33-year-old married man with a 10-year-old child.  The child attends the  fourth class of secondary school. 

Seymur lives with his wife and child in the village of Seyidahmadli in the Fuzuli region but he has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person ) from Füzuli for 21 years.   His home is located near the war zone and it is  difficult to live there. 

Seymur has raised cows for 6 years to sell in the local bazaar. He wants to buy three calves and needs 1200 AZN.  He has applied to Komak  for a loan. 

He thanks the  Kiva organization for their help and support. In the future, he wishes to develop the industry, increase the income and give his child a good education.

loans.use: to purchase three calves.

loans.name: Selenge

texts.en:
Selenge, 37 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has taught math teacher and accounting at the high school since 2005. 

She used a previous loan to  renovate her house and create a comfortable place for the family. She requests another loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase and install insulated windows in her house.  The insulated windows will reduce heat loss and enable the family to burn less coal for heating. Reduced coal usage means less air pollution.

loans.use: to install insulated windows to protect against dust, noise and energy waste.
